reviews.text: They convinced me to buy extra insurance and breakdown cover and guess what, i needed it as the car was not in a good state. Called the emergency number provoded. "If you experience a breakdown please ring the number on the windscreen"... well, guess what, there's no number on the windscreen.

Avoid at all cost !!!!!
Big moving day even bigger let down.
Hired a van with Europcar Hull received nothing but confirmation emails and even a speed up our check in email.
But turned up on the day and they had cancelled everything with no correspondence letting us no in advance so we can sort something else out to aid us with big our move. This Caused nothing but stress would never recommend to anyone EVER !!!

Guy at the desk apologised and said they have nothing available however 5/6 vans were parked outside not been used.

Soooooo disappointed so not use Europcar
üí©üí©üí©üí©

I just wanted to give a big shout out to Charlie and Jack at Europcar in Stansted for all their help and support in getting my car rental sorted out. You guys are amazing. the office at stansted have always provided a wonderful service this time was exemplary many thanks again in advance.

Terrible Experience ‚Äì Avoid Europcar Porto

I rented an electric vehicle from Europcar Porto, but when I arrived to collect it, I was told I needed to use a third-party app and have a Portuguese debit card ‚Äì something that was never mentioned during the booking process. Since I didn‚Äôt have that, I was essentially forced into ‚Äúupgrading‚Äù to a more expensive vehicle.

To make matters worse, they added taxes I had already paid and pushed an unnecessary insurance upgrade. The replacement vehicle was dirty, and the tire pressure system was faulty, clearly showing poor maintenance.

After I returned the vehicle, they even attempted to charge my card again without authorization.

Overall, this felt like a scam from start to finish. I won‚Äôt be using Europcar again ‚Äì especially not at this location. Be warned.

The worst customer experience I have ever dealt with. Disputing a charge for a ¬£80 no pick up fee.... despite me going to the branch. The branch said I never showed up. Person on the phone saying "there's nothing I can do". Shameful and disgusting. 1 mont, 2 emails, and 3 phone calls, what should have been a simple refund has still not been sorted

I was charged ¬£709 for a lacquer scratch that could not be even felt by touch. This would have easily buffed out.
Absolutely unjust charge amount completely disproportionate to the damage caused. Absolutely terrible experience.

Worst customer experience of my life! AVOID. Was told I would have a delivery at 9 in the morning and was even told the driver was 14 minutes away and now when I‚Äôm calling they saying I have no reservation number and the car hasn‚Äôt even left the building ! I‚Äôm absolutely fuming. Every time I call they tell me what the last person said is incorrect!! I‚Äôm heavily pregnant also due in three weeks and they do not care. Please if you can , find another company to hire a car from!!!

Most disgusting company stansted manager was so rude. They was giving me new Mercedes after I said I want to pay with debit card he said no. It‚Äôs luxury car lol Mercedes c is luxury car and they was offered me Toyota yaris. When I give my credit card they try to give me so old Mercedes key was scratched every corner and he was offering me this. Waste of money go other companies they are more respectful I hate this guy I will never come this company I was paid last month this company 3.000¬£ for 1 month rent and they lost me now

Hands down the worse customer service experience I have ever had, lack of humanity and care. I used my digital card to make a booking online, not knowing i needed to present a physical card in branch, I‚Äôve been told I can‚Äôt get a refund as the package is non refundable, it was a honest mistake and should be looked at as such. Complete scam. Avoid Europcar if you want better customer care please go elsewhere!
Totally rubbish telling you no delivery till tomorrow or you can collect. Totally unacceptable behaviour to a disabled person

I had a great rental experience with Europcar last week and it was all because of Tami at the Heathrow pick up desk on the N Perimeter Rd at Heathrow. Efficient, polite and helpful all through the pick up process he's a credit to the company. The car was clean, in great condition and drop off was super efficient a couple of days later. Very good experience. Thank you!

Europcar took 3 payments out of wife's bank account twice for identical sums of money. She is still waiting for a refund and being fed a load of lies from Europcar even with them having accepted liability for the error and told her that the money was released 2 weeks ago. Its now a month since it happened. On top of this, the car has been returned and their pre authorisations have not been released and the deposit has not been returned.
Their continued moving of timelines and this behavior has to be illegal as I do not understand how they can simply take money out of a bank account when the customer has not authorised it. Tesco can't do that with shopping.

The booking.com website led me to Keddy by Europcar at Valencia airport in July with the promise of "no queues" but I had to wait more than 30 minutes to collect on arrival. I reserved a "T-Roc or similar" and tried to pre-empt me not getting "or similar" by contacting Europcar (Madrid) in advance. They responded with a "we cannot promise anything" and indeed when I arrived was given a Hyundai Tucson covered in scratches with a flogged engine 65k on the clock. Europcar then pre-authorised 800 Euros on my credit card in case of collision even though I had paid an extra 70 pounds to booking.com for full additional insurance (excess insurance). I hated the Hyundai Tucson. The safety features were infuriating with the parking brake auto-hold not having a light on the console and the locked patrol cap. The staff were very polite at Europcar Valencia airport but the experience was a let-down. One week after returning the car I noticed a further charge from Europcar on my credit card. When I contacted them they said it was an "environmental contribution" charged to me in error when it should have been charged to the intermediary (i.e. booking.com). Long story short I would avoid using either Europcar or booking.com for a car rental in the future.
Scam, not only did they take additional money for insurance, they kept my deposit saying I scratched the car.

Avoid

I rented a car for a month in June 2025. The collection was smooth although, while the car had been washed, it had not been wiped dry and so was covered with water marks. I inspected the car reasonably thoroughly and could not see any damage.

On returning the car the member of staff immediately identified what she claimed was damage but to my mind was a mark on the rear bumper that was hardly visible and not possible to see without wiping away the water marks. Nevertheless, the staff member required me to sign the Statement of Return acknowledging the damage. She told me that is it was the only way I would get my deposit back and also implied that the damage would be assessed by an expert and would probably not be an issue. As I was in a hurry to catch my flight I signed document.

Unbelievable experience with this awful company and the partner companies I have had to deal with.
Booked a Citroen C3 fuel car for 12 days in Tolouse in late July. (almost ¬£300 total) . I used the GOTrentalcars website to book the car from Europcar.

My Ryanair flight was late so I got to the Europcar at 12.30am. They did not have the Citroen C3. They insisted I had booked an electric car of the lowest category. ( Major Red Flag) I insisted I hadn't because I deliberately excluded electric cars when booking. The electric car they wanted to give me could only drive for 1 hour before needing charging. I would never have willingly booked this.

They only had 1 fuel car to offer me but it was going to cost an extra ¬£60 PER DAY!!! I was absolutely stuck, I had a young child with me and it was 1am on a saturday night, I had to drive for 1.5 hours to get to our accomodation. I was forced to get the fuel car at ¬£60 extra per day but they said I could try and explain the next day and change it. All day Sunday and Monday was ruined because I was trying to sort out the situation on the phone and eventually just had to go back to return the car and try to get refunded for the 10 days. But they still have not refunded me. ( RED FLAG - staff directly lied to me)
However the Europcar staff at Toulouse airport were completely UNHELPFUL and RUDE. RED FLAG. I had an argument with them in the Toulouse airport. I parked the car near their returns office and went away for an hour.

When I came back to return the car, they said there was a dimple on the rear door. RED FLAG! I KNOW that I hadn't ever touched this door or seen the dimple when I checked the car over. I think they did it out of malice for my complaining. I asked to check cctv but there wasnt any. They forced me to sign a thing saying I had created the dimple. I definitely did not. It is so small that I took a close-up photo and you still can't see it. They have taken ¬£800 out of my bank account. They have not even refunded me 10 days' worth of ¬£ that I had paid.

Every staff member that I spoke to from GOTrental cars and Europcar says I signed the contract in the first place for the car. I keep saying I was FORCED to sign it because I was stuck in the middle of the night with a child and they did not have the car I had booked. I am being totally GASLIT by these theiving, tricking, fraudulent blatant liars, and they now owe me ¬£1200 plus 2 days of my holiday plus petrol and toll money to return the wrong car.

THEY WILL NOT GET AWAY WITH THIS.

After using this company for car rentals quite often over a few years, I thought I'd grown to trust them as one of the better car rental companies that weren't out to scam you at every possible opportunity.

Unfortunately, I was proven wrong when I was handed a cleaning fee for having some dirt, from a shoe, in the footwell of the car. This was deemed excessive and upon querying the matter, I was told this would require 'expert third party cleaners ' and 'the cleaning of a interior specialist'.

Direct quotes, yet evidence of this was never produced and I was ignored for over a month before receiving a dismissive email saying they will not be replying any more.

If only photos were allowed on this platform to show how little dirt was apparently deemed to be excessive. I have since moved to using other car rental companies, as this lack of customer service for a long-standing customer, or anyone, is just not good enough.

I will be reporting them to the British Vehicle Rental and Leasing Association for breaching their code of conduct in their handling of this matter.

I booked a hire car and paid for it using my Monzo card, got a train to Gatwick Airport and brough this card with me like the booking confirmation said to. I hired another vehicle with Europcar earlier this year and had no problems paying the deposit using this card.

Got to the branch to be told by staff that they don't accept Monzo so I couldn't hire the car. Nobody could explain why this was their policy, only that they had to cancel the booking.

I offered to make a full payment for the deposit amount which could be refunded when I returned the car, but the staff weren't having it either. I spoke to the branch manager, who could only tell me that they didn't accept Monzo and I'd have to cancel my booking.

This policy seems to be based on the understanding that Monzo cards aren't "real debit cards", which doesn't seem to be true.

In the end, I had to ask my friend to travel to the branch with another card, and Europcar refuse to cover the costs of this even though (1) they literally told me to bring the card I used to pay for the booking and (2) their terms say they accept debit cards.

Europcar's customer service have just ignored my attempts to get them to refund me for these costs, or to at least explain their policy. Useless.

If anyone from Europcar reads this, my case number is 23955880.

I‚Äôm very disappointed with this group
I got a lawyers letter through this morning which I have been asked to pay for damage to the car I hired from the 29/05/2025 to the 02/06/2025.i never got anything back from them regarding this and as far I knew everything was ok.
I since tried to call the lawyers and was on the phone for 1.5 hours to get someone. I gave up on that and called the head office of Europcar to discuss the matter. The woman name was lynne who insisted that they had sent a email for recovery of damage. I then checked my junk mail and found 2 emails from Europcar. One was the invoice from them on the 04/06/2025 saying the car was ok and the deposit would be returned
Which it was by Europcar.

Then on the the 23/06/2025 I have another email regarding the damage to the car ( which was a flat tyre and I picture of the tyre with the nail in it.
3 weeks after the so called nail was in the tyre they contact me to inform me that I must of done it and they were going to charge me for the time it was off the road a new tyre and admin fees of 251.64. Something I did not know about til now.
I know I checked the car out and it did not have a puncture as I checked all aspects at of it with a friend who assisted me in the process. At no point was the car damaged or anything wrong with it.
How can this company say the car was ok and issue an invoice on the 4th June 2025 and then 3 weeks later decide that the car had a puncture and decide to send me a bill.
They must of done this when driving the car round the car park or someone else who hired it and the only person they could blame was the last person who drove it. This is wrong on all levels and I will contest it as it looks like they are blaming anyone they can. Absolute disgrace from Europcar and as a company I used to use regularly I won‚Äôt be using again and I will tell anyone who is using this company do not use them as they are not true to there words of being a good company who cares about the drivers.
I received a request for payment for damage present when I RECEIVED the vehicle. Europcar are continuing to pursue the payment. I have photographic evidence with date stamps on the photographs.

Crooks!
They told me at the rental desk that I could bring the fuel tank back at any level and they would fill it up at cost price for no extra charge.
2 days after I had returned the car with 7/8 full tank, they charged me ¬£67!!
No responses to emails sent to complain, and unable to do anything on the phone.
DO NOT USE EUROPCAR

Daylight Robbery. Had to cancel my booking from Inverness Airport branch as my flight was cancelled . I foolishly hadn't checked every square millimetre of the website to find the 'refundable booking' button when I made the reservation so got charged the full value of the booking (¬£748.00) which included all the insurance waivers, extra driver even though clearly never used, surprised they didn't charge me for some fuel as well! In the end, we had to hire a car in Huntingdon and drive up to Scotland, and as Europcar had said they would refund me the full amount and didn't have a branch in Huntingdon, we used Enterprise - brilliant service, better car and cost ¬£50 less anyway despite being a one-way hire with unlimited mileage. Will never use Europcar, ever.

Scammers, extremely shady outfit.

I picked up my car in Johannesburg and they tried to give me a car without a damage report, telling me ‚Äúit will be fine‚Äù.

Upon checking the car it had clearly been in some form of accident. It took an hour of refusing to take the car without damage report for them to finally say they would bring me a new car at my address later, but that I should take this one for now (I assume they then would have said the car was damaged by in the time between me taking it and them brining the new one).

Travelling with a newborn, this was stressful and they eventually brought me a new car with a damage report and assured me that I had the maximum insurance. Unfortunately this was not the case as I was hit by a driver running a red light and Europcar took ¬£2000 from me.

Be careful, these guys are extremely shady.
I‚Äôm renting with them regular for few months and today I can‚Äôt rented because my credit score filed,rubbish company and very expensive I didn‚Äôt recommend ‚Ä¶!

Worst rental company in world
We book a car and hotel every thing
And when we went to collect the car they said we don‚Äôt have any car
We only have 8 car that booked for others
And even they didn‚Äôt offer any replacement car in other branch‚Äôs
When called cuz service they said if you pay ¬£40 extra we can book you a car in another branch

Classic case of should have read this before we booked.
Complete shambles from start to finish.
Tried to add a booster seatto our booking, which wasn't possible. Tried to reach customer service which was impossible.
When we collected the car, they wanted 100‚Ç¨ for a booster seat. Even in Switzerland it costs about 15‚Ç¨ to buy one (which we did!).
They then told us we needed a Vignette to drive in Switzerland (another 40 CHF). When we tried to buy one online it transpired the car already had one (of course it did, they are valid for a year). The police confirmed when we asked.
Why oh why would you make your customers' lives more difficult?
Terrible terrible service, and I will not use them ever again.

I've never had a more stressful few days, that ended up costing me an absolute fortune!!
I originally booked yesterday (thur 14/08/25) to have a car delivered to my home address. When I went to review it, the booking was the wrong time and said it would be delivered to my local branch... so I tried to amend it online, but their website is rubbish to navigate through. I called up, and when I finally got through, managed to confirm that I would have the car delivered to my home address and changed the time. The guy said it would be an extra ¬£30 foe the ammendment. Reluctantly, I paid it, asking that it would only be for the extra and not for the full amount, to which he confirmed that was the case.
However, they did take the full amount, PLUS the extra ¬£30, so I ended up paying twice as much.. nearly ¬£700. This put me overdrawn! I called to complain and they sent an email stating I would be refunded.
I spent an anxious night worrying if I would have to go into the city to pick up this car, as I was still jnsurenit would be delivered to me.

This morning I get a call to confirm it all so that out my mind at ease. Then he asked if I would like to pay a bit extra teo avoid the extortionate excess charge. Worried that anything could happen, I agreed to pay it.via a credit card. I had to pay ¬£180, then I would pay the deposit on that card qhen the car arrived.
I then got a call to day their system can't process the payment and it had to be via the original card.
So, with the deposit of 250, plus the reduced excess payment, it would be ¬£317.00
I'm upset now, as I've had to borrow money to pay into that account to cover it.
I'm stressed, upset and broke, and all because I wanted to hire a car for one week!!
What a terrible system that they just keep taking money off you on top of previous payments...
I will never use them again. If I didn't need a car for the next week, I would have definitely cancelled this booking.
It's literally cost me a grand!! If I was allowed to use expletives on here, believe me, I would!!!

Truly awful service for disabled customers ‚Äì avoid if you can

If you are disabled and rely on Motability, avoid Europa Car Belfast at all costs. Unfortunately, they have the contract with Motability for hire cars if your vehicle breaks down ‚Äì but that ‚Äúservice‚Äù is virtually non-existent.

They rarely answer the phone, and when they finally do, they lie. I was told a car would be ready for me in 2 days. That never happened. A week later, I still have no car, no update, and no way of knowing when (or if) I‚Äôll get one.

I am disabled and live in a remote area with no access to shops or medical appointments without a vehicle. This delay has left me completely stranded and put my health at risk. The lack of care or urgency for a disabled customer‚Äôs needs is absolutely shocking.

Europa Car Belfast have shown themselves to be unreliable, dishonest, and completely unsympathetic to the needs of vulnerable people. If you have any other option, take it ‚Äì because you cannot count on them.

Hired a car from the Gloucestershire branch, when asked if I needed to know anything about driving in the UK all I was told you drive on the same side of the road as in Australia. I returned the vehicle some 25 hours before the due date and time and never received a refund. Upon my return to Australia I received an email and infringement notice to say I drove in the coach lane at Manchester Airport for 34 seconds. I paid this fine and also received a further invoice of 45 UK pound for Europcar for passing on the original fine. When I questioned this I received an email to say my query was being investigated and I would be notified soon. I did not received a refund for the early return of the car and I advised Europecar UK to use that money to cover the cost of typing my email address to cover the costs of passing on the infringement fine. Europcar UK charged my credit card without my knowledge for the said 45 UK pound. To use my credit card without my authorization is criminal and I believe this to be corporate fraud. I am still await the 'outcome' of Europcar UK investigation. Would NOT recommend Europcar UK to any future hirers.

Hired a car from Toulouse Airport. On returning the vehicle they refused to examine the car. They are now saying that there is a 2 - 5cm light scuff.
Cost to repair - 550E
Loss of Use - 4 days - 138E Yes 4 days to repair a 2 - 5 cm light scuff
Admin - 72E
Money grubbing racket, I believe because I wouldn't take out their excess cover - I have third party cover.
I will never use them again

I am giving this Company a 1 star review, because I cannot give them any less.
I was given a hire 'car' by my insurance company while mine was being repaired. I am nearly 70 and need a car to get around, so when my car went in for some repairs, the repair company stated that their courtesy cars were too small for me, (I am quite tall) Europcar were my insurers choice to give me a suitable car. They contacted me top say that they had not got an SUV as requested, but would give me something as close to an SUV as possible. What they supplied was a 9seater mini bus.
I tried to contact them to explain that the 'car' was not suitable but every time I called, I was constantly put on hold. I even completed their contact us form only for them to send me a standard reply email 2 weeks after the van had been returned. Do not accept anything from this firm unless you are happy with the size of vehicle and the condition. make sure that you take an all round video just in case they try to con you for damage that you have not caused.

CROOKS. Booked in advance but because they wouldnt accept different cards we had we were forced to take out their insurance for the week which was more than the cost of the car hire. We had arranged our own insurance at a tenth of the price but they would not even look at the paperwork. It was late with only a few other companies open and limited availability. When I asked why the insurance was so high they said it was a local insurance company. Never given a policy document just ‚Ç¨268 item on the bill. We still had to pay a deposit. Read other reviews and see this is a common scam by them.

I arranged a hire of a Luton van and when it turned up the driver noticed someone had stolen the number plate ! They arranged for a LWB van to be delivered and this had a front tyre that was 1/3 bald ! The driver said you can take it to Kwikfit and they will change it for you , as it's our problem we willpay for it ! Oh yeah , sure I'm going to waste a few hours of my time for a problem caused by them. On top of that he said he saw the Luton was missing the number plate the day before , but thought he would keep quiet and not report it to the office !!! Unbelievable .... Then they would not answer the phone at the local depot and I did not get a hire at all ! I wish Trustpilot gave you the option to give a minus score s it would be -5 ! Don't use them is my recommendation.

False advertising from Europcar:

I booked an EV for a holiday in Spain. Online booking process says "full recharge not required" ‚Äì but the collection desk argued I must recharge it before returning it.

They finally agreed when I showed them the website, and said they'd make a note on my booking. Obviously my choice was either sign the paperwork and trust them, or leave with no car for my holiday (plus they'd keep my deposit?).

So I had to trust them, and when I got home they invoiced me for recharging the car and took the payment from my credit card.

When I filed a dispute, they just replied saying that's the terms I agreed to when I signed. I keep asking about the false advertising, but they just ignore that question.

Won't use them again as this broke my trust.

We returned our car to Izmir Airport on 21/06/25, and as of 13/08/25 are yet to have our ‚Ç¨300 security deposit returned.

We have made multiple phone calls and emails to attempt to get this resolved and are yet to hear anything back. We waited 30 working days, as advised, before emailing the Customer Service UK email address on 01/06/25, and only received a NoReply, automated response on 06/08/25 with no real update or additional information regarding our query- it was clear that it was sent automatically and not by a real person.

Europcar are contractually obliged to return this money to us, yet we do not have it- or any correspondence from them about it at all!

We will begin pursuing legal action if we do not hear back or receive our money back by the end of the week.

This is unfortunate because the car itself was lovely and the staff in Turkey very helpful, and the staff who assisted in making the booking were also helpful. We only went with Europcar because we believed them to be reputable, but will not be using them again after this experience.

If Europcar would like to reach out as a response to this review then I would very much welcome it, as all we really want at this point is our money back. I will be happy to provide our booking reference if so.

Very rude and unprofessional staff in booking process. 9th of July they 9 am they come collect car from may door 12 hours after I received text message from them said apologies for any inconvenience but we couldn't collect your rental vehicle today!!
And 24 hours after with out any notice they sent me invoice for damages front wheel alloy .
When they drop car for me before inspection take signature.
Terrible experience bo recommended them

Booked with europcar paid ¬£276. They cancelled my booking with no explanation. I spoke to them on the phone they said I would receive a full refund with 5-7 days. They then refunded ¬£206.00. I called to request the full refund. Customer service Carlos was obnoxious stating they need to do an investigation that will take 10 days no mention of refund. What investigation is needed all they need to do is look at the data ¬£276 paid by customer and they returned only ¬£206 clearly shown on bank statement. DO NOT USE THEY WILL STEAL YOUR MONEY. There is clearly some fraudulent activity happening in this company.

I had a prepaid car rental voucher for a predetermined type vehicle through a third-party provider. I went to collect the vehicle from EuropCar Gatwick South Terminal to be told by the female EuroCar employee that the vehicle we ordered was not available. She said ‚ÄúWe are giving you a free upgrade‚Äù. No mention of cost we would pay etc. because we were told they were GIVING us an upgrade. GIVING! It is my understanding that under law, if the company cannot provide the car ordered (and paid for) they must offer either a free upgrade or a lesser vehicle with a monetary refund, The upgrade was a very luxurious vehicle and I was immediately resistant and anxious and expressed deep concern to her, I was told by the female agent not to worry, the vehicle was at the end of its rental life, it had 50,000 miles on the odometer, which it did, and it was to be disposed of when I returned it. Reluctantly I accepted it. I felt it had been foisted upon me. When I was outside loading the car, the female agent came out and said the car had damaged wheels and I had to sign a form to acknowledge the damage. She presented form with a diagram of the car, both sides, with X marks on the wheels. I now realise she had folded the paper in half so that I couldn‚Äôt see what was on the other side. I really thought the shonky, trickster days of car hire had long gone. Boy was I wrong!!!
In hindsight I should have said NO! NO! NO and I should have run away, screaming, and rung the third-party provider and complained, but I didn‚Äôt, fool that I am. However, after 26 hours of travel I was exhausted, and yes, I now know I was dimwitted not to spot a scam in the making.
I hated the car from the start. This car wrecked my entire holiday and nearly wrecked me. I was highly anxious when I drove it and it made me quite ill from worry, It was too large and too wide for UK parking spaces. It literally got stuck in the entry to a shopping centre car park. It gave my daughter high level anxiety attacks. I had to try to park it away from other cars because I was terrified they would dent the car‚Äôs doors. This car was just too big,and too wide for UK narrow roads, even some A roads were scary and it did things I found hard to accept. It was so technical it was dangerous, simply because it was distracting.
But just as importantly, mechanically it was difficult. When the car started off there were many times when it just didn‚Äôt want to change up gears. Leaving Cobham Services, the car wouldn‚Äôt change gears at all and I held my breath thinking I would need a tow truck, but eventually it did change up. I am used to driving a Subaru with CVT automatic, but this vehicle had a habit of just stopping and not moving off. It would stop and go into Neutral and once you realised why the car wasn‚Äôt moving and what had happened, you had to go through the set process to get it going again. This happened in dangerous places at times like waiting to enter a large roundabout on a 70mph road. A friend suggested I return the car and I jolly well wish I had.
On the day I had to return the car to Gatwick, a yellow message about the tyres appeared on the consol. 8 calls to EuropCar proved useless and so I drove just down the road to the local dealership for the marque. Service personnel said it was ok to drive it back and gave me instructions as to what to do with the gadget in the trunk should tyre pressure deteriorate. And this is how I returned the car.
During the term of the car hire I did check my credit card several times to see if EuropCar had levied the ¬£1500 block for security and I was surprised they had not. I returned the car on 1 August and flew home. The day after I arrived home, I checked my credit card and found that at between the 29 July and 9 August (8 days after I had returned the car) EuropCar had charged me $3,630.06 in my money for the upgrade they told me they were GIVING me because they were unable to supply the car I had ordered and prepaid for. It was then that I remembered the woman who asked me to sign the document acknowledging the damage to the car, and it was then that I realised she had folded the document in half and therefore I could not see what was on the other side-the upgrade charges etc.What a Fool I am
I have lodged a dispute but EuropCarUK is notorious for completely ignoring disputes. I am told that what this woman did could be a criminal offence called Fraudulent Misrepresentation. Some could ask whether she is highly skilled in the dark arts of duplicity and deception? Of course I will not be letting this matter go and others in the travel and insurance industries have been advised. Eventually when I can confidently tell the Citizens Advice Bureau,Trading Standards,Watchdog and Rip-off Britain that EuropCar has done absolutely nothing to resolve my dispute,then I will lodge a dispute with the BVRLA to whom EuropCar belong.

Rented a car for 1 week - we landed early and collected the car 40 mins early- was not informed that this would incur and extra days charge - would have waited until the 11am time we had booked if we had been informed. Customer exploitation at its best

I booked a car for the month of August 25 and needed to make a small correction to the pickup location all other details remained the same - duration timings etc. I notified the customer care department almost immediately to explain the situation. I was subsequently notified that there was nothing they could do with 5 days notice before pickup and that I would either need to pick up the car as per the original booking or lose the rental money 840 pounds. I am on holiday, required the car for the duration of the holiday and was forced to rent another car whilst I contest the problem - simply ridiculous people.

I rented a car abroad in Thailand in March I have not received my deposit back and it‚Äôs July. I have contacted customer service multiple times and they have been no help saying they are unable to find my booking.

Europcar Heathrow.
Arrived off a 32-hour flight from New Zealand. Tired and disorientated I arrived at the desk ready to produce my CarTrawler.com voucher for the 30-day rental. This was not required, apparently. I asked about an upgrade to a car with automatic transmission and was told that one was available at an additional 25 GBP per day. I was told by Danielle that because she was not (now) going to be charging me for the additional driver (upon the return of the vehicle) that additional cost would only ‚Äòfeel‚Äô like 5 GBP per day as the additional driver would have otherwise been charged at 20 GBP per day. We signed the documents, drove away and then 30 minutes later realised we‚Äôd been well and truly conned by Danielle.

The cost of the additional driver, for the original vehicle or for the upgrade was NOT 20 GBP per day (or 600 GBP in total). It‚Äôs only 186 GBP for the whole period (according to their website) for the upgraded vehicle. I phoned Customer Services from a service station on the M5, who also said that the 186 was too cheap and it they‚Äôd never offer an additional driver for less that 13 GBP per day.

So, having already paid 1,034 GBP for the original vehicle I was stung for another 1,035 GBP for the upgrade. The payment was taken out of my bank account, and this prompted an email to their customer services. Several emails later, during which I was told that ‚ÄúYou‚Äôve signed the documents, so you had to pay‚Äù, and that ‚ÄúI (the customer service rep) was not there when you had the conversation with Danielle, so I can‚Äôt confirm or corroborate what was said and so can‚Äôt offer a refund for the difference‚Äù etc etc, it went on.

The upgrade vehicle, should I have booked that originally, would have cost me 1,390 +186 = 1,576. I was conned out of 492 GBP. I wasn‚Äôt asking for a refund for the whole amount, just this difference. I would have been happy to pay the correct price for the vehicle that I had.

The whole ‚Äòshow‚Äô was a farce. ‚ÄúFor this deal I need to get my manager to sign this off. It‚Äôs that good‚Äù (Danielle). The whole things was a well-practiced hustle.

This whole experience really played on my mind for the whole of my holiday in the UK. This experience and realisation of their wrongdoing was something I was unable to reconcile with.

Avoid, avoid, avoid. I hope my that by writing this I can help others to avoid a similar experience.

"Hello David,

Other customers were facing the same issue, including those who had booked weeks in advance. The staff were rude, unhelpful, and took a ‚Äútough luck‚Äù attitude with everyone. The whole experience was chaotic, unprofessional, and completely ruined the start of our family holiday. I had to get a refund and find an alternative at the last minute. Easily the worst customer service I‚Äôve ever experienced. Never again.

I rented a van from Europcar on the 13th of June and returned it the following day, the 14th. While I‚Äôll admit their vehicles are quite lovely and modern, that‚Äôs about the only good thing I can say. The rest of the experience was a full-blown disaster.
I used the van to move boxes to my new house, driving a total of just 38 miles. However, when I went to refill the tank before returning it, I had to put in 14.61 litres of diesel. That‚Äôs laughably excessive. For context, I drive a diesel SUV 64 miles round-trip to work daily, and that uses only 4‚Äì5 litres. So how did 38 miles in a van burn through nearly triple that?
The answer is simple: the vehicle wasn‚Äôt filled up properly when I received it. The digital fuel gauge can be deceiving, giving the impression of a full tank even when it‚Äôs not. I mentioned this immediately upon return, only to be told that maybe the heavy boxes I moved caused it. A flimsy excuse at best.
I raised a formal complaint online on June 15th, expecting the promised "7 working day" resolution. It's now well past that, and I‚Äôve received nothing but silence and disgraceful customer service. I've been hung up on twice after providing my complaint reference, and on one occasion, I was subjected to the rudest, most unhelpful call imaginable. Not once did anyone seem remotely interested in resolving the issue.
If you're thinking of using Europcar, don‚Äôt unless you‚Äôre prepared to be ignored, insulted, and treated like a nuisance the moment you raise a concern. Their complaint process is more like a black hole. Once you're in, expect no return.
Avoid Europcar. Their shiny cars hide a rusty, soulless machine underneath.

I hired a car from Trieste Ronchi Airport on 22 June 2025, and returned it in Bologna on Thur. 26 June.

The pick up process went OK, but the car's conditions were worse than those described on the contract. This forced me to take something like 18 pictures of various damages and return to the office to report one of them in particular. This was particularly unpleasant as I had to do this under the scorching sun at about 37 degrees; it would be greatly appreciated if Europcar could rent some parking slots in the shade.

But the worst was still to come. The documentation I had been emailed when I booked contained 2 different addresses where to return the car in Bologna. When I asked about this on the pick-up day, the person behind the desk (Sig.ra Ilenia) said that, actually, both of these addresses were wrong, and gave me a third address ("V. Matteotti, 5 - Bologna"). She mentioned that, when I reached the car park, I should go to level -1. That was it.

On the last day, car return time was 15:00. Google map said it would take me 15 minutes to drive to the alleged return address (Via Matteotti, 5); I left at 1:45pm (1h 15min early).
Indeed, after less than 20 mins, I reached "via Matteotti"; however, when I started looking for no. 5, there was no ‚Äúno. 5‚Äù anywhere. The numbering jumped from no. 1 to no. 7; in between, there was a huge bridge over the railway, and, after the bridge, Bologna's main Railway Station's car park.
The car park entrance had no indication suggesting that this might *also* be the place where rental cars had to be returned. There was NO Europcar sign to be seen anywhere, nor were there any other rental companies' signs, which would have hinted this could have been the correct location.

I stopped and called Europcar office in Bologna for some indications. It was about 2:10-15pm. Nobody answered. I tried several times, for about 5 minutes, but nobody picked up.

The clock was ticking. Given that I had 3 (three) different addresses where to return the car, and that, amongst those, one was Europcar's main offices', I decided to drive there, as the address placed it nearby.
After another 10 minutes, I managed to locate Europcar's office entrance, parked, and walked there.

It was 14:30, under a scorching sun (37 degrees C). When I got there, the office was closed. The sign on the door said "14:30" as the afternoon opening times. I waited for a few minutes, while occasionally ringing the bell, and insistently knocking on the office door.
No answer. Nobody was visible through the glass windows.
It was now past 14:35, the return time was approaching, and the door remained closed. I tried to call Europcar's office number again: no answer.
At that point I noticed a small sign (written in Italian) next to the office's door, stating that, should the office be closed, the car key should be dropped off at Europcar's car park located in the ** main train station's car park ***. It was now clear that Bologna's rail station car park was where Europcar also had its own car park.

But the calvary wasn't over. I drove the car to the train station car park, went to level -1 (where, finally, a "Europcar" sign showed up) and parked.
I had a look around, but there were no signs as to where to find the key drop box; there were no Europcar's desks anywhere. I walked to the top / ground floor, found a railways office, where a staff member of the national railways very kindly told me he believed the key box was on floor -1. He was not a Europcar staff, so he wasn't supposed to know this. I assume he knew as he had already come across tens of people who, like me, were looking for the same piece of information.
I then went back to level -1, where I found two other people equally lost and looking for the drop box: someone else had told them that it was at level -2, not -1. I decided to believe the railways staff member (for the reasons above) and we started walking around on level -1. Finally, in a very remote, dark corner of the car park, partly hidden by other cars, there it was, Europcar's key drop box.
It was now 2:55pm; I was drenched in sweat, and had spent 45' of my time doing this.

To sum up:
1. Europcar's office *never* answered any of my calls; I tried also later in the afternoon, repeatedly. This is simply a disgrace;
2. The documents I was sent contained 2 different addresses where to return the car, both incorrect;
3. Car conditions: some of the issues were not noted on the report I was given at car pick up;
4. When I picked up the car, Europcar staff (Sig.ra Ilenia) did not clarify that the return car park happen to coincide with Bologna's main train station car park;
5. Europcar's sign posting is abhorrent. A small sign next to the train station car park's entrance would have made this so much easier, as would some sign posting to the key drop box.

Overall, I will never hire a car with Europcar again.

My wife with our young baby found that the vehicle she had reserved (with a child‚Äôs car seat etc) was not available. They had an alternative vehicle, which they said it was ‚Ç¨60 more per day. I strongly urge others not to use Europcar. My experience was nothing short of a rip-off. After returning a rental vehicle in good condition and signing what I believed was a routine check-in form, I was later hit with a staggering ¬£714 charge for a tiny scratch.

There was no transparency about how this figure was calculated, no prior notification before the charge was applied, and no opportunity for a fair dispute. I formally raised concerns with customer service (Case #23359929), but the response was robotic and dismissive ‚Äì no explanation, no breakdown of costs, and no engagement with the clear disparity between the "damage" and the fee.

The process feels deliberately opaque, and the customer support offered no real dialogue or justification for such an extortionate charge.

Warning to all renters:

Do not sign anything when returning the vehicle unless damage is properly reviewed with you on-site.

Document everything with photos.

Be aware Europcar may charge you excessively and without transparency.

I wish to provide a candid warning to those contemplating the prospect of hiring from this company, particularly with regard to their Heathrow branch. This caution is underscored by a significant volume of negative reviews available online, and my experience is not isolated.

During my interaction with the Heathrow location, I was subjected to charges exceeding ¬£200, categorised as a Premium Station surcharge. This fee is levied despite the availability of other provincial alternatives within a reasonable taxi or cab fare of approximately ¬£20. Furthermore, I was charged for Super Premium Personal Accident Cover, which is redundant as I possess my own comprehensive annual coverage with premiums totalling less than the cost of their two-week charge. Additionally, their breakdown cover was almost twice the cost of a standard RAC or AA annual policy for annual duration.

Regrettably, I discovered these exorbitant charges only upon receipt of my invoice, as none of these fees were disclosed to me in advance. I strongly advise prospective customers to explore numerous online options for car hire excess cover provided by various insurers, which are available at a fraction of the costs imposed by this company. It is prudent to exercise caution; these charges are often hidden until after the transaction.

My attempts to rectify the situation were met with a lack of accountability. I engaged with a representative named Monica at a Spanish call centre, who assured me that the matter would be investigated. However, after a five-day interval, I was informed that no action had been taken, and I was told that Monica would face internal disciplinary measures.

Although a decision was made to refund my charges, I was subsequently informed that the process would take five days due to the sum exceeding their operational limits, necessitating approval from the UK. This was further compounded by a call handler abruptly ending our conversation when I sought clarification, stating that they were restricted in the length of calls. Once approval was secured, I was told that an additional ten days would be required for the funds to reach my account.

This level of indifference displayed by their representatives is striking, particularly in light of how they would likely respond if the roles were reversed and they were in a similar predicament. My experience has been distressing, exacerbating my PTSD with multiple triggers stemming from their deceptive practices.

I encourage anyone who has previously rented from this company to reassess their charges. Even years later, with the appropriate documentation, claims may be pursued in the County Court. To summarise:

1. Avoid utilising the Heathrow location.
2. Scrutinise all charges, regardless of the duration of your rental.
3. Research supplementary services available from various providers online.
4. Review competitor options thoroughly, paying particular attention to customer feedback.

Protect yourself and make informed decisions.

My entire experience with Europcar has been nothing short of shocking and deeply disappointing. Upon arriving at the rental desk, I was told that my reservation was "blocked" without any clear explanation, despite having a confirmed booking through Carflexi. I was then told I had no choice but to pay double the original price (for a new contract) for a different vehicle on the spot. Feeling pressured and stranded, I had no other choice than to comply.

What followed was a series of deceitful and contradictory actions that made it clear this was not an isolated incident, but rather what felt like a systematic scam.

The agent handling my rental, someone named Sheikh, presented a false "upgrade" that I had never agreed to, and I was misled about what I was actually being charged for. It later turned out that I had been mistakenly identified as someone else with the same name, which Europcar themselves admitted in writing, confirming the error was entirely on their side.

However, when I requested a refund for the extra charges caused by their own mistake, Europcar refused to accept any further responsibility. They effectively cut off communication and showed no willingness to resolve the issue, leaving me with no option but to escalate the case to the European Car Rental Conciliation Service (ECRCS).

To make matters worse, days after ECRCS confirmed I would be refunded ¬£157 for the unjustified upgrade fee, Europcar attempted to charge my card an additional ¬£142 without my consent. The only reason this unauthorized charge failed was because I had already transferred all remaining funds from that account, leaving no balance for them to take. I then had to urgently contact my bank and request the card be frozen to prevent any further attempts. This added yet more stress and time to an already exhausting situation.

I have never in my life encountered a company that operates with such blatant disregard for honesty, accountability, and customer trust. I strongly urge others to avoid Europcar, especially at this location (London, Heathrow), unless you are prepared to be deceived, overcharged, and ignored when things go wrong.

We booked our rental through Auto Europe, unaware at the time that they act as a broker and that the actual rental would be fulfilled by Europcar. Upon arriving at Verona Airport, we eventually located the Europcar desk, and that‚Äôs when everything began to go wrong. The staff member at the desk was very insistent that we purchase additional insurance, despite the fact that we had already bought full protection through Auto Europe. I contacted Auto Europe again, and after speaking with the Europcar desk staff, they informed me that nothing could be done as Europcar uses a different classification system than Auto Europe.

Eventually, a more suitable car was located, but we were told we‚Äôd have to wait 30 minutes while it was cleaned. In reality, we waited far longer ‚Äî not an ideal start to a long-awaited holiday.

The car we were eventually given wasn't in the greatest condition, but at least it could accommodate both our group and our luggage and done the job. Still, the overall experience was disorganised, frustrating, and disappointing.

We left feeling exhausted before our trip had even begun. Based on our experience, I cannot recommend Europcar or Auto Europe and would urge others to think twice before booking.

BUYER BEWARE if you are thinking about renting a car from Europcar.
After reserving and paying for a car rental through a third party before leaving the United States, on arrival in Southampton I presented the 3rd party rental voucher to the Europcar agent who accepted it without comment. He told me, however, that the car I reserved was not available and I was offered an upgrade for ¬£9 a day extra for the 14-day rental period. I accepted this and the agent made out a rental agreement reflecting the upcharge. At no time did the agent in Southampton tell me that the payment we made through the 3rd party would be disregarded and that Europcar would be re-billing the entire rental amount again. However, 4 days after returning the car, Europcar charged my credit card the full rental price plus the upgrade charge. In other words, I ended up paying for the car twice.
After calling the company‚Äôs customer service three times and explaining the situation by email, my complaint fell on deaf ears. I was finally told that the voucher I presented in Southampton and that the agent accepted and kept without comment had not been applied.
To add insult to injury, upon returning the car at the exact time and date stated on the rental agreement (as confirmed by the agent who received the car), I was charged for an extra day after being told the car should have been returned an hour earlier.
Apart from being conned out of more than $500, the worst part of this experience has been trying to communicate with a company that is completely deaf to their customers concerns. The customer service rep., who is located somewhere overseas, will let you talk about your problem endlessly and then do nothing about it. Ask to speak to a supervisor: ‚Äòsorry there are none‚Äô. I have to assume that using bait and switch tactics to justify ignoring payments from third parties is a common Europcar practice in order to avoid paying fees to those parties.
Since we still needed an additional rental in the UK, we discovered Drivalia, which came highly recommended. It is understandable because their rates are half of what Europcar charges and their customer service reps are extremely friendly and accommodating.
Hopefully, my own experience with Europcar‚Äôs unethical business practices will serve as a caution to anyone in future looking to do business with an ethical car rental company.

Review update: In response to Europcar's standard corporate response.

I was charged for damage, some minute scratches, which I‚Äôm told I should have taken pictures of, despite picking the car up in the dark and only having it for 12 hours where it was almost all dark, driving around 50 miles on main A roads, clearly this wasn‚Äôt me however Europcar have charged ¬£500 (!!!!) . After an accident my AA Insurance organised a loan vehicle, the vehicle was dropped off at my home address keys left with a relative.
On my return I inspected the vehicle and proceeded to do a short run to the local store but found the tyre warning light on, I thought maybe the tyre needed pumping up , after a 8 minute journey the tyre went completely flat resulting in calling out the AA and being escorted to quick fit for a new tyre, the AA engineer found a tyre valve wedged in the wall of the tyre.
Eurocar want me to pay ¬£159 for a new tyre which is an absolute disgrace.

SO I SAY DONT EXCEPT A VEHICLE WITH EUROCAR UNLESS YOU INSPECT IT INSIDE AND OUT .

As we've said many times yes we signed a contract but we were told an untrue story about our luggage which was not corroborated by their other 2 depots namely our luggage was too big. The other depots both said we should not have been charged more for the car and they hadn't heard of any luggage laws as told to us.
1. We asked the guy in Edinburgh to try our luggage in the car we hired but he refused. He told us there were restrictions on putting luggage on the rear seat (a small carry on bag) He also told us the police were on the lookout for hire cars doing this on the North Coast 500, not knowing the laws we believed him. But I haven't seen any corroboration on the internet to say this is true.
2. We went to Inverness to swap our car as instructed by Europcar's head office via email.
3. Inverness advised us he had not heard from head office and advised us to keep going as smaller cars are like hens teeth. What did they expect us to do? We had already paid $1900aus and had pre booked accommodation.
4. We only signed because we had to have something because we were booked ahead.
5. At no time after we went to Inverness depot were we instructed to go back for a smaller car which we would have done. So why were we instructed to go to Inverness only to find no car available, and why weren't we told to come back the next day or at some other time...were we expected to walk around Scotland??
All of the above borders on a shonky deal and we have been trying to resolve this since April 24th....how long does it take.
The contract was signed after we assumed the story we were told was true but since found out it was dubious at best so....if you sign a contract under wrong assumptions it should be voided. Was the initial amount we paid not considered?
The car had lollies and other packets in the glove box...the guy in Edinburgh said we might have to fill up with Adblue which we had to do on the first fill of the tank....this should be done by Europcar not the customer...there was no manual in the car so we could not learn anything about how the controls worked. We would never recommend Europcar to anyone, quite the opposite especially when we have been fobbed off with the phrase "but you signed the contract" so even though we were told a story to get us into a bigger car which we didn't want and didn't order it doesn't matter to Europcar?
We booked a Citroen C3 or similar and we would have easily fit our luggage in that sized car. When we took the car back to Manchester Trafford Park the man who took delivery of the car was called Usama and he told us we should not have to put Adblue in the car as it's Europcar's job to do it...he said the guy in Edinburgh might have lied to get a bigger bonus...he said we would be reimbursed for the Adblue and the bond money both of which we are yet to see.
Thanks,
Peter Brock

For a 6 day hire my bill so far is gbp 400 plus deposit. I feel totally ripped off. I have not been able to drive the car because a tyre had 2 holes in it and no one was interested in resolving the problem. I have been stuck in one place waiting for repairs to be done. There was no spare tyre.
I went through Rentalcar.com which is a broker. I was in a difficult situation and had to hire in a hurry for a next day, Saturday, start. I requested a Leeds city pick up and Manchester airport drop off on Thursday. I was charged 233gbp, then 85gbp extra when I went to pick up the car because the ‚Äòdifferent drop off location‚Äô had ‚Äòdropped off‚Äô. Plus a deposit which was ok and expected, if large. There was another extra charge for road usage when I picked up the vehicle. Prices are advertised in GBP but my UK credit card was charged in NZ dollars - I‚Äôm using an NZ mobile phone and drivers license but there was no obvious option to change the currency quoted/charged in. So then the insurance cover was added - the wording strongly suggests you need their full insurance offer. This was ¬£65 for 6 days. Charging my UK credit card in NZ$ incurred four times unnecessary conversion fees. By now I‚Äôm committed and don‚Äôt have time (or energy because I‚Äôm dealing with a family emergency and really need a good reliable car, right now) to find another supplier so accepted the deal.
I booked a 10am pick up. There was a 15‚Äô wait before being able to begin completing the paperwork and pick up the car. The car itself is ungroomed in the interior, and didn‚Äôt drive well from the get go. Shortly after leaving the pick up point an alarm appeared saying ‚Äòtyre pressure low‚Äô. I did not have time to deal with this immediately. When I called Europcar (the end supplier) two days later, by which time the wheel alignment feels obviously wrong, I waited a very long time for an answer and was eventually shunted through to someone who turned out to be the AA who came out to check the car through their breakdown service. Whilst the AA is always great, I could have called them on my own membership and saved the 30 minutes + waiting for Europcar to answer. So at this point I had no usable car (for which I‚Äôve paid a very expensive total hire rate) and was stuck waiting for a roadside rescue service to help me out with ‚Äòmy‚Äô problem. The AA turned up as promised an hour later, removed a nail ‚Äòwhich has been in there a long time‚Äô, did a temporary fix so I could get to some local appointments early the next day (having by now not been able to get to that day‚Äôs necessary hospital visit and run other urgent medical-related errands), and booked a new tyre service Kwikfit who replaced the tyre the next day. They found another nail in the tyre and let slip that poor quality tyres on loaned-out vehicles are a common problem with Europcar vehicles. The worst part of this is that Europcar do not answer the phone and even when they do couldn‚Äôt give a damn. When I did eventually get through to a customer service agent she was smugly rude by just meeting my concerns with deliberate silence. She finally put me through to ‚Äòthe local branch‚Äô (an ad loop telling lies about how great Europcar is) which clearly no one answers) where I was on hold over 30‚Äô before I gave up. Worst customer experience ever. Will never use rentalcar.com or Europcar ever again.

I was requested under pressure to pay extra ¬£71.40 as ‚ÄúAfter Hours‚Äù fee when we arrived Birmingham airport for car collection.
Due to a flight delay, we arrived at 11:04 PM‚Äîjust 4 minutes past office hours
We did promptly call their office at 7:30pm (UK time) in Italy before departure once we knew there was flight delay. This staff, who is on duty, confirmed he could wait up to 30 minutes beyond the usual closing time ‚Äì until 11:30 PM. We expressed our deep appreciation in phone.
Before making the car booking, we contacted your Customer Service team to clarify what would happen in the event of a flight delay, given that your office hours end at 11:00 PM. We were assured that, as long as we provided our flight number, your staff would monitor our arrival and wait for us accordingly. Based on this reassurance, we proceeded with the booking and submitted our flight information
We explained our situation and referenced the prior conversation with that staff. However, he remained adamant. When we requested an official policy document justifying this charge, he became defensive, accused us of being impolite, and refused to provide any documentation. He then stated that unless we paid the fee, he would close the office and WITHOUHOLD the car.
Adding to our discomfort, before demanding the late fee, this staff spent over five minutes trying to upsell us additional insurance. We informed him that we had already purchased full coverage. He replied confidently‚Äîbut misleadingly‚Äîthat full coverage did not include wheels and tires, and pressured us to purchase more coverage. When we declined, his attitude changed abruptly, and he immediately brought up the ‚ÄúAfter Hours‚Äù charge.
Lastly, when we arrived at 11:04 PM, the staff member had just finished completing the documentation for the previous customer. He was not simply waiting in the office for serving us.
I fully agree that flight delay was not Europcar‚Äôs fault and was not their responsible for this either.
However, they did not keep promise and still charged us after failing to sell us insurance, simply because we were only 4 minutes late.
They not only refused to issue a refund, but also failed to provide any documentation justifying the 'late charge' as per their Terms and Conditions
Please think carefully before ordering a car from them, even if their initial prices seem cheaper.

I had an accident with my car (not my fault) and received a replacement car similar to mine, from Europcar. It took about 40 days to fix my car so during this time I did about 2,000 miles. When finally my car was ready, I was told that I can leave the rental at the repair garage, as this was apparently, the usual practice. It took Europcar 3 days to collect their car and I received the collection report with all the images, which looked okay. I've been driving for more than 40 years, dozens of different rental cars around the world, never had a damage. I did not suspect any problems with the rental car, as usual.
What was my surprise when a month later I got a message from Europcar stating there was damage to the rental car worth nearly a ¬£1,000! There was no visible damage to the car while in my possession and I am not aware of anything like that! The images presented were magnified x20, making minor scuffs and scratches look massive. The car was not at the place where I left it, and was also cleaned. There was no mention in the contract that 2mm scuffs will be considered a damage worth ¬£1,000!
I feel so sorry I accepted their service as they are clearly after ripping off their customers. Perhaps there was an element of me being naive but the same thing happened to the person before me, so I tend to think it‚Äôs a tactic they use.

When it came to the payment, lo and behold, the price was DOUBLED.
So, when they give you insurance options, make sure to ask what ALL your options are, and make sure to specify that you want the cheapest/no additional insurance. Otherwise they will try to take you for all you‚Äôre worth.

That‚Äôs without even mentioning the lack of care, they are supposed to come out and show you the car‚Äôs features, how to use it, etc.

Overall extremely negative experience.

We had booked a 9-seater Mercedes van on line for a short holiday in Spain. Arrived at Malaga Airport on 5th April. We thought it would be quick service to get our vehicle. Were made to wait an unreasonable amount of time while the staff struggled to locate a Mercedes vehicle. After some delay, the customer service agent remarked, ‚ÄúAt last, I‚Äôve found the Mercedes van for you,‚Äù and then immediately pushed a rental agreement towards me for signature.
This document listed more than half a dozen scratches, broken parts, and damages ‚Äî yet none of this was explained or reviewed with me in any way. Most of the text appeared to be in Spanish, with only a few vague English notes.
After waiting for over 30 minutes at the desk, we were handed the keys and told to collect the vehicle from level -2 of the car park. Not only was this an inconvenient distance from the desk, but the underground storage was extremely poorly lit ‚Äî making it nearly impossible to conduct a proper inspection of the car.

We were told to report any additional damage within 24 hours or risk being held liable for anything not listed. Due to the lighting conditions, we were unable to thoroughly inspect the vehicle. We drove it out and parked at a nearby shopping centre, where we finally had a chance to properly look over it. What we discovered was shocking: the vehicle had over two dozen scratches on the bodywork and extensive internal damage, including loose parts that rattled loudly during the short drive. It was very clear that this vehicle was not roadworthy and should never have been released for rental.
Have already complained (22966365). No explanation has been provided in response to my formal complaint, which I find unacceptable. This response lacks the seriousness the matter deserves and reflects poorly on how Europcar treats its customers.
Don't rent a car through Europcar at Malaga airport. Their cars are parked too far underground, and you cannot inspect the vehicle because of poor lighting. Avis or other cars are parked at a reasonable distance. The message is clear - AVOID Europcar. They only want your money by even putting your life at risk

What a trapdoor this company is. Stay away please take my advice. The errors this company has made against me has cost me thousands of pounds. I am currently trying to retrieve over ¬£1100 that Europcar took out of my account on a saturday morning without any authorisation and having never had a hire car from them. There message to me was go somewhere else you are not getting anything from us today. I was left standing there having giving up the day to collect the car in the first place. I have still nor had it back. There is no one to complain to at Europcar there is no real customer service to speak off. I have had to register it as a theft with he police I've had to buy a vehicle in order to start my new job at the cost of ¬£8000 taxed and insured lost days in work as a result of it. I don't think I've ever been so badly treated by a company in my life. I actually thought that this type of behaviour by a company was not possible in this day and age but it is. We had never hired a vehicle before & could almost see ¬£¬£s signs in the rep's eyes when he asked us. After being bombarded with insurance information & other additional charges told that the insurance already taken out with Booking.com was useless, so told to take out their additional insurance - even charged more for the One-Way charge than anticipated - altogether had to pay an additional ¬£400 for a car we didn't request or need!!! Valid driving license she would remain the legal hirer as it is her who signed the agreement and paid‚Äù. That is incorrect

I hired a large van to move some items all in all around 30miles. I needed it on a Saturday and this was the only company with availability. I booked it on the Thursday beforehand. Booked the van from 10:00am-22:00pm on Saturday and was charged ¬£71.45 which I thought was fairly reasonable. Noticed when booking that a charge would be added after as I would be returning the van out of hours. I called Europcar to ask how much this charge would be and was told ¬£20. I asked for this info to be emailed to me in case they tried to charge more later. They said they couldn't provide this info in writing which made me nervous but I needed to go ahead with the booking. The next day (Friday) I had a phone call from them saying that the van I had booked was not available but they could offer me a smaller one. I declined as had to move a sofa. They said it was OK and they would make sure the van was available for my booking the next day. Saturday we arrived at Europcar at 10am but there was nowhere to park at all - it was a tiny site with cars/vans everywhere. I ended up dropping off my partner and parking at the shop down the street. He was waiting for about 15 minutes till he got served and was told the van wasn't ready. He had already checked in online but they wanted all of his details again. Clearly they needed to waste time as the van wasn't ready. They asked for the payment card so I had to go back and provide this, they made a comment to my partner saying something along the lines of 'we will cancel this whole thing off until she gets here and then start again' - my partner said 'no that is not necessary she is parked 30 seconds away - keep it on the screen she will be here now'. I arrived and they took all of my details and tried to sell me insurance. I said that the basic will be fine as we are travelling very local. They proceeded to try and scaremonger me into taking the insurance but I said no. At this point it was about 11am and they were cleaning the van. I said that I want a discount as the van wasn't ready 1 hour after my booking time. They said as a gesture of goodwill that I could have the van until the following day. I said this is no use to me, I am doing 1 trip - I want you to waive the ¬£20 key drop-off out of hours fee and they said they would 'try'. So far, I haven't been charged this but wouldn't be surprised if it comes out of my account in the next few days. Would not recommend at all. Problem at every stage. Should have read reviews before booking. Even if you're in dire need I would go elsewhere.

Arrived ~45 minutes before the reservation time. Approached the counter, asked if there were any issues and was assured by James that this isn't a problem - that there won't be any additional charges for the early pick up, and the original reservation will hold (i.e. able to return at the original time without incurring any late fees as well).

I had added on the fuel option and was told that there'd be a hold on my card for excess fees, which will be returned. Went through the contract quickly, and James only pointed out the additional fuel option and got me to sign. BIG MISTAKE. I should've noticed that the contract now showed an additional day's rental charged at a ridiculously high rate, along with associated fees.

For context, my original booking was a compact sedan over 3 days, and the spot rate charged for what was essentially a 45-minute early pick up was ¬£100 (40% of my initial cost). Might I add that due to the hard selling, we only received the key to the car 20 minutes before the original pick up time.

After returning the car, I wasn't provided a statement of return nor a final invoice, despite them responding to confirm that it would be sent over in the next 10-20 minutes. When I saw the absurd charges to my card a few days later, Europcar representatives informed me that the dispute was filed, but again, they never got back with a case number and went radio silent after.

Despite 2 follow-up emails, sharing the intention to file for a chargeback based on fraud, Europcar refused to respond. Filed for a dispute with my bank, took months and multiple emails before I finally got my money back.

Save your time and wallet, pay the extra and go with more reputable car rental firms in Bristol.

Guess what? I contacted customer services and according to them the case was closed!! I have been instructed to email them again. Feel like I am banging my head against a brick wall!!!

If I could give less than 1 star I would. Europcar operate a 'scam' service.
I was flying from Australia to London Heathrow and decided to hire a car from Europcar during the Doha lay over. I selected the car to be picked up at the airport, filled in all the necessary and selected to pay upfront. The process went through up to my bank where it came back with 'there was an error with your bank' (Scam 1)

I found this odd as there were no issues. I tried a different credit card in case - same response. I tried calling Europcar, no answer. I decided to back myself up by selecting a 2nd rental from SIXT but to pay at the airport. Within seconds I received a SIXT confirmation of booking.

We arrived at Heathrow on Sunday 23rd March at around 5pm and decided to first go to Europcar as we had in the interim received an email stating 'YOUR CAR IS WAITING FOR YOU' (SCAM 2), and we had made a payment and if it had gone through whilst we were in flight, we didn't want to pay twice.
But we couldn't find Europcar. We asked SIXT desk and they said it is a shuttle SERVICE (Scam3). We went back to where the shuttle was supposed to be with 2 trolleys of suitcases. No signage. Went to ask again and told it is lane 3. Pushed the trolleys to lane 3 only to find it was not there. Asked again and directed me back to the first point. We waited 20m for a shuttle and a 20m drive to the EUROPCAR satellite office where there was another wait to be served of 15m. By this time it was now 8pm. I got to the front desk eventually, pulled up my email and the Europcar agent says 'you didn't finish your booking?'. I said I did and showed him the email stating 'your car is waiting'. He said that the booking was not confirmed, and the error message showed that. I asked why if the car wasn't available didn't they show this online and how was a customer to know that an error message for payment meant the vehicle wasn't available? He responded with that he could do the booking manually but there would be a price difference (Scam4). On the app it showed a 30GBP difference between online and at airport booking. We were tired and frustrated so said ok to the difference if it was small. We had booked an Electric JEEP for the week at a cost of 284GBP. The guy came back and said it was now 722GBP. I told him that was unacceptable. He said that due to the fire, all cars were booked out and no other rental company would have a car. It was now nearing 9pm, we had to be at a hotel 2hours drive from Heathrow and I think this is Europcar's plan (Scam 5). We refused to pay the price which was almost 3x that of the original booking and seeing we were not buying this scam, he said he could give a discount and we could get it for 520 GBP. The online at airport booking was 309GBP so he was trying his luck with the higher amounts. We refused and asked them to take us back to the airport.
On arrival I went directly to the SIXT desk, was helped by a fantastic and knowledgeable lady and within 10m we had the car which we had selected, at the price we selected. Europcar you could learn a lot from SIXT.
We are frequent travellers and will NEVER RENT FROM EUROPCAR again as they deliberately show cars online that they use to lure customers and then when the travellers are tired take advantage and try to scam by tripling the cost of the vehicle. You should be ashamed of yourself Europcar.

I am writing to formally lodge a complaint regarding my recent experience with Europcar.

Booking and Payment Details
I booked my rental car at the same time as my easyJet flights. The total rental amount was ¬£91.00, and an additional ¬£50.00 was paid for waiver protection. (Supporting details attached.)

Initial Interaction at Rental Counter
Upon arrival to collect the car, the representative at the counter inquired whether I had rented with Europcar previously. I informed them that I had, but had a negative experience regarding fuel charges, despite refueling the car minutes before returning it. I was forced to raise a complaint and provide proof of my fuel purchase in order to receive a refund. The representative apologized and offered me a free upgrade for my current rental.

Rental Agreement and Holding Deposit
I was presented with the rental agreement, which clearly indicated the prepaid amount of ¬£91.00, as well as an additional charge of ¬£86.90, which was explained to me as a holding deposit. I questioned this charge, and it was reaffirmed as a holding deposit, which would be refunded to my card upon the return of the vehicle. This conversation was witnessed by my colleague, who was traveling with me at the time.

Fuel Refill and Return of Vehicle
Prior to returning the vehicle, I refueled the car with 6.91 liters of petrol, totalling ¬£9.66, at the nearest garage to the airport (PA3 2TH), as per the attached receipt. Upon returning the vehicle, I handed the keys to a Europcar representative named Jack, who inspected the vehicle, including its mileage and fuel levels. He confirmed that everything was in order and that no issues were present.

Unjust Charges
On March 21, 2025, I received an invoice for additional charges, including a Premium Station Surcharge and a charge for 6 liters of fuel. Furthermore, my credit card has been charged an additional ¬£98.85 on top of the original rental charge of ¬£91.00.

These charges are clearly erroneous, unjustified, and appear to be fraudulent.

I hereby request that the excess charge of ¬£98.85 be refunded immediately to my credit card.

Additionally, I wish to file a formal complaint against both the employee who processed my rental and the representative to whom I returned the vehicle. Their actions were misleading and resulted in fraudulent charges being placed against me.

I expect prompt resolution of this matter. Should this issue remain unresolved, I will be forced to take further action to protect my interests.
