Please beware! Paid ¬£1,400 for a ¬£580 Europcar Rental: Misleading Deposits and Hidden Insurance Costs

I initially booked a 2-week rental for what seemed like a great price‚Äî¬£237 in total. The pick-up process went smoothly, and I was asked to pay a ‚Äúdeposit,‚Äù which I was told would be refunded if the car was returned intact. However, at no point did the staff mention any additional costs beyond what I had already paid online.

Fast forward to the end of the two weeks‚ÄîI needed to extend my rental, but it wasn‚Äôt possible. No big deal; I returned the car and booked another one for ¬£343. This time, I noticed that they had sneakily added a ¬£30 per day insurance premium. To my shock, this same hidden charge had been applied to my first rental as well, even though it was never communicated to me.

Now, here‚Äôs the real kicker: the so-called ‚Äúdeposit‚Äù isn‚Äôt a deposit at all! They cleverly call it that to make you think you‚Äôll get the full amount back, but in reality, they deduct the insurance charges from it. It‚Äôs a deliberate tactic to keep the insurance cost as hidden as possible until it‚Äôs too late.

When I asked if I could opt out of the insurance, they refused to give me a car and would not refund the ¬£300+ I had already paid. In the end, what was meant to be a straightforward car rental turned into a financial nightmare. For four weeks of car rental, I spent ¬£580 on the online booking, plus an outrageous ¬£800+ on insurance, bringing the total to nearly ¬£1,400.

It‚Äôs clear that Europcar‚Äôs strategy is to lure customers with attractive online rates, and then, after you‚Äôve paid the non-refundable fee, hit you with surprise insurance charges‚Äîlast minute‚Äîleaving you with no choice but to accept. If insurance is mandatory, why isn‚Äôt it included in the advertised price so that customers can make an informed decision? This is blatant false advertising.

Europcar has lost me as a customer forever, and I strongly advise anyone to steer clear of this company. In all fairness, the cars themselves are clean and good, but their deceptive, scheming practices make for a truly awful experience.

I booked a car through AutoEurope who collected full payment, confirmed my reservation and issued a voucher to collect the car from Europcar at Newcastle Airport. I live 16 miles from the airport, so someone gave me a lift to the airport to collect the vehicle (had to also pay the Newcastle Airport drop off charge (¬£4) to be dropped off in car park near the terminal!
I went to the Europcar desk in the terminal only to find no one there. Instead, there was a notice saying that the desk was closed and that they were operating from a cabin in the car rental car park at the opposite end of the airport!
On arrival at the new Europcar location I was asked for my license which I presented. I also offered to give them my passport and proof of address which they declined (said they didn‚Äôt need them)!
After 10 minutes the person behind the desk asked me to confirm my address which I did, and I was then told that Europcar had declined my reservation and that they could not give me the car I had booked and paid for! In fact, they couldn‚Äôt give me any vehicle!
When I sought clarification, I was told that their system had not been able to verify my address which by the way is on my licence and I also had additional proof of address with me but this was not acceptable as the ‚Äúsystem had declined‚Äù my paid for in full confirmed reservation!
I spoke to the manager who said he could do nothing nor could he refund the money I had already paid as it had been collected by AutoEurope and I would have to take it up with them!
He also astounded me with a tale of how Europcar was clamping down on who they hired cars to because some had not been returned and others had been used in robberies etc and as a result of these unacceptable comment and inferences I was left feeling as though I was some sort of undesirable crook!
If that wasn‚Äôt bad enough this whole experience caused me a great deal of embarrassment as it was done in front of other customers including the bit about cars used in robberies etc hence the clampdown on who Europcar would hire vehicles to!
I again challenged them and said that I‚Äôd been hiring cars for more than 40 years including with Europcar and never had any problems and was then told that I was the 3rd person in a row who the system had rejected, and that the manager was going to raise a query in the company‚Äôs group chat to see if other branches were having the same problem. Not that this helped my situation!
Ultimately not only was I was unable to hire vehicle but I was also left stranded at the airport and had to take a taxi from the airport back to South Shields to pick up an alternative hire vehicle from a local car hire company before they shut at 1pm.
This whole experience has proved far from acceptable and its unlikely that I will use AutoEurope again despite having used them many times previously but I certainly will not be using or indeed recommending Europcar again, in fact quite the opposite ‚Äì I strongly advise anyone thinking of using Europcar to think long and hard about it and certainly don‚Äôt assume that you have a confirmed reservation.
Based on my experience, not only will it prove to be a costly exercise, but it‚Äôs also an experience you are likely to regret!
If by any chance you are foolish enough to try and book with Europcar than I strongly suggest you put an alternative back up plan in place too, because based on my experience you are more than likely going to need to fall back on it!

I want to share my experience of a ‚Äúblatant scam‚Äù by Europcar to help prevent others from falling victim to such frauds.
I rented a car at London Gatwick Airport after booking the car and purchasing a "Premium" insurance policy online with e-Dreams. At the airport counter, the agent informed me that since I already had insurance with full coverage, I did not need to subscribe to any additional insurance. I was also told that a deposit of 700 euros would be charged (something I was already aware of through the contract signed with e-Dreams). In good faith, I signed the required forms on the tablet (the amount indicated was ¬£647, which I believed to be the deposit) and was given a document with the rental and payment details; nothing else was handed to me, nor sent via email (certainly not an insurance policy that might have raised some suspicions).
After two months of waiting for the refund of what I thought was the deposit, I was informed, upon my inquiry, that no refund would be issued as the amount charged corresponded to the cost of the insurance I had supposedly subscribed to. Realizing I had signed a document without verifying that the amount (which was not specified) actually consisted of ¬£100 for the deposit and ¬£546 for the insurance policy (this was the final amount charged), I nonetheless filed a complaint with customer service. Their prompt response (only 21 minutes after my email!) stated that since it was impossible to verify what had been discussed verbally, only the signed document held any validity! It goes without saying that all the information regarding the costs and charges was written in such a small font that one would need not just a pair of glasses but a magnifying glass!

On the 10th of March 2024, I hired a vehicle from Europcar and returned it on the 11th of March 2024 with no issues raised at the time of return. I was surprised to later receive a damage report claiming that I had damaged the vehicle. This report contained my signature, but no damage was brought to my attention when I returned the car, nor was I shown any documentation or proof of the alleged damage at the time.

In an effort to resolve the matter, I sent several emails to your customer service team seeking clarification. However, the only responses I received were automated emails apologizing for the delay and requesting my continued patience during your investigation. Months passed without any meaningful communication.

Two months after the incident, I sent the following email to inquire about the status of the investigation:

-----
Dear Customer Service Team,
I am writing to you again to resolve the following issue. We have not received any communication except for two messages stating:
Dear Customer,
Thank you for your continued patience during our investigation.
Please accept our sincere apologies for the delay in responding to you, due to the nature of your query; it is taking slightly longer than usual. It is our aim to provide you a full and thorough resolution, including any necessary supporting documentation.
We would like to offer you our assurances that once the information we are seeking has been obtained, we will respond to you. In the meantime, thank you for your continued patience in regards to this matter.
We look forward to contacting you again in the near future.
Could you please advise on the status of this issue?
-----

Despite my best efforts, this email went unanswered. Instead, I was contacted by Shakespeare Martineau LLP Clients Account, a debt collection firm, which was both intimidating and unexpected, given that no final resolution had been communicated to me regarding the alleged damage.

In August, I finally received a response from Europcar stating that "a member of our team will review your query and reply accordingly." However, no action followed this, and on June 10th, I received another email stating that you would not be pursuing any third-party providers and would be billing me directly.

As you can see, I have received numerous conflicting and contradictory communications from Europcar throughout this process. This is not only highly unprofessional but also confusing and distressing.

Under the Consumer Rights Act 2015, I am entitled to clear and transparent information regarding any charges or claims made against me, as well as reasonable communication in the resolution of any disputes. Europcar has failed in this regard, breaching your obligation to provide services with reasonable care and skill as required under Section 49 of the Act.

Furthermore, the Protection from Harassment Act 1997 outlines that it is illegal for companies or third parties to engage in intimidating or unfair practices. The involvement of a debt collection firm in this unresolved matter, without following your own procedures, raises concerns about the fairness of this process.

I find it unacceptable that Europcar has escalated this matter to a debt collector instead of adhering to the process stipulated in your terms and conditions. I request that this issue be resolved in accordance with the law and your own procedures.

Thank you for contacting Europcar Customer Services regarding reservation 1179912958.

When you arrived at the branch, 250.00 GBP was held on your account as a deposit for the rental. This was only recorded as pending on your account and not as a completed transaction. When the vehicle was returned, the full amount was reversed and was not converted into a transaction. The above amount would then be released back into your available balance. The number of days this would take is a banking process, not a Europcar one,and this takes around 3-10 working days to show on the account (up to 28 days for international transactions).

If your statement lists pending amounts separately, then the deposit amount should disappear from this list. Some online statements can show authorisations as debits, so again this should drop off and your available balance would increase. In either instance, you would not see a refund or credit in your list of transactions, as the deposit was not debited by us.

I would like to offer my sincere apologies if this was not clearly advised previously and I thank you for bringing this to our attention.

If you require any further information regarding the deposit process, you can check our FAQ section on our website - >click here.

I trust this information assists with your query.


Regards,

Maryam

Be aware that not all collision damage protection policies are the same for all rental car companies! With Avis or Budget, CDW/LDW coverage means that the total cost of any damage to the car is waived ‚Äî zero liability! But not with Europcar . . . their "Medium Protection Plan" just reduces liability to a maximum of ¬£250, as I discovered when I returned a rental with a scuff to the alloy wheel. Yes that is in the fine print but it was not made clear when I picked up the car ‚Äî in fact the agent encouraged me to take the additional tyre & glass protection to reduce liability ‚Äî and when I returned the car the agent implied I would be covered. Subsequently, I got a letter from Europcar stating that I was financially liable for up to ¬£250, after paying over ¬£70 in protection coverage for a 2-day rental. Safe to say, I will avoid this company for any future rentals in favor of companies like Avis where waiver means waiver.

I hired a car from Europcar (Volvo XC60) on a recent trip to Nice. I booked the rental through a 3rd party comparison site and paid a deposit for the rental and was covered for some extras, such as environmental surcharge. On arrival at the rental centre we were in a queue for about an hour and when we got to the desk was greeted by a very pushy rep. The cost of the rental was not as per the original agreement and they had added on the additional environmental charge. The salesperson also tried to "upsell" me a Mercedes and additional insurance, which I declined, at which point his demeanor became more aggressive. I was also miss-sold a full tank of fuel on the understanding that I would only be charged for fuel I used. They also charged me over ¬£400 for a tiny scratch on the bottom of the rear bumper which I must have missed on the initial inspection, however I do have insurance cover for this. Their business model is clearly to misrepresent the original displayed price and then aggressively sell or even miss-sell add-ons and I strongly suspect their staff are targeted and compensated based on these sales. I will never be renting from Europcar again and would urge others to think twice before using their services.

If renting a car from this company be VERY careful on collection to take detailed photographs of both the exterior and the interior. Check the car thoroughly before accepting it. Their employees cannot be trusted to list all existing defects and you may be found liable for them later.
Do not believe the person handing you the keys when they say that there is only, for example, one item of minor damage on the rental agreement. I recently collected a car, was told that there was only one item of damage: a chip on the windscreen. When I checked over the car before leaving, I saw that there were scuff marks on the wheels but assumed that as it had not been mentioned this constituted usual wear & tear. The car hire rep was dealing with another customer. I am not a mechanic, nor an employee of a car hire company, to know what constitutes acceptable wear & tear or unacceptable damage. I accepted that he could do his job. A few days later I returned the car in the evening after the office had closed so did not see a car hire rep. 2 days later I was very surprised to receive an email stating that there were 5 items of 'new' damage. One of these was chipped paint on the edge of a door, something that would have been hard to see. The car hire rep had opened all the doors and taken detailed careful photographs. What a pity the same care had not been taken when the car was prepared for hire. I was lucky that my photographs showed all the ‚Äònew‚Äô items of damage to be pre-existing. The car hire company puts the onus on the customer to inspect the car (in detail). Their T&Cs state that ‚Äúif you don‚Äôt notify us of pre-existing defect or damage to the vehicle then we will assume that you have accepted the vehicle in the condition set out in the rental agreement‚Ä¶‚Äù It is a shame that they cannot employ people who will professionally carry out their duties and ensure that cars are in a good condition and defects are accurately reported. The people in customer services are equally unhelpful; their attitude seems to be ‚Äòtough, you agreed to the T&Cs‚Äô. The ineptitude of the people who check the cars and the ‚Äòhard luck‚Äô attitude of the customer services reflect the bad name that some car hire companies have.

Don't use Europcar, use one of the other companies (like Budget). The staff at Budget have always been amazing! They even stayed open late so I could get my car once.
The response from Europcar has been appalling goes some way in explaining their 2.3/5 rating on Trust pilot.

ZERO STARS GIVEN - NOT ONE!
Bought a car battery in September, recently started to lose power. Car broke down, had to call AA & buy a new battery. Rang these Europarts clowns, who stated dont give refunds on batteries as they degrade!. Advised for me to take to Europarts who may give a replacement. Told the genius, I dont need a new one as Ive already got a new one!. Woman on the phone, doesnt know the job, just making excuses! . Dont use this Crpy company, they just rip you off with crpy goods!. Avoid at all cost!

Huge issues with my rental from this company. Poor communication from start to finish. After I handed the car back at an attended check in, I was right there for about 20 minutes because I had to wait for a lift and everything seemed fine. 2 weeks later they sent a bogus damage charge out of the blue. Cue a 3 month long back and forth with them where I was consistently ignored, both the content of my emails and europcar would deliberately wait 2 weeks at a time to respond, presumably in the hopes I‚Äôd just give up and pay. They reached a final decision while still having not responded to me pointing out breaches in their terms and conditions so I took it to the ombudsman who reached a decision in my favour in only 2 days - in my opinion, proving that they are *able* to respond and had been choosing not to respond to me. I also had an issue that other people have had where someone verbally confirmed something but this information then just vanished into the ether when I tried to bring them up on it - fortunately this was a phone call so was recorded by the company. I will personally not use this company again and would suggest to anyone who does that you take every possible measure to protect yourself and just assume that the company will take advantage anywhere you leave them a chance to. I‚Äôd like to be able to add something positive but honestly even from the start it wasn‚Äôt a positive experience. There were more small incidents that didn‚Äôt warrant a complaint from me, such as a (male) check in attendant who didn‚Äôt understand why I (female) wouldn‚Äôt give out my personal details on the phone when I was in public on a train; the fact that I‚Äôd booked for a Vauxhall corsa type car and they gave me an MG SUV type vehicle when I‚Äôve never driven anything that big before and the same man told me I‚Äôd probably find it easier because it‚Äôs automatic‚Ä¶ in my opinion, just not a customer led experience or company attitude unfortunately

Please be very careful with this company, if you didn‚Äôt select the extra insurance then please don‚Äôt accept an upgrade. What should have been an upgrade of ¬£5 per day for an automatic cost me more than an extra ¬£500 for a 2 week rental. Blatant scamming their management couldn‚Äôt care less about.
One day we might find ourselves in an mis-sold PPI situation with car rental companies, karma!

Updated to respond to Europcar‚Äôs offer to contact customer service:
Obviously I did contact customer service several times, I‚Äôm just being ignored now.

Do not rent from this company. They will conveniently neglect to inform you about London's congestion pricing scheme and then send you insane bills after the fact with fines for nonpayment, (90 GBP!) plus penalties and their own exorbitant fees (40 GBP per incident!). When you question why they made no mention of this ahead of time when they know full well that you are a foreign national driving in the area, why they made no effort to help you prepay or advise on how to pay, and why their cars are not registered for autopay to ensure their clients are protected from daily fines, they will tell you dismissively, "...it is not Europcar‚Äôs responsibility to make you aware of the London Congestion Zone or its charges."

By comparison, other companies routinely take care to go over the entire scheme in detail at the rental counter and then they offer you a means of prepaying to guarantee you will be not be subject to fines and fees.

Europcar would rather sweep it under the rug, hang their clients out to dry and then charge you crazy fees.

UPDATE: After being contacted by Europcar and invited to take the matter up with Customer Service, they did absolutely nothing except waste more of my time and send me another denial filled with corporate speak, back peddling, refusing to take any responsibility, pointing to fine print, blaming the client and other insulting lip service.

Imagine you book a car on July 1st and have to return it on 15th August (you pay AND book, 10am pick up and drop off). Imagine you have a receipt to prove this.
NOWWWW...Imagine you hand the car back at 09:26am and find out a week later that your account has been debited by ¬£280.54 for late hand in.

NOWWWWW. Imagine you call TWICE to complain and TWICE they promise an e-mail and DON'T send one.

This company is s###... stay away...

I strongly urge people to insist on being given a copy of their car rental agreement upon collection. I wasn't given one and of course, a dispute arises, with 450 pounds deducted from my credit card I had to leave with them. This was 2 days after I had returned the car and was given a clear "Statement of Return". I had reinterated upon collection that I had no further need of any insurance but miraculously my signature appeared on their rental agreement.This was a very expensive lesson for me and I still think it is a very sneaky way to do business. I would not recommend this company(Gatwick Airport) and urge any future car rentals to be aware, photograph the car before leaving, and insist on a copy of the rental agreement. My Travel Agent and the Driveaway agent could not do anything to help me.

Hello Nabil,

We appreciate your feedback and we are sorry to learn you were dissatisfied with our service.

Give us the chance to solve the issue by providing more details using this link https://www.europcar.co.uk/contact-us/email where our customer service team will be in touch.

We hope to see you again.

The Europcar Team

We had 2 hire cars included in a holiday booking but when we arrived changed that to 1 larger car. The branch then offered us free full insurance for the larger car as a trade off.

When we returned we were then charged over 400 pound for the insurance we were told was free. When I queried this, I was told it was my word against the branch and therefore they couldn't refund it as I had signed. The document was all in Portuguese and therefore I wouldn't have been able to read it to understand. I was also then told there was no appeal process. Saves them the cost of a car for a week but changing to 1 even though we had paid initially for 2. Wasn't refunded the cost of the second car but instead conned out of a further 400 pound.

Absolutely shocking service amd complete scammers

Worst experience ever! Firstly they cancelled delivery of my car hire 45 mins before it was due to be delivered. I had to drive and collect another car. The car was due to be collected on Friday and at 9.05pm on Friday I get told it will not be collected via text - no communication over the weekend. I have contacted the branch today (Tuesday) and it should be collected today, again no communication, no apology. Shocking customer service when you go through. I wouldn‚Äôt recommend this company

I was supposed to get a car in Luton Airport.
My parents were coming over for few days so I decided to rent a car.
The guy on desk just said "please have a sit, we will do a soft check before to handle the car to you".
At the end they have said to me I couldn't have the car because I didn't pass the check on DVLA. That's ridiculous. I have been left without vehicle and all my plans broke off. Why don't you do these check when booking online instead to let people off just 5 minutes before to collect the car??? And the most ridiculous thing is that they didn't give me any explanation. I have driving licence since 16 years, never had an offence, never had a penalty. That's crazy! and after more than 2 weeks I have not seen not even a penny of reimbursement in my bank account.
Stay far from Europcar!

Booking or reservation number is
1178821726
Europcar invoice number 100434713817

Did everything by book and went there before the booking date to make sure there will be no problems but still they did not provide the car of the right specifications. I was like ok will take whatever but the staff offered a refund and asked me to cancel the booking. They I got charged for one day as if I took the car and return it in the same day and they did attached a signed return inspection by (only one side) themside. When I called the customer service, I went through a long discussion before get them agreed that it is their fault and they will issue (it never happened) the rest of the money back.
Then they did not stop there, after few days I got another bill to pay extra fees which is the whole period again, so now I have paid one day plus the whole period against nothing in reality.
Let's see if I will get anything back from them

Hello Julie,

We appreciate your feedback and we are sorry to learn you were dissatisfied with our service.

Give us the chance to solve the issue by providing more details using this link https://www.europcar.co.uk/contact-us/email where our customer service team will be in touch.

We hope to see you again.

The Europcar Team

Honestly take a video of the entire car before driving away - time stamped on your iPhone with the date and the time to use when they ‚Äúcharge you‚Äù for damage that was already on the car when You picked it up.
All they want is your deposit money and if there staff did there job they would at each drop report all new damage. Saved myself ¬£250 when I sent Customer service my video of the car at pick up. Screen shotting the damage I was changed for that was already there haha no sorry just a email stating I was confused about my deposit money ‚Ä¶.
Will charge anyone who doesn‚Äôt take pictures. Heads up!

We rented a car from 5th to 19th August from Manchester Airport. Their online system was down so it was very delayed, all manually written, but I got the car. All fine with the car and since I dropped it off, they have charged Protection Premium (GBP 420). I specifically did not accept this online or at the desk. The form confirms this, and I even got separate 3rd party waiver for this purpose. There is no response from customer service and I will have to take it through the courts. Go for a different supplier.

Absolutely diabolical.

I am currently stranded with a broken down car. Made dozens and dozens of calls to the breakdown service, the office where i picked it up and the head office. Sent emails etc .

All anyone says is a mechanic is on the way, which they are not, it when i call an office they transfer me to another section that can't help.

Buck passing of the 1st order .

Avoid like the plague

The response below from Europcar is typical. I've filled in Thier help forms many times , no help is given. I've spoken to over twenty people employed by Europcar in the past 48 hours,not one of them has accepted any responsibility for the fact they have left us stranded, or made any attempt to help us

I should have known it was bad from the offset. The vehicle was an hour late and I was constantly being fobbed off while waiting for it.

When I got home I looked in the back and saw how dirty the car was, it certainly hadnt been cleaned well.

I was advised the car had previously had bumper damage but it had been repaired.

The following morning, I was driving down the Motorway with my 2 children when I heard a loud noise from the front drivers side.

When I Pulled into the service station I noticed the plastic wheel trim around the front wheel arch had broken off on the front part and was sticking out from the car.

I pushed it back on due to having a child with additional needs that would not have coped with staying at the service station. I instantly rang customer service and advised I wanted another vehicle as soon as I arrived at my destination.

They said they had emailed the branch and they would call me which they never did. The trim came off a further 4 times and I could not drive about 55mph on the motorway and needing to make emergency stops.

When I arrived I instantly called to complain and air my disgust with the poor service and poor quality vehicle they provided me with. They told me I'd need to drive 1 hour away to collect another vehicle which I refused and was told they didn't know when they would have a replacement as they had customers waiting from 4 days prior!

I was passed from pillar to post, told to ring their AA cover who came and gaffa taped the car back together whilst still waiting for an update on a replacement car.
After being advised I would be called first thing the following morning and 4 days later I've had no contact despite calling again and sending a complaint.

I'm now expected to drive this car for the return journey of 270 miles with 2 children and a car that is taped together.

Never again will I hire a car from Europcar.

Having paid for every insurance excess available I was disappointed to be told that, after a minor collision, I was apparently not insured.

This was before anybody had inspected the vehicle or knew the circumstances of the accident (ie this is the normal starting position for them).

A replacement car was provided and when the driver arrived to collect the damaged vehicle and give us a replacement he had a payment machine and demanded that I immediately pay over ¬£1000. I explained that I had insurance and he just kept repeating that I was not insured because I had a collision and it was my fault (without even asking about the circumstances of the collision).

I refused to pay. This saga continued at the airport and the threat of calling the police was raised by Europcar which I welcomed but this was a bluff on the part of the agent at Europcar.

Please also be aware that after you have paid for insurance online, when you arrive at your destination they ask you for more money (160 euros in my case) and tell you that you are not covered for an accident unless you buy this additional product. Cynical as I was, I did pay the additional amount and then was still told after a collision that despite having two policies (one for excess cover and one for any type of damage) neither were valid.

Nobody has contacted me since so I can only assume that this was pressure applied at the time to frighten customers. I worry that many people must have paid in similar conditions for them to continue to do this.

I you think this company is reputable given its size please consider this review before using them.

I hope that you find somewhere else and wish you all well.

I've been a regular customer for 15 years, at the same branch, I know the staff (who are brilliant). Never had any damage or problems with my hiring. I booked a car online so I could travel to my Dad's 80th birthday. Booking confirmed and money taken from my account. I relaxed knowing everything was sorted. Then THE DAY BEFORE I was picking the car up, I got a call to say I couldn't pick the car up as I've failed a credit check??? That it was a new company policy to do a credit check. I haven't got bad credit, but I was advised to ask experian why I might be refused. Not much good the day before my dad's birthday. I didn't have time or extra cash to book another car...I missed my dad's birthday. Worst thing is I can't find anywhere to complain, they make it so difficult. Upsetting to be a loyal customer and get treated like this... and miss an important family occasion because of a stupid company policy.

This is the most incompetent and dishonest car hire company I‚Äôve ever dealt with. They accepted my virtual card over the phone, charged it, and then refused to release the car at pickup because their rude, racist staff insisted on seeing a physical card‚Äîdespite us showing proof through the app! Instead of resolving the issue, the arrogant representative yelled at us and then charged ¬£40 for a ‚Äúcancellation‚Äù that was entirely their fault, before trying to make us rebook at double the price. Avoid this scam of a company at all costs. They‚Äôre unprofessional, deceitful, and clearly don‚Äôt care about customers. Total nightmare. I wish I could give then negative star ratings.

Extremely poor customer service. We queued for ages at airport for the car. We had a lovely lady help us. We were given a brand new Jeep (what we ordered) but on going to the collection point we were overlooked, waited ages and given a badly dented Ford Puma. We showed the paperwork which had the new Jeep showing. This was taken off us and simply changed to the Puma. We said it was not the car and were rudely told to go back to the reception if not happy which would have been another 30 minutes at least. We complained during the hire, after the hire, chased and chased. We did a trustpilot review and Europcar seemed to take interest and asked us to send in details again (to the same original address) We heard nothing again until today( well over a week later) from the Italian branch stating that the Jeep was the same category as the Puma. There was no recognition of the rudeness of the staff on collection in Italy and no understanding that we were allocated a new Jeep and ended up with a damaged Puma - not acceptable.

reviews.reviewer: No Service too good to review
reviews.text:
Someone damaged my car and I was told I was a courtesy car from this company while my car was being repaired. The repair was organised and I was promised I would have a vehicle on Tuesday at 11 o‚Äôclock. I was phoned by the Glasgow branch at 9 o‚Äôclock the morning that the vehicle should have been delivered and was told it would be 48 hours that I would need to wait before they could get a vehicle. I said this wasn‚Äôt good enough. After spending all day on the phone with various people I eventually got a car at 6 pm.
I contacted Euporcar to have the hire vehicle returned yesterday - Thursday - I was promised someone would pick it up at 9 o‚Äôclock this morning. At 10 o‚Äôclock I was told someone was on their way to pick the hire vehicle back up. My home is 15 minutes from their depot. Three and a half hours later I contacted the company to be told it‚Äôs between 9 am and 5 pm. To say they are having a laugh is an understatement - who has all day to wait about for a company to pick up a vehicle If they had no intention of picking up the vehicle don‚Äôt inform customers you are on the way to get the car.
I would have given the company no stars but there isn‚Äôt an option. The Glasgow branch seem to have a problem contacting customers and giving updates on what is happening and wasting people‚Äô valuable time. Obviously customers don‚Äôt matter.

Went to collect car at LHR & decided to take excess insurance to reduce damage excess. Quoted 27pounds/day ended up paying 46pounds a day as they also added other insurance like personal effects breakdown etc. I verbally confirmed before signing hand held device as could not see any financial info. Customer service person confirmed 27 pounds a day & said contract would be emailed to me. After I returned to Australia contract was sent to me.
Very Very expensive way of hiring a car!

Appalling and dangerous service from Nottingham branch.
Refusal to apply for a Crit- air certificate when the car was on hire to take to France , causing all drivers vulnerable to a fine. The hirer was unable to do it because Europa Car refused to supply V5 info due to DPA/GDPR and the. Refused to do it , initially suggesting hire cars were exempt!

Also all numbers supplied for breakdown were obsolete- printed on a 5 year old print out from 2019. Dangerous and negligent conduct - left stranded no numbers to contact emergency breakdown with disabled elderly grandmother .

Please checked any info you get from the only use them as a last resort. Forcing drivers to no comply with French driving requirements is appalling. Let alone negligent breakdown info.

Is this cost cutting or incompetence? Either way , it‚Äôs the hirer who is left to pick up the pieces. No where near good enough for such a large company.

Booked an economy car well in advance for Saturday collection at Stansted. Price quoted for two days: ¬£218.34. On arrival, they were unable to supply an economy car, and I was given the keys to a Mercedes. At the same time, I was told that if I returned the car within 24 hours, I would only have to pay for one day - which I did. Come Monday morning, I received an invoice for ¬£307.33 for one day, and Customer Service are not explaining why I am being charged the additional amount. Very disappointing, as I've always used Europcar. (If Customer Service reads this, it's case 20874160.)

Hello Sharon,

We appreciate your feedback and we are sorry to learn you were dissatisfied with our service.

Give us the chance to solve the issue by providing more details using this link https://www.europcar.co.uk/contact-us/email where our customer service team will be in touch.

We hope to see you again.

The Europcar Team

Customer service absolutely horrendous, I had a van booked 10 days before i needed it and then emailed me two days before to say it was not available at 8pm, no help at all other than we will process a refund to you which they were not supposed to have taken unless confirmed. totally S..t customer service leaving me very stressed trying to get another van with two days notice. FU..ING pissed of with them.

Beware when they offer you a complementary upgrade - the charge will come out of your deposit days after you have handed the keys back... I arrived in Belfast airport early morning to pick up a rental car I had paid for in advance. The lady behind the desk was lovely with good chat. I was offered a complementary upgrade - I thought wow this was nice, this proved a fallacy as a couple of days after I had returned the keys, I was charged on my credit card out of the deposit. Having looked after the car and taken photos of the condition when I handed it in, I assumed I had been charged for some perceived scratch and was about to argue. When I enquired I found out the charge was for the upgrade which I had assumed was complementary/free.

The way I was charged was misleading and deceptive since I was not charged on the day I picked up the vehicle and accepted the 'complementary upgrade' and therefore did not receive a paper receipt from the sales point terminal. I signed what I thought was a contract for renting of the car, I had no idea there were extra charges for the upgrade, the charge was in font 6 and not easy to interpret especially arriving early morning bleary eyed.

I took the smallest/budget car as this was what I could afford and would have not taken the upgrade if it was clear to me I was going to be charged!

Beware the talkative nice assistant and if they offer a complementary upgrade, triple check they are not charging you!

Hello Claire,

We appreciate your feedback and we are sorry to learn you were dissatisfied with our service.

Give us the chance to solve the issue by providing more details using this link https://www.europcar.co.uk/contact-us/email where our customer service team will be in touch.

We hope to see you again.

The Europcar Team

I booked a car via Carjet and they gave me the contact number for the car dealer at Prestwick Airport to collect the car called Keddy. They also told me I had to pay an additional 800E holding deposit. When I called the number a guy called Kris from Europcar answered and explained they are not actually based at Prestwick Airport but agreed to pick me up and then drop me back. He also explained Carjet are always making mistakes and a nightmare to deal with . On arrival he picked me up and I was only offered an automatic car even though I only ever have driven manual,but this was all he had to offer me . He also asked for a 700E holding deposit on my card which I accepted. I had to watch YouTube videos to figure out how to actually drive the car as I got stuck a few times. When I returned the car ,he told me everything was absolutely fine and said I'd be returned the 700E in a few hours . They did return the 700E but then deducted 78E and I contacted him to ask what this was for . He ignored my messages for days . And when I chased him up 5 days later he acted as if he didn't know who I was and asking for the booking reference number . I then sent him all the information he needed. 25 days later I still never received a response, apology or explanation. The whole thing is an absolute SCAM . WILL NEVER RECOMMEND CARJET OR EUROPCAR PRESTWICK TO ANYONE. SCAM COMPANIES!!!!!!

I have still not received my deposit been a long time now. They also hid until I collected van additional costs to reduce excess amount. They said "forgot". Very underhand, sly and in my view dishonest. Very quick taking deposit very difficult getting it back. Avoid avoid avoid. To Europcar. I have already emailed your customer services team and so far been ignored. I repeat hopeless and in my view dishonest.

The vehicle was hired for an extra day ¬£68.01; 2 days later an additional ¬£73.01 was taken from my account. I tried to call customer services to sort this out and they refused to talk to me because it was against procedure as my brother was the named driver, even though I rented and paid for the vehicle. If it is against procedure for them to talk to me as the Renter about taking money from my account without permission then why did they send me a survey to complete about my experience? My brother is having to take time out of his working day to sort this out and get my money back. Its appalling service and their PROCEDURES need to be reviewed!

Please do not use Europcar in Naples airport. We hired a car for the weekend for my husbands 50th.
we did not damage the car. We returned to the office out of hours due to our flight time. Then we received a bill for damage to the car, alloy wheel scratch and wing mirror scratch. We didn‚Äôt damage the car, we have argued this with Europcar in Italy, they are now threatening debt collection agencies. However, they have no photo evidence of the car prior to our hire period. I would suggest you avoid using Europecar at Naples unless you want a further bill. They even had the cheek to suggest by leaving the car there out of office opening hours that it was our fault??? We can‚Äôt get easyJet to schedule flights around there opening hours. Avoid and use someone else. I have always used Europecar but I will never, ever use them again!

Absolutely awful experience. Had to call them three times to confirm the booking and they still got the time wrong.

Then they left the car on my neighbour's drive without permission, blocking them in.

Finally, I was supposed to receive a "like for like" car and the car I received was nothing like the car I drive.

Terrible company, do not ever use them.

This ridiculous response they‚Äôve given underneath is just even more infuriating. I already emailed their customer service a week ago and they completely ignored me.

Now they‚Äôve called me and said they‚Äôll collect the car between 8-12 when I won‚Äôt be home and I have to call a different number back to tell them I won‚Äôt be home. Why can‚Äôt they just do that? Absolutely disgusting company. They‚Äôve caused me nothing but stress all week. Avoid them like the plague.

Also, I can‚Äôt understand a word any of their employees say.

All seemed fine, we agreed on an additional cost of ¬£40/day (¬£320+tax) for a car upgrade, but they ended up charging me more than ¬£900 for extra stuff I never asked for.
Sure, I should have read the contract better, but the person at the counter ensured me that the extra was ¬£40/day, but all of a sudden they charge for insurance, station charge, different fees, just because they had the chance to grab some extra bucks from someone in a very stressful situation.
They also scrolled through the contract and pointed to the signature field without giving me the option to read it beforehand.
I will never use Europcar again, they are a literal definition of a scam/fraudulent company. Never had an experience like this with their competitors Hertz and Sixt, go for them in stead, and stay FAR FAR FAAAR away from Europcar.

---Edit, a response to their response.
I've given all the information to your support team, and *SURPRISE* they denied any claim I had.

This was by far the worst car hire experience we have ever had in nearly 35 years of hiring cars in Europe. Two and a half hour wait in 40 degree heat on pick-up, with no water, in their stiflingly hot garage in central Lisbon, which ruined the first day of our holiday as we then missed our connection in the Algarve. Incompetence was literally evidenced by the queue of disgruntled customers stretching back down the street. This is obviously something that happens a lot at Europcar as none of the staff seemed even remotely bothered and just had a look of total disinterest whenever anyone complained. Due to their own total incompetence they then failed to fill the car with petrol and were in such a rush they failed to check the car in any way before we departed. So you'll never guess what happened next, oh yes, they send us a bill for more petrol and for a scratch on the car that they had failed to mark up on their pre-booking sheet. Totally incompetent car hire service

I am deeply upset by this recent hire. I am a regular user of Carflexi and have found their rates to be good. However, this time, I was allocated a pick up from Gatwick with Europcar. When we arrived we were rushed through the sign-up process and at no point were we given information or guidance on insurance. As I never get insurance cover (Carflexi can attest to this) I signed the papers and left. Only to find that I had been charged for premium insurance which cost more than the car hire itself. In addition, I was charged 40 pounds administration fee on a Dart crossing that I had already paid. I feel that these big companies act without any checks and balances and the customer becomes a victim.

My car needed a new gear box, so I ordered a hire vehicle similar to mine, 7 seater, while I waited for mine to be repaired, I got no notification of car arriving on site for over 3 weeks! No hand over, no documentation signed, nothing, I got to the car, it would not start, it also looked like a banger car, I put that aside, and used it as normal, due to the looks and no information on the car, I did not refuel due to the potential of filling up with the wrong fuel, they charged me just short of ¬£100 for 1/4 of a tank.......I sent emails explaining the poor communication and mis management from their side, but they took the money and told me it's in the terms and agreements, that I did not sign? Regardless of how many times I tell them, I did not sign anything. Clearly this is a failing company and will scam you out of any penny they can, AVOID find another firm to use.

Booked a vehicle at the weekend for Monday, it wasn't confirmed because of low stock for tail lift vans. I was moving house and had been let down by enterprise. Because they couldn't confirm I looked elsewhere, I didn't get any confirmation in time on Monday and had sourced another van. They have since charged me over ¬£100 for a no show fee. Having to section 75 it. Scammers.

To the female who was working today Saturday the 17th of august at the europcar trafford Manchester and who threatened my son with not providing the vehicle that was pre booked and then said he had but then had not passed the checks, then who tried to charge him more and who kept switching between customers (also threatening the foreign visitors) that both of them could be liable for up to a ¬£100,000 if they didn‚Äôt take additional cover , YOU ARE DISGUSTING , Europcar you need to take a long hard look at these google ratings and deal with this person, as soon as she was challenged on the phone she handed the phone back to my son and said she would not be hiring the van again you are VILE

Hello Joy Matchett,

We appreciate your feedback and we are sorry to learn you were dissatisfied with our service.

Give us the chance to solve the issue by providing more details using this link https://www.europcar.co.uk/contact-us/email where our customer service team will be in touch.

We hope to see you again.

The Europcar Team

I wouldn't go with them ever again. We got a letter, 6 wks after hiring asking for 80 quid for 2 x admin fees for traffic violations. No proof of anything , just letters of demand, or we'll use our solicitors to obtain.( who charges that much to forward 2 emails?) Our traffic fines were overturned, we advised car company, nothing. No acknowledgement, nothing. When we hired the car, we were told we were getting an upgrade, we got an Audi, totally unsuitable for 2 of us over 6ft 3.
Never again!!

I was provided with a vehicle with less than a full tank of fuel, and was advised to take a photo and return the vehicle with a similar level of fuel.

I did so and was charged an additional fuel as it wasn‚Äôt returned full.

The sort of service you‚Äôd expect from a two-bit outfit, not a multinational chain.

Will stick with Sixt in future, rather than this robbing outfit

My family and I rented a car for 4 days from Europcar in Bristol Airport. On return, it was checked by a member of their staff who confirmed all was fine. A day later I received an email with the receipt which had an additional ¬£45 charge, with no explanation as to why. I emailed their customer service team who said it was for soiling inside the vehicle and provided photos of the foot area of two seats. There was some dry grass and a little sand, nothing abnormal and certainly nothing excessive. I insisted on speaking with a manager and escalating my query as it was totally unacceptable. The customer service agent simply closed my case saying it was resolved. In addition, when I collected the car the fuel was only 3/4 full, not full as agreed, and there was large black scuff down one side (white car) which foolishly I cleaned for them! My partner and I hired a van to move house back in October 2023, and we‚Äôre unfortunately involved in a collision that was not our fault. The other party involved was arrested at the scene, and we have clear photographic evidence and witness statements of the incident. Despite this, Europcar have requested over ¬£1600 in damages be paid by us. We were told by Europcar that if we had paid upfront, we would have received the money back once it had been settled through insurance. It is quite clear that they have no intention of settling this through insurance, as this would have been a straightforward claim and taken weeks to settle, and has now been ongoing for 10 months.

Neither Europcar or their legal representation have respond to our emails. In April, we managed to get a hold of the acting solicitors by phone, where their employee acted surprised and compassionate about what we had to tell her and asked us to send a full account of all evidence, comms with Europcar and witness statements. She assured us that she would be putting the account on hold whilst they investigated further and she would ensure we received responses to our emails (which we never did). It is now 4 months since then, and we have had no update on the outcome of their investigations or notice that the claim had been re-opened. They have now sent draft court letters out of the blue stating ‚Äòmultiple requests for payment‚Äô - this seems unfair considering we were told everything was on pause.

Avoid this company at all costs. They are complete scammers and show no care or compassion towards their customers.

We were provided a car via our dealership due to a fault on our own car. we have had ongoing issues with this car and therefore have a lot of recent experience with hire cars from other companies. our experience with Europcar was awful.
First, we were delivered a car without functioning aircon, it took multiple attempts to contact europcar to notify them of the issue. We were passed between the AA, tyre repairs and general customer service instead of being passed to the depot directly despite using the contact number on our reservation paperwork. Once we did get through, they asked us why we hadn't taken it to Halfords to be fixed as if this is something we should have known to do with a car that is not ours?! We should not be responsible for the maintenance on a car that is not ours!

when the car was dropped off, we had no paperwork detailing the level of fueling we had received but we made sure all 8 bars of the gauge were full before it was collected. we have been charged for refueling costs. we were also not warned when they would be collecting the car despite being told on the phone that we would receive a message letting us know they were on the way, we could easily have been out or in a meeting.

overall terrible customer service and communication, we would never hire with Europcar again out of choice.

edit to add: weeks after this hire we received notification that we were going to be charged the insurance excess because the car required cleaning. no way to discuss this over the phone. no idea how this company still operates.

On arrival, we were told that the car we had reserved was not available and we would need to upgrade to get an equivalent. To be offered a car for ‚Ç¨80 a day on top of the money we had already spent was insulting. The courier then proceeded to run through all the insurance options recommending another ‚Ç¨480 to be spent which was more than the booking itself. Why is insurance not included in the hire cost? We were then told that the car had no scratches or dents on it. However, on inspection in the daylight the next day there were four significant scratches and marks on the car which I then had to phone to report, why had this not been picked up already? The whole experience has put me off hiring a car again in Europe again and I will be warning others of how poor the experience with Europcar was.

I had made an online booking for car hire to pick up from Edinburgh airport where I had travelled to with my wife and three children. There was no problems online booking the car, I am a memeber of Europecar and a previous customer and had only rented a car from a different branch around 5/6 weeks prior. We arrived really excited to celebrate or wedding anniversary and looking forward to explore the city. But things didn't go as planned. I went to collect the car and I was refused. I was told that I didn't meet the rental criteria, as they perform credit checks. Even though I am a returning customer I was not aware of this, when I had previously hired from a different branch there was a slight issue but this was to do with blue light card discount, no mention of credit checks at all. And even when I made the books online there was no mention of credit checks. After being refused rental, which I fully understand if that's the company policy and anyone don't meet the requirements then a car would be refused. The staff were limited in branch as to what they could do I understand this also but there was not alot of help given, and knowing I had three children with me. All I was given was a piece of paper with a basic explanation and an email address to contact to find out why. Which I did and I also asked a few questions non of which got answered, one of the questions I asked was to confirm what I had been told in branch that I WOULD NOT be charged anything for this rental, they didn't answer that, all I got in the form of a reply was a breif description about credit checks, non of which are done at the time of booking, and exactly the same letter I received from the branch the day of rental. I asked about being charged for the vehicle ij branch and I was told that the car hire would be cancelled their end and I WOULD NOT be charged anything. I have this morning noticed that I have been charged ¬£102 by the brach still, for a vehicle I could not rent, which is absolutely disgraceful. Be very careful when hiring, you will have to undergo a credit check, which is not done at the time of booking online it's only done in branch, if anything comes up you will not be able to hire and you will be left in a difficult situation and you will also get charged for a vehicle you didn't have. The original price for the car hire was more the ¬£102, it was around ¬£154, but we have still been charged ¬£102. I then on the day had to go around to different rental company's to find a vehicle, which luckily enough I managed to find one with no issues in renting at all, albeit it cost more money but we were in need of a vehicle.

Exceptionally poor service and system. Booking a car online does not guarantee you a car in Belfast. this needs confirmed by the station the next day. If the booking is refused because the car isn't available, they offer you a premium number to call, yes you have to pay for the privilege to being a customer. At the same time the system still sends you instructions to confirm your identity although you aren't getting a car.

The phone number for the branch, takes you to the main customer service, and again they do not know the availability of vehicles at the branch.

The company is extremely difficult to book with and contact, therefore I would avoid at all costs if you don't want to waste your time.

Dear Europcar Team, I hope this message finds you well. I am writing regarding my recent car rental experience in Barcelona, under reservation number 1177604295, from 5th July to 12th July. Firstly, I would like to express my satisfaction with the overall rental experience. The car and service provided were excellent, contributing to an enjoyable trip. However, I have noticed a discrepancy in the final charges that I would like to address. Upon reviewing my final bill, I discovered a charge of 108.51 euros labeled as a "cross border fee." When initially asked by the Europcar representative if I planned to travel outside of Spain, I specifically stated that I would not be doing so. The charges were explained to me as airport fees, but after referring to your website, I have found that they are indeed intended for crossing the Spanish border. During my trip, I did not travel outside of Spain. When returning the car, I inquired about these charges and was informed by the counter representative that the car's GPS would be checked. If no cross-border travel was detected, the charges would be refunded. As these charges have not yet been refunded, I kindly request that you look into this matter and issue a refund for the cross border fee of 108.51 euros. Thank you for your attention

Then they will trick you by saying the charge to upgrade is only 15¬£ more, without saying it's per DAY. They won't give you the time to read what you sign because they have to go on their lunch break.

Hired a car at Bristol airport. The service rep asked if we wanted extra insurance which I declined as we already had it independently. He then asked if we wanted Roadside Assistance cover and said it was "only ¬£5". Both my husband and I commented and questioned the amount, but he confirmed that yes it was just ¬£5 so we agreed. Stupidly I signed the agreement without checking it, assuming it was just for the car hire (which I had pre-paid) and the extra ¬£5. It wasn't until I got the final invoice after returning the car that I saw that the roadside assistance was not ¬£5, but was in fact ¬£5.81 PER DAY plus VAT, making a total of ¬£48.97. This was an added cost of 32%. I raised the matter with Europcar, but they were not interested in what the sales assistant told us, only what I had signed for. I consider this to be sharp practice, taking advantage of people who have had an early start, travelled a long distance and are anxious to get their car and go. This car hire was only for a week. Later in the year we will be hiring a car for a month, but it won't be with Europcar or any of their other companies, so for ¬£48.97 they've lost out on a future hire of around ¬£1300 and more on future hires.

We rented an MG HPEV yesterday. The check-in at the Milton Keynes depot was relatively smooth. So we drove off assuming all was well. Since it was the hottest day of the year so far, we specifically wanted AC. We followed the instructions and then realized that the AC was working but only blowing in the footwell. There was no cold air coming from the face (upper vents)--in fact no air at all. Given the heat, especially after the car has sat in the sun, it was uncomfortable to endure and possibly unhealthy, given the risk of heat-related issues. So we drove back to the depot, only to be told by Amanda that she already had two people with the SAME issue. They also wanted different vehicles because the AC in their cars (also MGs) was not working either. So Amanda said there were no other cars now available so they could not offer another. She also said there was no recompense since the AC is "not guaranteed," and that we were lucky since at least there was cold air and the customer who did get a replacement car had no AC at all. From this customer's view, it seems churlish if not deceptive that a car hire company is happy to take ¬£1000s and rent a car that is not 100% functional. Moreover, when we called to complain, customer service confirmed no recompense and suggested we take the car to the service department for them to "take a look." At that point I decided to write this review, given that after they rented us a faulty vehicle, they expected US to be inconvenienced and take time from OUR vacation to resolve THEIR problem. Last year we rented an Audi from Sixt here in MK and it was flawless, with zero problems. We made mistake choosing Europcar and will not be using them again.

After years of loyal patronage without any issues, I was unexpectedly charged for a tyre puncture that was not my fault. Regular maintenance checks should have prevented such occurrences. Additionally, an engine warning light was illuminated by the time I returned the vehicle. Despite promptly communicating with the company upon discovering the puncture and taking time out of my journey to have it repaired at a garage, I was charged ¬£14 for the tyre repair and ¬£40 for administrative fees. The customer service was unsatisfactory, as I received a charge instead of compensation for the inconvenience. It's important to note that the tyre deflation was not apparent within the first 24 hours of vehicle pickup, and it was only on the second day that I noticed and reported it. The vehicle's condition at pickup was substandard, posing a safety risk. For future renters, I recommend documenting the vehicle's condition through a video at the time of pickup. Be aware that if any issues arise after 24 hours that are not your fault, the company's response may be unsatisfactory and result in unwarranted charges. The fuel was also not full on pick up and they told me I would receive 10 credit. This obviously never happened..

I've obviously emailed multiple times to complain so their reply to this review means nothing.

Absolutely appalling service from Europcar. Will NEVER rent from them again. I was travelling to Italy as I am part of Andrea Bocelli's management team and he was performing a series of concerts featuring other big names in Tuscany - I needed a reliable car to navigate this very rural area. On arrival the initial car they tried to give me (which wasn't what I'd booked) had a busted wing mirror so I had to trek back from the car park to the terminal with two large suitcases to get a different car. Within 3 hours the car had a puncture to the front passenger tire. I'm stranded in the middle of a very rural area of Tuscany in the pitch black and there is no spare tire in the car, just a lovely empty space in the boot where it should be. Some kindly locals allowed me to leave the car on their land until the morning but it was an extremely dangerous situation to be in as a woman alone. The following morning I made various attempts to contact Europcar by phone and email, to little avail. Despite having taken out their premium coverage package no one seemed to care. I am still (7 days later) waiting for the callback they said would be 20 mins. My Italian colleague also made various attempts - apparently not even speaking the language gets you anywhere. At one point I was told a tow truck would come and take it (offering no replacement) but I needed to call him back with the full details of exactly where the car was located. On trying to call back I got a message saying the number was out of service. In the end I had to arrange for a local mechanic to tow it back to their garage and replace the tire. They said the tire d was already quite bald and Europcar should not have sent that car out as it was. It cost 300 euro to get it fixed which Europcar have seemingly no interest in reimbursing. When returning the car I told them the busted tire was in the boot, a member of staff inspected the car then told me my holding deposit would be taken because the puncture constituted damage to the car, despite the fact that tires are obviously subject to wear and tear, the mechanic had stated in his report it was unfit for purpose AND I HAD REPLACED IT AT MY OWN EXPENSE. Disgusting service.

After my new car arrived I returned the hire car 4 days early to a site that was near my new car pick up.
On arriving, they were not expecting me even though I made a call a day earlier to check where I could leave the hire car and charged me ¬£26 for returning it 4 days early to a different site.
I arrived at their Nechells Birmingham office early on Monday morning to be told they were not expecting me, even though I was told it had been recorded.
After arriving I was dismissed by the guy on the desk who said "one of our lads will deal with it" while he was clearly on a private call.

There are clearly customer service training needs here.

I recently had a very disappointing experience with Europcar and feel compelled to share my story to warn others.

On 6 July, I rented a Tesla Model 3 from Europcar at Heathrow Airport for a week. I prepaid ¬£394.04, which included the Basic Protection Plan. Upon arrival, I was in a rush to pick up my family and trusted the Europcar employee, Danielle, who assured me that the only extra charge would be a refundable ¬£510 deposit. I explicitly stated that I did not want any additional insurance.

To my surprise, when the invoice arrived, I was charged for:

Super Personal Accident Protection: ¬£56
Selection Protection Package: ¬£210
Roadside Assistance: ¬£77.03

These charges were never discussed or agreed upon. The total amount on the invoice, including unexpected fees like a Premium Station Surcharge and various licenses, did not match the initial quote.

This isn't the first time I've encountered such issues with Europcar. Last year, a similar situation occurred, and despite raising a ticket, I received an unhelpful response, forcing me to accept the unjust charges.

This repeated experience of hidden costs and lack of transparency is unacceptable. I feel deceived and let down by Europcar‚Äôs practices. I urge potential customers to be extremely cautious and thoroughly review every detail before signing anything.

Overall, my trust in Europcar has been severely undermined, and I won't be using their services again

Horrendous company, last year had one of the rentee's smash into my vehicle whilst trying to rob a shop and on drugs! Had to pay a ¬£1000 to repair my vehicle whilst it went through court. Court declared I must claim back the money from europcar, they have no interest in even engaging with me. Swindon branch has shown 0 interest as well. To add, sadly I have just been caught out by renting a car through Keddy Car (apparently a subsiduary of Europcar). My engineer was sick so had to change the Name, eventhough you cant contact Keddy Car, Europcar claim no responsibility, so I have just had to spend another ¬£200 on a new rental for today whilst losing the rental before...totalling ¬£300....Overall I have lost
¬£1300 to these con artists. Do the right thing europcar.

Extremely slow service. I waited a total of 1 and a half hours, first in queue to sign papers and then wait for a car that wasn‚Äôt ready. Was being cleaned. I could have taken the bus and been in my destination much faster. They also charged twice what I paid for the car in insurance and took a ¬£250 deposit. Poor service and will never use Europcar again.

As our flight was delayed, I called ahead to let Europcar know that we would be late to collect our vehicle. The man on the phone explained that, it is totally ok as as a courtesy, staff members stay at their desk for up to 2 hours after a booking is due. I asked if there was any fees involved. He said no, its free, flights are delayed all of the time, so we don't charge for it. Amazed and happy, we finally arrived at Dublin Airport only an hour after our booking.

As I approached the man on the Europcar desk, he asked us what did we want. I explained that we had a booking. He said that "he wasn't expecting us". I showed him my confirmation email with Europcar on my phone which he took. He said he was struggling to find us on the system. After a few minutes he said "you're late, that will be a 40 euro late fee". I explained the phone call I had had previously with a Europcar agent. He laughed at me and said "I have been working here for 16 years and I am a supervisor and I have never heard of this". I explained the phone call again in more detail, highlighting that the man on the phone said "there would be no late fee charge" more than once. The man on the desk asked "who did we speak to?", I explained that I didn't catch his name. He laughed again and said "if you don't pay the late fee, you are not getting the car, it's that simple". Hearing that I had no choice, I agreed to pay it.

He then asked to see my driving licence, which I handed to him. He asked how long I had been driving and I told him "11 months". He said that "you need a minimum of two years". I explained that when I was booking the car on the Europcar website, this was not stated. He said "it did say that, you just obviously didn't read the terms and conditions". I explained that I did read them and couldn't find that detail". He then asked to see the email on my phone and put out his hand. So I handed him my phone with the email on the screen. He then took 15 minutes just reading through my emails, going on to the Europcar website and attempting to book a vehicle, trying to locate the terms and conditions where it stated the 'minimum two years rule'. I could only see what he was doing on my phone by stretching my head over the desk. He laughed to himself whilst he did this and he said that he could not fid it. During this, he didn't say a word to us. My mum explained that she's tired as our flight was delayed by 5 hours. He said "so, I've been waiting here all night for you to arrive, how do you think I feel?". He handed me back my phone and using his own phone, quickly got up some terms and conditions stating the two year minimum. He then said "see there it is, you didn't read the terms and conditions". I again explained that I did, I just didn't see it". At this point, I said ok that's fine, we'll just get a taxi". He then continued to talk at us for 6 minutes all whilst holding my license in his hand. I gestured for it back and he ignored me and continued to talk nonsense. It felt as if he was doing it on purpose, to keep us there longer. He again complained that he was waiting for us all night and now we're not even getting the car, because I didn't read the terms and conditions, that we wasted his time. I said "I understand that we're not getting the car, will I still be charged?". He laughed and said "no, because you haven't got the car". I said "I know that, but what about the cancellation fee or late fee?". He said there would be no charge as they don't have my credit card details". I asked if I could please have this in writing, he said "no, no that's not up to me, that's up to the company".

He then said "if you go upstairs, you can get an Uber taxi for cheaper". He finally handed me back my driving license and as we were leaving he said his name was "Peter". (I am not sure if he was telling the truth or not). We went upstairs and there was nowhere to get a taxi from as it was 'departures' only, again, this felt like he did this on purpose. We eventually found the taxi rank on the same floor as the Europcar desk and left.

This is not a complaint that I couldn't hire the car, I accept the two year minimum. This is a complaint about the man on the desk, he was patronising and very rude! He also contradicted himself several times as first he "was not expecting us" and the next minute he "had been waiting all night for us". We will never be using Europcar again, absolutely appalling experience. Avoid!

and to anyone wanting to rent a car in Dublin, you honestly don't need it, the trams and buses are so frequent! and a lot cheaper than renting a car.

Gave me a vehicle with over 20 damage points. I asked the rep to show me around the vehicle so I can confirm all points were covered, he just said take photos. With the list so big it was impossible to confirm exactly what areas were covered on their paperwork.

I expect transparency and honesty from a reputable car rental company like Europcar. This experience has significantly eroded my trust in the company, and I will think twice before renting from Europcar again. I strongly advise other customers to be cautious and double-check any information provided by the staff at this location.

So after arriving at the hotel I tried contacting Europcar to at least get the process happening Sunday night so at least first thing we can get a new tyre for the car as we had places we needed to be Monday morning, once again after several phone calls I was told nope sorry nothing we can do to help you tonight call back after 8 am, are you kidding??, I now have to call again in the morning at 8 and who knows when we will get the car sorted. Will never ever hire with Europcar and will be making sure everyone knows about how they treat their customers

On 24 June 2024, we arranged to collect a medium size van at 10am from your Dartford branch (which is a 1-hour journey from our location).
Upon arrival to the branch at 9:30am, we were advised that the vehicle we had booked, and type specified was not available, and that we would need to wait until at least 11am for a vehicle of that size to be available. The branch could not confirm an actual time of the day the vehicle would be available - only that it would be a minimum 1.5 hour wait.
We advised that our schedule whilst using the vehicle does not allow such a delay, and that we should have been informed of this issue prior to arriving to collect the vehicle and travelling an hour to collect. The branch had been open since 8am that day.
The branch offered a smaller or larger vehicle as a replacement, but we advised them that we were specific in the size (height and width) of the vehicle that we had prebooked and prepaid a week in advance so this wouldn't be an option.
After nearly an hour's wait in the branch due staff seemingly having the same issue with various customers at the same time, they insisted that we took a larger vehicle to get us back to our location and that they would send a replacement (correct size) vehicle to us at our location by end of the day. We agreed to take the larger vehicle based on this agreement as we needed transport (an hour away) back to our location at the very least - but the vehicle could not be used for its specific reason for rental which was meant to be starting directly from the branch at 10am that day.
After wasting a day's vehicle rental/fuel, being delayed a day on our project due to not having the correct vehicle, and having to wait at our office all day for the vehicle to (allegedly) be replaced, we contacted the branch via telephone at 4:30pm to chase up when the vehicle would be changed over to the correct one (we had been waiting from 9:30am with no update). The member of staff stated that she did not know when this could be done, but it would be done by end of the day and somebody would contact me prior to the branch closing at 6pm and when on route to us.
At 5:50pm, there was still no contact from the branch, so we contacted them again, only to be on hold until 6pm and for the phone lines to then be cut off when the branch closed.
We then contacted customer service straight away, who were of no use to the situation and did not offer any reasonable solution to the branch and company not meeting their obligation. Customer service stated that they would send an email to the branch requesting that they call us urgently when re-open at 8am the next morning, and for a customer service supervisor to contact me shortly after our call.
No call from the branch was received the following morning, and nor was a call from a customer service supervisor that evening.
At this point we have now wasted a full day of our time, cost and vehicle rental being a 24-hour company.
Between 8am and 9am the following day (25 June 2024), we contacted the Dartford branch via telephone 4 times, only to be put on hold and cut off each time someone answered the call.
We then contacted customer services again, with the first operator stating that they could be of no assistance other than sending another email to the branch (which we can do ourselves) and suggested that we just travelled an hour to the branch directly to speak to them (which is an absurd request from a customer service agent!).
We were then transferred to a second operator who also advised sending an email would be their only assistance, but then attempted to contact the branch directly, and confirmed that they were also not successful in doing so various times. The second operator then confirmed that he had contacted a party from the branch indirectly and was promised that someone from the Dartford branch would contact me ‚Äúwithin minutes‚Äù. As expected with the current level of customer service from Europcar at this point, this did not happen, and no contact has been made.
We have now wasted two days of time, cost, and vehicle rental, with our project now being two days behind due to the branch or Europcar not fulfilling their obligation or supplying any sort of customer service.
At present, we have a vehicle sitting outside our office that cannot be used for the purpose we paid for, with zero customer service from the branch or call center.
