Under no circumstances accept the offer of an upgrade. As nice as the front desk people seem, "It will only cost..." is not the truth. I made it clear I did not want to pay an uplift charge just for changing one thing on my booking. I wasn't planning on changing my booking but Mike at the Europcar on Northern Perimeter Road offered me an upgrade car which I turned down. My wife said she would like to be added as an additional driver and I was given the offer of full cover insurance or an automatic for the same cost as adding my wife at GBP 20 a day. I chose the automatic and added my wife as an additional driver. I was surprised to find that rather than GBP 24 a day, the an addition GBP 60 was added. Do not sign anything until you have checked the paperwork they give you. There is no mention of an uplift charge, 19%, just the item and the total. Zero mention is made at the desk that there will be an exorbitant charge just because you make a change at the desk. I wrote to customer service and all that was done was to point out there is an up lift charge that is in the documentation. I challenge anyone to find it, especially when getting off a flight and tired. It should be made clear by the desk staff that there will be an additional charge above and beyond the cost of item added, for the privilege of accepting the offer of the desk staff.

This is underhand. It should be made clear verbally and the uplift charge pointed out in the documentation. Most people like myself would not accept it.

To add my wife as an additional driver is valid, to disguise it by offering an automatic or additional insurance cover with no extra cost as I was adding my wife and then charging an uplift charge for changing to an automatic is deceptive.

I wrote to customer service and I received a brief response that essentially said read the paperwork and the 19% uplift charge would not be removed.

I have been a Europcar customer for nearly 30 years. This is the last time I will book with Europcar.

Another word of warning. There is no paperwork to sign and note any damages or marks when picking up the car. I took photographs before driving off and asked for the paperwork at the gate before leaving. The response I got was unclear so I drove back into the Europcar premises and asked at reception. They said upload the photographs. I could not find anywhere to upload the photographs. Beware, after logging on to the website there is a paragraph that says the noted damages are printed on the documentation you receive. It is not obvious. Take time to take photographs and compare to the documentation you are given. In my case not all damages, scratches were noted and the description leaves the extent open to dispute. Ask the reception to come out to the car, note all the damages and scratches and ask for the paperwork to be updated and sign the new documentation.

Do not take anything at face value. Europcar will hide behind not telling you of the uplift costs and leave it open for dispute on any previous damages before picking up the car.

Very disappointed by the business practices. Be very careful and ask for a full breakdown of any cost above and beyond what you think you have agreed to, it is not clear.

Never use this company! Do not book via a third party (in my case Rentalcars.com and do not use Keddy - their budget brand where they farm out their knackered cars at reduced rate. I should also add that picking up the car at Manchester Airport took nearly and hour in a queue because there was only 1 then 2 and finally three staff. Europcar to my complaint - not our problem talk to the third party you rented from.

I was deceived by Europcar UK, and instead of paying ¬£366, I ended up being charged ¬£642! I never imagined being scammed like this in the UK.

The story is that I reserved a car for ¬£366 with basic insurance. I agreed and signed the contract. After paying the original amount plus 28 pounds, they also mentioned they needed to reserve ¬£400 for own risk, which I accepted.

Upon returning to the Netherlands, I received a bill for ¬£642. When I checked, it turned out that the insurance was actually ¬£28 per day, not ¬£4. Although the bill I signed indeed stated ¬£28 per day, I initially trusted their verbal claim and, being tired after my travel, did not double-check before signing.

This experience has been extremely frustrating. Please be cautious and carefully check everything if you choose to use Europcar. They were deceitful in my case, so ensure you verify all details before signing anything.

I did a booking with EUROPCAR with Carjet. EUROPCAR didn't offer me car telling I need to complete at least one year of licence in UK, even though I had license from home country since 2013. When asked about refund to EUROPCAR said they haven't received money from Carjet. I spoke to Carjet, they said they would need the money refunded from EUROPCAR. I have been having poor customer experience from both providers

On the morning of Saturday the 27th of April 2024, we arrived at Edinburgh Airport by 10 am as stated on the rental documentation to pick up a previously booked, paid and arranged hire car.

When talking to the Europcar, agent, Carol she promptly informed us that the class of car we booked and paid for months earlier, a VW Tiguan SUV, was not available or for that matter no other class of car in that category.

As a consequence, we were offered an upgrade, at greater expense ($1500 Australian dollars) to a Mercedes, C 200, which supposedly would accommodate three adults and our luggage plainly this solution was inadequate.
I, as the driver am over two meters tall (6ft 3inches) and with luggage having to be placed on the fold down seat directly behind me I could not move the seat back to a comfortable driving position and like my wife and daughter who took turns in sitting in the cramped back seat with luggage around them we had to regularly curtail our journey and stop frequently to purely to get out and stretch our legs.

No other options were offered and at no stage was the Europcar Reservation Guarantee policy mentioned by the agent which I have since found out in hindsight should have been enacted as we were according to the rental agreement documentation well within the stipulated time frame and therefore the agent and by default Europcar failed in their duty of care to me the client by not mentioning or enacting this clearly stated policy.

I feel that an unscrupulous tactic was used to manipulate us into paying more money so we could continue with our trip of a lifetime. We were stuck and I had no other choice but to comply if we wished to continue our journey to meet on going travel arrangements and accommodations.

As a traveller you would expect a large corporation such as Europcar to act in the best interests of their clients and not place staff incentives and profit before this.

Their subsequent response after a supposed investigation was that the class of car was available on the day (which it clearly was not) and because I signed the upgrade paperwork there is nothing they can or are willing to do to compensate.

Europcar are yet explain to me why would I logically and conceivably reject the class of car that was booked the VW Tiguan if it was available, which was specifically designed to accommodate our luggage and driving needs as we travelled on the Ilse of Skye to Dunvegan Castle, for a more expensive car with a lower profile, which did not fit our needs, that is just ludicrous and I was insulted by the accusation.

It is my word against Europcar agents, and I was deeply offended by the insinuation that I have somehow fabricated this whole story. I have been lied to and coerced into a more expensive upgrade; they are the plain facts.

I cannot believe in this day and age that a company like Europcar sanctions what is tantamount to basically organised theft.

To the Europcar Team don‚Äôt bother to try and placate matters by trotting out the usual link to your customer relations team to get in touch.
At last count, five different representatives of Europcar have come back with the same insipid response, because the paperwork was signed for the upgrade I have no recourse. Case #19808698 // #4482376

Let this be a huge red flag to people who are doing their due diligence by reading this review on this company who hide behind paperwork, employ manipulative tactics to force an upgrade with their own Europcar Reservation Guarantee and Consumer rights being ignored.

Avoid at all costs.

Arrived at Bristol airport by friends car to pick up a pre booked hire car. Europcar in the UK couldn‚Äôt complete the hire as we had arrived into the country by sailboat and didn‚Äôt have a departing flight.
The team were friendly but it didn‚Äôt seem like anything they could do as they said it was policy.
However I‚Äôve hired 2 cars in South Africa late last year through europcar with exactly the same documentation and no dramas. I also arrived there by sailboat.
So all very confusing. We were left high and dry and had to call back our friend to come and pick us up. Other companies at the airport were happy to hire us a car but it was up to double the price at such short notice.
Request europcar change their policy. Not everyone arrives by plane. People still sail boats around the world and usually need some transport when they get to their destination.

As you can see below. Europcar responded to this review by asking me to fill in a form with the details which I did. They then responded by email to say this was just company policy in the UK. Not sure why they couldn‚Äôt have just responded to this review with exactly that, but suspect there is an automated bot in play somewhere and they aren‚Äôt interested in genuine feedback on how they can improve.

Absolute waste of my time. Seriously.

We had an incredibly disappointing experience with Europecar. What made the situation even worse was the complete lack of effort from both the in-person staff and the help center over the phone. No one tried to find a solution or assist us in any way. We received no apologies or acknowledgment of the inconvenience caused.

Our weekend plans were completely ruined as it was impossible to proceed without a car, especially considering it was just before a bank holiday. We didn't have the chance to rent a car from another company at such short notice.

While we were refunded the money we paid, this did not compensate for our ruined plans and the frustration we experienced. The lack of customer service and the reliance on a malfunctioning system is unacceptable. We will not be using Europecar again and advise others to avoid them as well.

This service is absolutely dog poo.and they expect me to put 2 children in a car that had muck all over the seats they didnt even clean it til i had a go at them sayin in not drivin it.i had to take me other car back that was a rental from them .my tire blew out which wasnt my fault and there trying to charge me for it .when it should be covered by motability.i refused to sign and will be taking it up with my insurance .scratches all over the car muck all over the seats .rips in the car . advice would be not to go there.and go somewhere else .terrible customer service .there attitude stinks .and theres cars stink to .the woman said if i take it to quick fit i dont get charged but just because ive come with the aa there trying to charge me .how does that work .not goin to get charged for a tire if i took it there but cos ive brought it back to the compound with aa there trying to charge me. After comparing other rental sites we chose Europcar at Belfast airport for a family re-union in Donegal,Ireland. They offered us a great price with a small note stating there may be a surcharge if we cross over into Southern Ireland, and to speak to the desk on collection. In all my previous years I'd never heard of this but presumed its as a result of Brexit etc. and didn't think it would be significant.
At the airport all was going well until they informed us the cross border charge was around 140 euro (40+euro more than the cost of hire!) regardless of how many days we planned to visit. I complained that this was a hidden charge as we now couldn't cancel and look elsewhere (less than 24 hours notice). Most other companies only charge a one off fee of 30-40 euro so why was this so excessive and not advertised on their site. I guess its to attract people with a lower price then sting them at the airport. The lady at reception was not helpful offering that 'it's what the computer says'. When I enquired if the charge is a result of Brexit she even had the cheek to repeatedly call me Racist, trying to divert our complaint! Not a trustworthy company and very underhand tactics. I would not use them again.

Absolutely shocking company with no regard for the customer. Made one booking for a van a week in advance for the bank holiday weekend on the phone. Was told all confirmed and saw a pending transaction in my bank account (booking was made on a Sunday). Several days later I had still not received a confirmation email so called them up the day before I was to pick up the van - after struggling to find the booking they said it had been cancelled. However I had not received any notification about this (by phone, text or email). I therefore made another booking there and then for the following day, which I was told was confirmed, only to receive a very short voicemail from the branch a few hours later to say the type of van I'd booked was not available and no further explanation or offer of another type of van. This was late friday afternoon the day before i was due to pick it up. After being on hold while trying to contact the branch for about 10-15 mins the call was answered by one of the call centre staff for the whole company. I had to explain my situation again but was told there was nothing they could do, my weekend plans had effectively been ruined.

Fortunately I found a local van hire business with much better customer service (would definitely recommend looking for one of these before using Europcar). While making this final booking with the local company, which was extremely efficient, I was told that this kind of thing happens frequently as companies like Europcar will just take bookings, but as the prices increase towards the Bank Holiday weekend and other booking enquiries come in, they will cancel your booking which you made at the lower price while accepting the higher price agreed by the more recent booking. Not sure if that's true but it does make a lot of sense and my experience would certainly reflect that being the case!

When describing what happened to a friend who happens to be a lawyer, I was told Europcar appears to have been in clear breach of contract. It certainly seems they feel they can get away with it because you're an individual not a big company with their own legal team who would sue them would it happen to them. My advice is steer well clear if wanting to hire a van.

The afternoon before we were due to pick the car up, I got an e-mail saying my booking was cancelled because I have a non-UK address. On the day when Kennington branch called me, I asked for an alternative vehicle due to specific requirements, which they said was fine as they would phone round to other branches to check availability. I recently picked up a car from Europcar Oxford. I had pre-reserved the car with a guaranteed price including VAT. Reservation no. 1171278816. The staff informed me very forcefully that no travel insurance covered the Europcar excess, so I should pay extra for Europcar's own excess insurance. This did not seem correct to me. So I immediately rang my travel insurance company and was assured the large excess that Europcar had was in fact fully covered by my travel insurance policy. So I very clearly declined the Europcar's insurance for the excess. The car I had reserved was not available, so I was told I was upgraded to a larger car at no charge. So I signed the form and took the car. However, when I later looked at the paperwork, I had been charged GBP 405 more than the guaranteed price. I have tried repeatedly to contact Europcar Oxford, but they will not answer their phone. I contacted Europcar customer services UK by email, they gave me a case no. 19781003, but said they could not help as the car was not yet returned. I then rang Europcar UK and spoke to Chris, who tried to help, but said he could not access what charges had been made. He thought perhaps I had been mistakenly charged for the Europcar excess insurance that I had clearly declined. He tried to ring the Oxford office, as he said only they would be able to sort out the overcharge, but they would not answer their phone. He emailed the Oxford office and asked them to contact me, but they have not. So I have been charged an additional GBP 405 and cannot find out why or have it adjusted. I find it appalling that a large company like Europcar cannot be contactable to sort out problems. It is perhaps a warning to others that guaranteed price is not honoured at Europcar UK and the company seems determined to avoid any contact with customers who have any problems. I have found it so frustrating trying to contact someone at Europcar who can help. I cannot recommend renting a car from Europcar Oxford.

The story: i've rented a car on booking.com, pick up/drop off at Glasgow airport, and paid it totally online with full insurance. It was wonderfully cheap (5 days for 90GBP).

After the (successful) rental period, some days later I realized that i was charged an extra 173GBP, which was a surprise.

After some emails (booking.com responded fast, europcar usually with 4-5 days delay) i got the info, that i bought a premium insurance at the desk (at pick up), so they cannot help. The car had 2x insurances, according to their helpdesk: ‚Äúwith my verbal agreement and unable to comment further as I was not part of the verbal discussion‚Äù...

What?!

At pick up, the agent (who was kind by the way) confirmed, that it is paid and it has full insurance, and i said "yes, i know", because i have chosen the option "full insurance" at booking.com. This was the full conversation about the insurance.
He didn't offer any other one.
There was no "verbal agreement". It was a trap.
The paper, which i signed there, my copy contained one line on the 1st page (with very small font) about a premium insurance, but it seemed to be the paid one (for me). In fact, this was a new insurance, which was twice as expensive than the whole rental!

So my advice: read very carefully the paper at pick up, because they have put an extra, unwanted item in my case.

The guy in the parking lot was kind, but the communication after the rental process was not cooperative. They repeated the same answer (copy+paste), not responding my questions, slowly, and didn‚Äôt help the find the agent (or give direct contact) who could confirm the situation. I tried to call them (desk at Glasgow airport, with no success, waiting during the "please wait music" for a long time). The europcar UK was a wall, which I bounced back.

This case could ruin all the whole holiday. I have to focus strongly on the positive side of the trip, otherwise this ruins it fully. :(

Appalling service from Europcar we are motability customer and our vehicle was going in for repair this was arranged through motability the car was dropped off by europcar Leicester the car was absolutely discusting inside smelt like wet dog and had not been cleaned at all,we called the branch over 30 times without responce then called the customer service line who tried as well without response they eventually emailed the branch and requested a call back it took a further two days to come back to me, and when the duty manager came back to me he did not believe the car has not been cleaned and requested images I am still awaiting for a car to use very poor customer support if I had a choice I would not use this branch or company !!!!!

I've hired cars for three to four weeks a year for the past ten years from other hire companies without any problems. EuropeCar 'customer care' was the worst experience I have ever had. There was a minor problem with a tyre. The companies immediate response was defensive, aggressive and totally unhelpful. There was no help offered and the response was that it was up to me to resolve the problem. The whole experience was very stressful. I spent half a day making appointments and sitting around in a tyre shop to get a repair. Without any prior notice I was subsequently billed for repairs which cost about 40% more than the original six day hire cost.

I would never go near this company again.

I hired a van from Europcar. The previous user must have spilled a lot of solvent in the back because the smell was extremely strong and over my 3 hour journey I became very sick, with the symptoms of solvent intoxication: headache, nausea, dizziness, coughing and vomiting.

I tried calling the various "call anytime" support numbers to see if I could swap for another van, spending about 4 hours on this over 24 hours. I never managed to get anywhere with the support.

Even the "I've been in a crash" option on their phone system cut me off multiple times. Anyone I did speak to told me to call the branch I hired from directly, but could not supply a direct number - just various numbers which all took me to the same switchboard. They said the branch does not pick up to internal calls. At one point an advisor laughed at me asking her to stop referring to a "smell" instead of toxic fumes.

2 reps claimed to have emailed the branch and that I would receive a call back. I did not. Even when returning the vehicle the branch had no note of any issue.

Eventually, after spending the morning sitting outside the van with all doors/open to air it, I spoke to someone from the AA for support.

I definitely would not hire from Europcar again. I dread to think how little support would be offered in other emergency situations. They seem like a company who do not care about their customers at all.

Edit: I would add that I have already been in touch via email as suggested in the company‚Äôs response and they were not able to offer anything except a denial of any issue and a ‚Äúgesture‚Äù of 10% off a future booking. Which I won‚Äôt be using.

Waited in twice for 4 hours for car to be delivered. Fail to show up both times.
Then unexpectedly had keys posted through letterbox.
Car had a huge amount of undocumented damage to it. Photos had been deliberately taken to avoid a big scratch on the side. I assume that's why they just drop the keys off rather than phone me up and tell me the car was outside my house. Car was absolutely filthy inside. It looks like it hadn't been cleaned for weeks. Whole thing felt like a scam so I haven't driven it or accepted it as a vehicle that is fit for purpose. I'm still waiting for them to collect the unused car.

Over the course of a week I've had to phone Eurocar 26 times. And I still haven't had a car that is usable. The customer service is absolutely appalling. The only redeeming feature is that the internal complaints team actually do try and resolve things. Though they don't seem to stand a chance with this ridiculous company. I'm appalled by my experience.

I had pre-booked a Compact SUV and the location initially offered me a very dirty Compact SUV that smelt of smoke and had cigarette buds strewn around aside from being damaged externally. They refused to provide a different car claiming unavailability in the same category. They only offered a car, which was also filthy, from a lower category than the one pre-booked with no refund for the difference amount. By this stage, I had already spent 2 hrs over my original pick-up time. The least they could've offered is a higher category car with no extra cost for the sheer inconvenience caused to my family.
However, the alternative offered was to pay extra for an upgrade at the site. It was clear that they wanted unsuspecting customers to pay higher amounts at the front desk to maximise the rental output from their fleet.
After a 2.5-hour ordeal, I had to additionally pay nearly twice the amount of my initial pre-booked amount and cut short my rental period by 1 day to get out of there with a car to retain any sanity to enjoy the Bank holiday weekend.

I will say that the car that I rented by the end was thankfully in good shape and had no issues on the road.

Unfortunately, my overall experience on this occasion at this location was extremely disappointing and not the level of service quality I would have expected from Europcar.

While I have been trying to get in touch with their customer support regarding this grievance as per the canned response from their business account, I now see a whole new duplicate charge for the rental and fuel charges for a fully electric vehicle (a new level!). It is simply appalling for now I will have to waste my time chasing them to accept their incompetence (that they will deny) and hope to get the money back.

Absolute ripoff and a nightmare to go through as a customer. Initially we were met with smiles and a super friendly staff, but were lured into buying more services than needed, and informed a price that excluded VAT and extra hidden fees! (which is illegal when dealing with consumers). In addition, this "upgrade" included a deal to return the car 30mins later than usual, in order to match our flight. No problem! Staff was also super friendly when we dropped the car off, and the statement of return marked everything as okay and the car returned within the agreed time.

All good then? No. We got the bill and we're charged for a full extra day. Had to fight with customer service for a week, with arbitrary and standardized automatic responses which didn't take the rental agreement into account, or even listen to our complaints. Have spent hours dealing with outsourced customer service, since it's apparently impossible to reach the branch directly. Now we finally got them to refund the additional day. "A good faith gesture" (not a joke, actual quote).

But wait, it's not done yet. Now we're informed that they will charge EVEN MORE MONEY. Another full amount, of the full additional charges. And for me to patiently wait for an eventual refund. Basically asking ME for a 10 day credit. What am I, your bank? This is insanely poor business practices, and without a doubt illegal under EU consumer protection laws. But I guess these are no longer valid in Scotland? So. That's on us, then.

At the end of the day we paid TWICE the rate that we initially booked the car for, and for the next 10 days QUADRUPLE cost. Absolute shame.

And Susan at the Edinburgh branch, if you read this - please be a little more transparent with future clients, this simply isn't fair. I really hope you acted in good faith and that it's just the company screwing us over. This has been an immensely frustrating experience for us. Trust misplaced. Will never hire from Euopcar again.

In December 2023 my parked car was hit by a bin lorry. Whilst it was in the garage being repaired their solicitors arranged for me to have a courtesy car through europcar. The first car they sent had warning lights flashing telling me not to drive the car. I called the company to tell them and when I finally got through to them I was met with a very unhelpful woman who simply told me to 'take it to a garage'. I'd had the car 45 minutes! I refused and they eventually (after 4 hours of being passed to different departments) agreed to replace it with another vehicle. The next day another car was delivered and the broken one picked up, I checked the car for existing damage (despite being discouraged to do this by the delivery man who stated 'its a new car, there are no marks on it') and found no significant damage. From the second day of having the car I was harassed every day by them calling me to ask how long my car would take to be fixed, I made numerous calls to the garage to ask but was informed by the garage that europcar should not be harassing me to find out this information and to pass the garages details to them so they could get updates directly, but they continued to call me daily. My car was in the garage being repaired from 11/1/24 - 26/1/24.
I informed them when my car was fixed and being returned to me, europcar told me they would be picking the car up on the same day as they had allocated it to another client and would arrive before 6pm on 26/1/24. They never showed up or called (which I found odd seeing as id been harrassed everyday to have the car back) I even lost work waiting in for them. They called me on 29/1/24 to arrange pick up, I told them I would be at work but they could collect the keys from my mothers work place which is around the corner. The car was picked up at 13.15. The man picking it up said to my mum that he was in a rush as he needed to deliver the car to someone else and he was running late due to traffic. We heard no more.... until today, 25/3/24 (8 weeks later) when I received a very blunt direct email telling me that a scuff had been found on the bumper and they would be deducting ¬£582.15 from my bank account to fix it - There was no evidence of damage sent with the email, nor was there any photos or videos to show this damage.
I categorically know there was no damage at all when the car was picked up. The collection note I requested is partially hand written and has not been signed by me.
I am now in the process of seeking legal advise.
Seriously think twice about using this company!

UPDATE 29/3/24 - They reply very quickly asking me to follow the link so they can assist in helping me with this problem but the link constantly has 'technical difficulties their end' so you can't actually follow the link. This company need to be shut down, it is openly conning people.

Review:
My experience with Europcar at the Luton location was nothing short of a nightmare. Firstly, I was charged for premium protection that I explicitly declined, and then hit with a premium location fee that was never mentioned during booking. The icing on the cake? A known scratch on the alloy was somehow blamed on me in the report. Despite reaching out to customer service via email, I've received no resolution or even acknowledgment of my concerns. Avoid this place at all costs unless you enjoy being overcharged and unfairly blamed for damages.

As part of an insurance claim, was given a luxury Mercedes E-class Estate. However after about a week it was decided it was too expensive so Europcar took the Merc away and instead provided a Golf hatchback.

The Golf itself was fine however when it was provided to me it clearly stank of smoke underneath that awful stinkbomb they use to cover up smells. a day later the stinkbomb smell is gone but the smell of smoke is just as strong. The car itself had also not been properly cleaned. Clearly they rushed out the first available car to me with no care about cleaning the vehicle properly and dealing with the 2nd hand smoke that clings to the entire vehicle.

Would not be comfortable driving children in a Europcar.

No follow up has been made to my complaint.

I have attempted to follow the link provided but there is no option to speak to someone about this issue specifically or for customer service to get in touch with me. Furthermore when I do send in any communications it just says error try again.

Be very wary of using this company.
1. When we arrived in Malaga (Nov 23) they did not have the size of car we booked. We were then offered a higher spec car at what we both understood was Eu20 extra for the period. The assistant's English was good so there is no way both of us misunderstood. We agreed and naively signed the contract without adequately checking the small print which was actually Eu20 PER DAY, in effect doubling the cost of our rental. We only realised this when returning the car and checking the invoice.
2. By the same assistant we were told this black car had a scratch on the wing mirror. Luckily I checked and found 6 other much larger marks. I went back to the office to explain but they refused to come and look, just said take pictures to show on return. We did this with difficulty as it was in a dark area of the car park. On our return, sure enough there was someone checking the bodywork in bright sunlight, who picked up some but not all of the marks. Predictably enough they then tried to charge us the excess. We showed the photos but this was apparently not part of their system and only by arguing really hard and refusing to sign (luckily not catching a flight at that point so we could stand our ground), did they take off the excess charge. I suspect the next person will pick up that car, still with only one blemish noted and if they don't check and take photos themselves, they will be charged.

If there was a no star option for this review, I'd be using it. In my opinion this company uses underhand tactics to get more money from you and I do not trust them. If you do use them, check and question EVERYTHING.

Zero help from the customer service line telling me there was nothing they could do and they will cancel the booking with zero apology. Booked a van to move house, went to pick it up only to be told their weren‚Äôt any vans available as people had extended their rentals and they‚Äôd had a couple of catalytic converters stolen two days before. I can‚Äôt chose no star because they don‚Äôt deserve any star. I had the worst experience with them. I have rented the car from rentalcars.com and I did pay for the car online. The car itself was great however the condition and cleanliness of the car provided was completely substandard. The car itself was disgusting, smelt so badly of cigarette smoke (had to buy air freshener), dirty interior with sticky residue, mud and crumbs/general dirt everywhere.
We are awaiting the arrival of our daughter any day now and are so relieved that we did not have to use this car to bring our baby home.
If I had paid to hire this car I would have been greatly disappointed. It clearly had not been cleaned after the previous hirer and also had confidential documents of a previous hirer in the glove box, inc. name, date of birth and address which I also think is highly unacceptable.

I hired a car which was needed for work , hired the cheapest being a Corsa, the morning I was due to collect received a phonecall to say they did not have a Corsa but an MG which is an extra ¬£12 a day , I had to have it as I needed the transport so that was an extra ¬£60 I was not expecting to pay. When I went to collect I could not see the back of the car as it was parked so close to the car behind. I drove to work and when I got out I noticed a chip on the bumper. I called their office to say do you know this is on the car but they had no record of this. I knew there was a ¬£1500 excess on the car so I arranged for the chip to be sorted. This was far cheaper than them hitting me with the huge excess. I have returned the car but will not be using them again. I have now hired with another company who offer a lower excess .

Hired a car in October / November 2023. Mistakenly drove car through a "bus only during specified hours" lane on two occasions. As a tourist, and being unfamiliar with the area, these things happen. Not unexpectedly, an infringement notice issued for each, which I duly paid.
However I received a message from AMEX that Europcar trying to take ¬£40 out of my account (twice). Very sneaky trying to take money out of my credit card without even asking me or telling me what is for. AMEX blocked the payments. When Europcar eventually notified me, they said this was a "processing fee" for each infringement notice, asserting this is representative of the "loss and damage" they suffered as a consequence of the occurrence. What a crock! They suffered no loss. The fine itself was ¬£70, reducing to ¬£35 if paid promptly. I have paid the reduced fine so the "processing fee" exceeds the fine!
The claim amounts to a "penalty" which would be unenforceable under UK law, despite what the Europcar Ts and Cs suggest to the contrary. The scam works because it is cheaper for us poor mugs who live overseas to cough up rather than be followed up by a bunch of debt recovery lawyers.
Beware!
---------------------------------------------------------------

My boyfriend booked a car for Malta through Europcar as advertised through the website. He made this booking over the phone and received a confirmation email of the booking.

We arrived in Malta to be told that our car was given to another person because our flight was delayed by 1 hour and that to give us a new car it would cost an extra 81euros and extra 800euro deposit. They explained that because we had not given our flight number they didn't save the car for us.

When my boyfriend had originally booked the flight over the phone this detail was not given by the europcar assistant and this was not stated in the email. Therefore this is the mistake of Europcar.

We straight away rang Europcar and they said they couldnt get us a car because they werent associated with the Malta branch.... They said they would refund the initial booking.

Thankfully we could travel by taxi, this was an extra cost to us... they offered no solution. This could have been catastrophic if in a different location and a different time.

After out holiday we contacted Europcar because we had heard nothing about the refund. Europcar then told us that they had investigated the matter and we had to pay 95Euros for the cancellation... which we never made and not previously been told.

This is not what they told us on the day that we arrived in Malta, why then would we have chosen to cancel for 95euros when we could have just paid 81euros for the other vehicle....

So now we have paid 81Euros for the initial booking and 95euros for "the cancellation", for a car that we never got to use because of Europcars bad organisation. This is an absolute scam, Eruopcar have offered no resolution. Would not recommend, and would avoid at all costs.

Disgusted by Europcar's conduct!
We received a significant damage invoice after an incident with our hire car. Europcar's repair records show they received a 10% discount on replacement parts, however, this discount was omitted from our invoice with the replacement parts charged in full. Resulting in an overcharge of 200 euro before VAT.
Assuming this was a mistake, we advised Europcar the invoice should reflect the discounted repair cost that they paid. Instead of an honest response, we have endured months of back and forth emails where Europcar have made every effort to deceive us. First they suggested we were getting confused about the damage excess, waiver exclusions and even VAT. After sending them screenshots of their own documents, highlighting the section with "repair cost, discount, corrected repair cost", they responded with the same screenshot but cropped to only show the "repair cost" and stated they don't understand where we are seeing a discount in their records!!!
I am baffled by Europcar's blatant effort to twist their own records to profiteer from us. All other efforts to reach a resolution has resulted in 3rd parties just copying and pasting Europcar's rhetoric of "we have discussed this at length, the invoice is correct, pay it". We have succumb after receiving threats of legal action, which are not worth contesting as our agreement was Austria based. Instead I will never book with Europcar again and continue to warn others of their behavior.
Rental agreement: 3502028742 (22/02/23)
Damage invoice: 48000-166/23 (15/11/23)

Three weeks after returning from holiday in France we received a bill for ‚Ç¨682 for damage to the vehicle which we returned. We were told to take photos of damage at colleciton but after an initial inspection there was nothing of note. We returned the car in exactly the same condition at the end of the week and then received an email demanding payment. The photos of the car show a tiny 3 inch scuff to an unpainted bumper which could only be seen from a foot away if you crouched on the floor.

It's important to emphasize that this issue hardly qualifies as "damage" ‚Äì it's more akin to a minor blemish, a common occurrence on vehicles, including rental cars. Rather than incurring additional costs pursuing us, the reasonable approach would have be to continue renting the car in its current condition, documenting the tiny imperfection in your inspection records, as is typically done with most vehicles in your fleet.

Your continued pursuit for payment appears to be a predatory business practice, not driven by actual incurred costs but rather indicative of excessive corporate profiteering. The exorbitant fee includes of ‚Ç¨442 for labor associated with this minor blemish is both offensive and unreasonable. The actual labor required for such a minor issue is a fraction of this cost. Therefore, not only are you trying to hold us responsible for damage we did not cause, but you are also attempting to overcharge us with highly disproportionate labor fees.

My car was hit and the insurance company - Marshmallow, arranged for this rental car company - Europcar to provide me with a courtesy car. The driver delivered the courtesy car to my house but didn't ask for my signature, instead, he just inserted the keys into my front door mailbox and left. Ridiculously Europcar requested that I personally deliver the signed documents to their office (your employee did not ask me to sign the document in person, and now you are requesting me to personally deliver the document back to your office? Afterward my car is repaired, the garage delivered it back to my home without notice, and the staff of garage said he will drive the courtesy car back to their garage. Europcar will directly retrieve the courtesy car from their garage (I just immigrated to the UK, and I don't know if this is a normal practice, but the driver emphasize that it is normal in the UK, said no worries).

Two days later, I received an invoice from Europcar by email which is charging me for petrol fees. I can understand this, but when I returned home that day, I only discovered that the driver said he need to take the courtesy car away. At that time, I didn't think about returning the car with a full tank of petrol, and then I received a very unreasonable fuel charge.

I sent two emails to Europcar to express my dissatisfaction and explain the situation when I returned the courtesy car (I understand that I need to return the courtesy car with a full tank of petrol, but the problem is I had no idea the garage driver would suddenly ask to take it away). I requested that the fuel cost be charged based on the actual market price, but I did not receive any response. After that, I returned to my hometown for three weeks. I did not receive any email, phone call, or SMS reminder from Europcar during that period.

When I returned to the UK, I received a letter from Shakespeare Martineau which is pursuing the debt on behalf of Europcar, with a late payment charge of ¬£40. From day one I have never received an original invoice from Europcar, only electronic ones, which do not mention any penalties for late payment.

I finally settled the invoice payment to Shakespeare Martineau before the deadline. At the same time, I emailed the payment receipt to Europcar and Shakespeare Martineau, emphasizing repeatedly that the ¬£40 late payment charge is unreasonable. I won't bear this unreasonable charge.

Two weeks have passed and I just received an email from Shakespeare Martineau, saying that I haven't paid the outstanding debt. Today, I called Europcar to inquire about it, but the staff said they don‚Äôt know what‚Äôs happening and asked me to call another number for further information. And then I waited for 20 minutes, and in the end, they asked me to leave a message saying they would call me back.

I have been living in the UK for 2 years, and sincerely, many of my friends have had to contact insurance companies for claims due to traffic accidents. Many of them say that Marshmallow Insurance Company's handling of insurance claims is poor. I really didn't expect it to be this bad. I am the victim, my car got hit. The other party says it's a company car and asks me to claim compensation from their insurance company. I didn't expect that later on, Marshmallow, the law firm and Europcar would all constantly seek opportunities to charge fees from me or the other party. This is simply an all-in-one scam that insurance companies have taken advantage of government regulatory loopholes and expanded. Under the guise of claims insurance, actually providing various services under different pretexts and then charging exorbitant and unreasonable fees.

I will give Europcar a negative review and raise awareness to their opaque operations. In any situation, whenever individuals file a claim with their insurance company, it is always the citizens who end up being the victims while these businesses benefit.

Following this awful experience and came here and read reviews that stated that the company try to scam you out of fuel money when you return the vehicle. Having read these reviews I kept a copy of the transaction at the petrol station where I filled up one mile from the drop off location and took time stamped pictures of the fuel gage clearly reading full at the drop off location.

I receive an email a few days later and the reviews are true to their word. The have charged me ¬£18 for fuel. This is a scam company and I would avoid them at all costs. If you cannot avoid them then I would say ensure you collect all evidence of fuelling up but that has made little difference.

After another car hire company let me down I walked into Manchester Airport Europcar and asked if I could hire a car on the spot. The young man went and spoke to his manager and then came back and said yes he had a car available.
This is where the misleading begins.
I asked for 3 days - Wednesday to Saturday morning - He put 5 days on the order
He mentioned a full tank of petrol from Europcar - I refused.
He mentioned NOTHING else. My other hire was 56 GBP for 3 days - He quoted me 515GBP for 3 days
He then said I was a privileged customer and he could discount that to 428 including a 100 GBP deposit.
All the while indicating this was the cost of the car hire for 3 days
It wasn't -
He'd added
2 extra days
Premium Protection 5 days - 173.49 GBP
Roadside Assistance 5 days - 65.47 GBP

Begrudgingly I agreed to the amount of 328 + 100 deposit thinking this was the price of a car last minute in the middle of a rail strike.
He then pointed to certain x parts on the form to sign - I duly signed NOT realising he had added these EXTRAS.
After getting in the car and driving home I double-checked the paperwork and was gobsmacked the actual hire cost for what I had ordered should be 45 GBP
He'd managed to slide in 239 GBP of extras (days and extras)

I immediately called the bookings line of Europcar and this is where they really DO NOT CARE - AT ALL
Call 1 - Put the phone down after my explanation
Call 2 - Took my details but no reference number - Also said he could amend a booking to be bigger but could NOT amend a booking once it was paid even if it was wrong
Call 3 - Customer services - he eventually made a case but had no details in it and kept me on hold for a very long time.
He would not give me any option to escalate
He only gave me the standard CS email
He also would not amend the booking even though we were 3 hours into the hire. He said he couldn't do anything once it was signed and paid for.
His comments were "You should have checked the booking before signing it" - Quite rudely

In that he's correct -

With Europcar I as an unsuspecting customer would expect to be misled - it seems an established practice to sell extras
I would expect they add details that you never discussed and never asked for
Do NOT sign anything until you've checked the dates, days, and extras plus the car.
Europcar is comfortably in my experience the worst hire company operating in the UK. I'd avoid them at any and all costs. It cost you an awful lot of money as I'm finding out.

It has been a month since my complaint with no follow-up - and to add to the insanity they've just billed me ¬£32.86 twice! No reference as to what this is, both payments within the same minute so likely a duplicate too!

I would never deal with this company again. I booked a car for a ski trip from Munich airport. Our flight was delayed and then we had to wait about an hour for our bags. When we arrived to collect our car they had given it away. This was very late at night and we then had absolutely no choice but to accept an ‚Äòupgrade‚Äô at an additional cost of ¬£240! Calling it an upgrade was a joke in itself, the windscreen wiper on the driver side was damaged and you could argue illegal! Their first suggestion was a tiny car, now as we were stood there with a massive snowboard bag you would assume that was just an entirely stupid suggestion. Driving on the autobahn with no wiper was incredibly dangerous and meant us stopping several times to try and fix it. This is after spending about an hour debating with the totally useless assistant on the desk about getting a car. Customer service is non existent. I suspect a cheap call centre somewhere with standard replies. The team on the desk were hideous to deal with too.
Reading a lot of the comments on here and on social media there seems to be a theme of lack of customer service, but also, and more worrying, a culture of charging people who have no choice or chance of getting any money back. I rented an automatic MB CLA 200 AMG LINE PREMIUM COUPE (PDAR) or similar (or similar) for 664.57¬£ for 9 days.

I go and check the car tyres and not only they were all summer tyres, but on top of that they had 3 tyres from a different brand out of the 4. This is a NO GO even if the car has AWD and it's absolutely illegal in many countries all over the world (but not in the UK).
I came back and asked to be given another car and price difference refunded.

Of course i couldn't check what the correct price would have been within their parameters by making a simulation online in their website but i knew i was definitely for sure getting scammed and i had no other choice than pay and go away.

I booked a van to pick up some furniture. I used the Woodford Green office because it was close to my house.

I took a picture of the dash to ensure the mileage and fuel were recorded. I also noticed some existing damage on the van which the salesperson did not highlight so ensured this was recorded.

I drove 344 miles which meant I exceeded the 250 mile cap by 94 miles. I was prepared to pay the 17p per mile which should have equated to ¬£17. I also filled the van with diesel to the same level as I received it. When I returned the van the following morning at 8am, the staff had not yet arrived. I waited until 8:30 the before someone processed my return using a mobile phone application because the office was still closed.

A week later, I receive an invoice from Europcar stating that I‚Äôd driven 339 excess miles and was also charged for additional fuel and a fuel surcharge.

This is downright theft. Instead of paying ¬£64.50 plus the ¬£17 for additional miles, I was charged ¬£189.24. What a disgraceful company.

I arranged for a car to be delivered, on the day I received an email saying my booking had been amended. I phoned and was told it would still be delivered as ordered. No delivery took place. I phoned, the branch was closed and customer services said I should ring back in the morning.

I phoned back the next morning (twice) and customer services couldn't get through to the branch and would not provide me with a direct phone number to the branch. I was assured I would receive a call from the brand asap.

At 9.28am I received a email confirming my booking cancellation! What a really poor customer experience from start to finish.

Found a vehicle online via a comparison site. Rang Europcar direct to arrange booking. Went through procedure of hire. I was told I needed to provide a check code which entailed me contacting dvla, enter my licence and national insurance numbers. I did this so that on collecting vehicle, counter staff could check my licence for endorsements.
I paid for hire with credit card and arranged to collect vehicle from my local depot.
I received a phone message a while later informing me that my local branch had no vehicle of any description available to hire at the time and my reservation had been cancelled.
Why take my booking? Their system obviously showed a vehicle was available otherwise my request should have been declined.
The booking system is long winded, irrelevant information required and they were unable to provide a service I requested.
I hired from another national company. The process was straightforward without the need to provide a check code.
I will not be using Europcar to hire a vehicle again.

I got an invoice for fuel by email. At no point was I told that it would be debited from my credit card. Therefore, I paid by cash transfer to their bank account. I raised the issue a month ago by email as I was travelling in Europe and included copy of credit card statement and also the transfer. They told my that they had only received 1 payment. I have disputed this but am still yet to receive a response!!!! NOT HAPPY!!! Their customer service leaves a lot to be desired.

Avoid this Company like the plague, I was charged ¬£34 for 8 miles of driving, the car came with a flat tyre and being Disabled I had to ring my carer to inflate it before I could drive it.
I went to the Doctors to collect a prescription and on return the vehicle flashed up a warning emergency maintenance required so I rang them and the AA arrived stating that the vehicle needed to go in to main dealers and not to be driven.
They sent a guy who drove the vehicle away after i advised him that it was not to be driven but he just went ahead without any care whatsoever.
I then had ¬£34 taken from my account for use of fuel for delivery and collection, I have queried this but they say it‚Äôs right and will not be refunding me.
They are nothing but Sharks and need reporting to trading standards which I am about to do after writing this review.
If you need a vehicle desperately, use someone else or take my advice and walk it it‚Äôs cheaper.

I would actually like to give no stars! Extremely bad service and follow up from customer services! Lots of hidden charges they don‚Äôt tell you about. I returned car with a full tank of petrol, as stipulated, but as I had used delivery and collection service (which doubled the cost of the car hire). They then charged me for petrol to their office and a refuelling charge. The office is 10 miles from my house yet they charged me for 18 miles! When I queried this with customer services, I was told this is their final decision and it‚Äôs not up for debate. They also did not collect at the stipulated time. I rang and explained that my son had been in a serious accident and I needed to get to hospital so couldn‚Äôt wait around indefinitely for them to turn up. They never arrived that day and turned up the next morning. As a result of waiting for replies to my emails to customer services, they now tell me I‚Äôm barred from using their services again..well guess what Europacar, I never would!

I rented a car to make a trip and everything was ok until i received a penalty fee. As i did not want to drag this for long, i've just paid it along with the admin fee.
After some time, i started to receive letters from a collection company threading me that they were going to take me into court if i did not pay that (keeping in mind that i already did when requested). I sent them different emails with the proof of payment but they either took months to reply or they were still asking me to pay that even with the information i provided (and also adding on top late payment fees)
At this point, they still want me to pay exactly what i paid once and ignoring the payment proof i sent them (i have also told them that if they continue with this they will ruin my credit score for something that is not right but they did not care).
I also called customer service but they did not care about my case and never came back to me.
If you don't want a headache, never hire this company.

My car appeared to be fine on pickup apart from the fact that the car play didn't work via Bluetooth and had no Satnav. I bought a cable and was able to use it so this was not a problem. It drove fine but the windscreen wipers needed replacing and the right headline needed replacing (not good in the weather conditions over Christmas).

The following morning I went to set off on a day trip to find the middle seat belt didn't work. I had to drive for one hour with a passenger loose in the car. I called into Europcar to see what the problem was with the seat belt. They told me it was faulty and couldn't send me home in the car or they would be liable. They then gave me another car. This one didn't have a working car play either and it required a different cable. It was late at night, raining and dark. I had no idea how to drive home and didn't want to with my children in the car when I had no idea where I was going. They agreed and offered me a third car. I had to wait for this car to be refuelled. When it arrived, I transferred my luggage again. Did the paperwork, again. Got my baby in the car, again. The middle passenger then got in to discover there was no seat belt. The staff had a look and couldn't find a seat belt. I had to get my baby back out and all the luggage while they looked.
After thorough searching with no luck, they decided to offer me a fourth car. Whilst transferring my luggage, they finally found the seat belt on the third car.

By this time, we had been there for 2 hours. My children were cold, hungry and tired. I took the third car. I explained to the staff that I would be making a formal complaint. The service I received was shocking. However, the worst part is that I was given two cars that had clearly not been checked properly. I had to drive off in a car that I didn't feel was safe, with my children inside. The staff are always very keen to check for bumps and scratches but is anybody actually checking the safety of these vehicles? Clearly not.

I was charged for an upgraded vehicle I had not booked nor requested, nor informed would incur an additional cost. My signed copy of the agreement makes no mention of upgrade costs. Their signed copy does. I accept that I could have read the 4 page document more thoroughly before signing, however with 10 people in queue behind me it didn't seem prudent at the time. When I queried the additional charge later I was made to feel like an idiot by the person on the phone and then hung up on mid-sentence. I had not raised my voice, nor been aggressive. It's not the cost. It's the immense disrespect shown by the phone operator when I queried it that concerns me. I had read many reviews about the customer service being very poor but assumed it was just angry, irrational customers. I now know those reviews to be true and made by rational people like me who were treated extremely poorly.

Europcar were asked, by Zurich Insurance, to provide a car similar to an Audi SQ7 while mine was being fixed. The first Europcar representative offered a Mercedes GLE (not really the same standard as the SQ7), then put us in touch with the local Europcar provider (Oxford Prestige) who then said the nicest/largest car they had available was a Volvo XC40. We agreed that they would arrive at 11am as I had a meeting at 10am. They arrived at 10:15am in the middle of the meeting and said I could just sign a form to take the car. The form stated 'No damage'. I inspected the car (taking photos and video) and found many chips and paintwork blemishes. I did not have time to look inside the car. Later this was found to be dirty, smelt of strong air-freshener and had exposed wires under the seats which my children were able to grab.

Europcar requested feedback through a website, which I provided and they asked if I would like to post my review on-line. On selecting this option, it redirected me to the French Trust Pilot site.

If your insurer recommends Europcar to provide any kind of courtesy vehicle, I suggest you ask them if they have an alternative provider.

However, we have now noticed that both of us have been charged, totalling more than twice the cost of our original booking. Also to our disbelief, the invoice listed the agent‚Äôs quote as an upgrade IN ADDITION to the original cost.

I find it completely unacceptable as we did not expect to pay more than twice the amount for an upgrade that we had thought was offered to us as a gesture of goodwill. I would like to request a refund of the upgrade.

P.S. got reply from their customer service rep who simply told me that they had charged the correct amount and the upgrade indeed cost over 50 pounds EXTRA. It's ridiculous given that the agent told us that she was giving us a half price discount and the cost of similar models are going for only about 100 pounds per day based on their website. Besides, should the agent have pointed out that my orignal visa payment was not going to be reversed as requested and the upgrade would cost more than DOUBLE the original price? It's pure greed and deceit. I will continue to escalate this matter.

I have purchased a 3-day rental car package online from Edinburgh Airport, and I was directed to Europcar. Upon returning the vehicle, Europcar charged me an additional ¬£264. Be cautious, as this appears to be a fraudulent practice. I have attempted to contact the customer service of both companies without success and am currently seeking legal counsel to pursue a legitimate refund of my money.

I've been a loyal Europcar customer for a decade, entrenched in their "privilege" program. Little did I anticipate the day I'd find myself compelled to compose such a review and sever ties with this company.
The Norwich office, once a paragon of exemplary customer care, manned by individuals genuinely invested in their roles and clientele, has regrettably lost its former luster.
In a recent incident, I scheduled a car rental for collection at 11:00 am today, to be returned on January 2nd. Arriving at the Norwich Europcar station ten minutes prior to the appointed time, I was informed, to my dismay, that there were no available cars, necessitating a 30-minute wait. The staff member at the desk, a commendable professional I had dealt with for years, suggested an automatic car as an alternative, a proposal to which I acquiesced with gratitude.
My husband and I took a brief stroll and returned after 30 minutes. Although the documents were prepared and the contract duly signed, I was informed of an additional 15-minute delay. Patiently, I waited, only to find that after the specified time had elapsed, there was still no progress. Approaching the desk for an update, I was met with an unexpected turn of events.
A recently recruited staff member, a young woman I had encountered on a few occasions but never interacted with directly, made a call and casually informed me of an extra 10-minute delay. In jest, I remarked, "Maybe I should consider AVIS next time," given their proximity at Norwich airport. In response, she retorted, dripping with condescension, "You are welcome to go."
Incensed but still patient, I endured another 10 minutes before deciding to abandon the endeavor. Fortunately, the same experienced employee who had initially assisted me promptly canceled my booking without imposing any charges. It became apparent that he understood my frustration after waiting an exasperating 90 minutes for nothing.
As the Managing Director of a company in London, I can unequivocally state that any team member uttering "you are welcome to go" to a customer would swiftly find themselves out of the office. This holds especially true if the customer's remark was light-hearted and well-intentioned.
It's disheartening to witness Europcar discard their stellar employees, who epitomized customer-centric values, in favour of individuals lacking in both manners and comprehension of what "customer care" entails. After more than a decade of patronage, I've decided to make a change. If Europcar demonstrates indifference towards its customers, why should customers reciprocate with care for the company?

Beware, scam! Despite explicitly stating I do not wish any additional insurances or addons on pickup I was charged 110 GBP after the rental for several things like breakdown insurance, driver insurance etc. I already contacted customer support and they were unwilling to help in the matter. Very unfortunate that I will have to resort to a credit card chargeback. Clerks are trimmed to try and hide extra charges so you sign the contract without noticing them. It is bad enough they try this with people who do not know about this but it is REALLY bad when you explicitly decline and they still put it on the contract and then hide the section by conveniently placing another sheet of paper on top of that section of the contract. I only noticed until after I signed but then it was "too late" because I had already started the rental. I thought this was a reputable company... Stay away from Europcar!

I am writing to express my disappointment with the van hire service I recently experienced with your company. Unfortunately, my rental on 7.12/8.12 was marred by several issues that need urgent attention.

1. The van was provided with an empty screen wash, and upon its return to your garage, I was informed that a broken pipe was the cause. This oversight is unacceptable and raises concerns about the maintenance standards of your fleet. (The manager of the Bristol branch came outside and noted the faults in person)

2. The wiper blades were below the legal limit, causing damage to the screen and functioning with noticeable shuddering issues. This not only compromised visibility but also posed safety risks during my journey.

3. The AdBlue levels were low, triggering warning sounds that indicated the need for topping up. Proper maintenance should have prevented this issue, ensuring a smooth and safe driving experience.

4. The near-side front indicator was not operational, posing a safety hazard and indicating a lack of quality checks before releasing the van for hire.

5. The driver‚Äôs overhead cabin section contained a mouldy banana and half-eaten doughnuts. The foul smell became apparent only after driving with the heating on. This lack of cleanliness is unprofessional and unpleasant for customers.

6. Further complicating matters, the plumbing piping within the vehicle‚Äôs wall lining was visibly old and retained smelly water, causing damage to personal belongings. I brought this issue to the attention of your manager during my visit to the garage.

p.s we only became aware of the above when we were a distance from the rental premise and committed with moving house

Booked and paid for an intermediate SUV over a month ago, I was ready to pick up the car in the morning, 1 week prior to Xmas. I chose to pay in full and a month prior, to safeguard the reservation due to the Xmas busy period.
1 hr before picking up, as I was travelling to the hire car office in Sheffield Parkway, they called to tell me that they only had a large 9 person people carrier, ie a mini bus!
I had no choice but to accept this as I knew by cancelling I'd receive a refund, but extremely unlikely to find an alternative 1 week prior to Xmas
The minibus was completely inappropriate fur a small family, I struggled to find parking spaces and it was a terrible experience that ruined our holiday
I was told it was due to others extending their bookings that I didn't get what I paid for..... Huw can they extend if I'd got a car booked!?!?
They are blindly taking payments but knowing they don't have the supply to fulfill my reservation. The 1 hr call prior was sneaky - knowing full well I'd not have a choice...and the office staff should be reviewed on that practice
In short, try somewhere else... Obviously this is a company policy, so you're not going to get what you paid for.

Charged for mileage I did not drive. My new Mercedes went in for warranty work. MB are now using Europcar to provide a replacement vehicle. Bit of a fuss sorting but managed. Car delivered full. Charged me for fuel despite me returning the car full to the brim (filled to the point where pump cuts out and then drove it less than a km to the Europcar site). The thing that made me really angry is that it wasn't mentioned on checkout. The employee just waved his mobile phone at me and asked me to sign in the box with no explanation of what I was signing for. I only found out about the fuel charge two days later when I received the invoice via email. Luckily I have photos from when I picked the car up that shows the fuel gauge reading 7/8 when they said it was full. It looks like the gauge on the car under-reads. But there's no way they could have put 6 more litres in the tank after I returned it, which is what I was charged for. Annoying experience that could've been avoided by either a) being aware that the gauge on their car under-reads or b) having the conversation at checkout rather than just smiling, pretending everything is fine and then hitting me with a charge the next day.

This is just blanket dishonesty and I‚Äôm shocked by the total lack of respect for customers. My partner and I rent cars from Edinburgh airport about 5 times a year. Never had an issue with a UK car rental company, until now - Merry Christmas I guess.
- we pick up a car.
- lady at the reception tells us to fill fuel back to existing level (3/4 full) on return.
- on return 3 days later, we check the paperwork to double check, before going to petrol station.
- the paper work does not stipulate level of petrol at check in, so we take the word of the kind lady at reception, and fill it back to 3/4 on the nose. I have a photo of our rental agreement and the staff did not circle the fuel status‚Ä¶
-we arrive at drop of point to an unstaffed unit (all other companies had people there helping). No problem, we drop the keys in the letterbox and go get our flight.
- two days later we receive a charge of ¬£20 for fuel, and ¬£18 to fill up plus tax, so another ¬£40+ quid. Apparently we need to fill it to the top? Despite it being only 3/4 full when we got it? Is this really the policy? If yes this is a total scam

As I say, we have a photo of rental agreement without any direction on fuel level, so hopefully this is resolved quickly.

Just FYI at Edinburgh airport there is an Avis and Budget car rental. We have used those before and never had any issues, they provide clear instruction, and honour their word and do not try and scam their customers. We will be using them next time and suggest anyone reading to as well.

Also I haven‚Äôt even got to the excess cover option on the insurance - at check in they tried to double our rental cost with this (¬£25 a day!!!). At this point I am starting to think it is just a racket‚Ä¶

An expensive, awful experience. In my opinion, no matter how much you think you may need something moving, or even if you‚Äôre just desperate for a vehicle quickly, you should avoid Europcar.

We rented a van in October this year for a single day & didn't pay for the additional 'premium protection' offered. On the day, the staff at the front desk were helpful and the process of actually picking a vehicle up was quick & easy.

We were given a much larger van than we had paid for, as this was the only one available & unfortunately I caused some minor damage to the side of the van (knocked off a plastic protector panel with some reflectors).

After hearing nothing for 3 months, we finally received a bill from Europcar for ¬£1,500 (the maximum I could be charged) for damage caused; the attached invoices included a figure over ¬£2,000 to fix a small dent in the van!

Anyone with basic knowledge in this area can tell you this is an absurd & ridiculous amount for such a repair. My assumption is that such inflated figures exist purely to ensure people hit their maximum excess when causing damage of any sort.

We'll never use this company again. Though they've earned so much money just from a 1 day rental, I'm sure they won't mind losing another customer.

Thank you for contacting Europcar Customer Services UK.

We understand that the condition of the vehicle did not meet your expectations, and we deeply regret any inconvenience or disappointment this may have caused.

At Europcar, we strive to provide our customers with clean and well-maintained vehicles that are in excellent condition. However, it seems that we fell short of our high standards in this particular instance.

We take customer feedback very seriously, as it helps us identify areas where we can improve our services. Rest assured that we have already taken immediate action to address the issue and prevent any recurrence in the future. Our team is conducting a thorough investigation into what led to this oversight, and appropriate measures will be implemented to ensure that such incidents are avoided going forward.

Whilst I appreciate you have stated that the vehicle didn't come with a full tank, I would be unable to comment further as I was not part of the verbal discussion. As the rental was in Spain, your contractual agreement is with them, we can only act as mediators in instances such as this, so in the event that the two parties are in disagreement our decision can only be based on the documented evidence.

As the State of return form have been signed, in acceptance of the state of the vehicle upon pick up and drop off, the request for the full of the hire refunded has been respectfully declined. If you need to escalate this further, please contact them directly

Please accept my sincere apologies for any inconvenience caused by the appearance of the rental vehicle. We value your business and appreciate your understanding in this matter. We remain committed to providing you with exceptional service in the future.


Regards,
Aleksandar Slavov

We rented a car twice in London City Airport and it all went smooth. 3 months later, both times, we were then charged because of some damage. The trick they do is that - if you don't return the car when someone is there, they simply charge you as no-one can prove you didn't do it. We thoroughly checked the car both times before leaving and there were no scratches at all. Funny enough the scratch only appeared 3 months later - god knows how many people used that car meanwhile. There's no point in appealing because they have 1000 clauses - so if anyone know from CS try to say " can you please give us your reference no. etc" - sure, nice to show that you care, but there has been months of conversations while our money was taken instantly

In summary, make sure that you return the car when there's someone there to check it with you as otherwise they will scam you

TLDR: Mostly unimpressed!

I will give them that it was relatively easy to book and pick up, however there were several things that left us very unimpressed and unlikely to use them again. First of all the van we received had a headlight out and no windscreen washer fluid. They told us to go to Halfords who sorted it but we really shouldn't have been given a vehicle with these issues, especially as we picked it up in the dark and the employee left so swiftly that we didn't have an opportunity to mention it by the time we'd realised.

The other issue was about their booking system and extra charges. Their booking system let us book the return time as 9pm without informing us that there were additional charges for returning a vehicle out of business hours, it showed us a charge for the duration of the pickup to drop off times as a set price implying that the total duration of us having the van was covered by this cost. We then received a confirmation email that very clearly said that drop off time was 9pm and when we picked up the van the employee told us it didn't matter what time we dropped it off as they were closed from 1pm. After we dropped the van back we received an email saying we would be charged extra as we dropped it off outside of business hours and when we questioned this with their customer support they just told us "well you should have read the small print" without addressing any of our concerns, it honestly felt like they didn't even read the email. I sent a follow up email and again they didn't address anything I mentioned just that they'd be charging us anyway. Overall customer service felt very dismissive and entirely uninterested in dealing with customer concerns or complaints.

I do understand extra charges for out of hours returns however I don't think it's fair to allow these times to be selected at booking without clearly informing the customer that the extra charges are there (even allowing a specific time out of hours is odd) and even giving them the option of adding the cost on to be paid upfront (for those of us who know we'll return late). It also shouldn't have specifically included the time in the confirmation email without a warning nor should we have been told we could return the van at any time without also being told it would count as after hours. This was all very misleading. When booking the list of returns times should change based on the locations opening hours so only these times are clearly listed and then have an "out of hours" option that has the time range for "out of hours", so if the location closes at 5pm and opens at 8:30am it should say something like "17:00-08:30 (Out of hours charges apply)" to make it clear.

The problem here is really that they very clearly set the expectation that returning the van at 9pm was included within the price we paid which made the additional charge feel deceptive or at very least highly misleading.
