I booked a van to go from Birmingham to Edinburgh Leith, with a drop-off time of 11pm on a Saturday.

Europcar signed everything off, gave me a fixed "guaranteed" price of ~¬£350 for a one-way trip, and all details were correct.

I arrive in Edinburgh at 2pm on the Saturday, and go to return the van early. I find out that Edinburgh Leith closes at 12 on a Saturday and is closed through Sunday. After phoning Europcar Leith, and then Europcar (main centre), I get to Edinburgh Airport who advise me that I should just hold onto the van and pay the extra 2 days worth of renting so I can return it on the Monday.

I advise them that I am happy to drop it off at Edinburgh Airport as they are the ones who are forcing me to either pay extra for an extended rental agreement that was not originally agreed to when I paid. Edinburgh Airport say that they're happy to take the van and that I would not be charged anything for this.

I receive the "van is perfect, you'll get your full deposit back" form back from Europcar, and then find a couple days later that they are holding onto my deposit and that I owe an additional ¬£600 for a "one-way surcharge". This "one-way surcharge" was not in the price guarantee, and has not been communicated to me.

I have been spending the past 3 weeks trying to resolve this, and have had 2 "cases" opened by Europcar to investigate this, but none have been closed or have given me any inkling into what actions will be done, despite being told I will hear back within 10 business days.

The company is an absolute scam, branches do not communicate to each other, and every representative is willing to blatantly lie so that they do not need to speak with you further.

UPDATE: It took emailing every board member at Europcar to be escalated to the "Executive Complaints" teams, who supposedly looked at my case and acknowledged I was overcharged and removed the note on my credit report and all outstanding charges - and that was it. At the time, I was trying to apply for a mortgage and Europcar made this unbelievably stressful as I had a "defaulted" account on my credit report. Do not use. I cannot reiterate this enough.

I‚Äôm rarely one to complain but HONESTLY STAY CLEAR OF THIS LOT particularly in Edinburgh airport, literally go with anyone else. I have rented cars from numerous rental companies and never had one single issue. Rented from this lot through a 3rd party who I had taken full insurance with, so the car and full insurance for ‚Ç¨370.
A day after I had dropped the car back, Europcar charged me ‚Ç¨345 for insurance with themselves which was never mentioned once by the desk agent but was put into the contract as saying I had agreed to it. Why on earth would I agree to insuring a car that‚Äôs already insured for a price that‚Äôs nearly same as my original full rental price. When the desk agent gave me the documents to read she immediately started showing me pictures on her phone of some wedding photos asking me what I thought of the quality of them etc. basically distracting me so I wouldn‚Äôt notice the additional insurance she put in the contract. She intentionally robbed me, I have no doubt about it. I have since contacted the police to get CCTV footage of the rental centre so I have evidence of the desk agent distracting me after giving me the documents, I will then be taking legal action. I would have been a returning customer as I have a few trips planned to this same place in the coming months so they have immediately lost out on 3 or 4 times the money they‚Äôre after stealing from me. Do not go near this company.

Never again!
On arrival at Manchester I picked up a car from this company. The interior of the car stank of cigarette smoke and there was a hole burnt in the upholstery of the driver's seat. I considered complaining but there was no sign of any staff at the parking lot, so this would have involved walking back to the office in the rain and I was tired after a long transatlantic flight. I just wanted to get on the road and get to my hotel in Chester, so I let it go. What I didn't notice was the damage to the sidewall of one of the tyres, which was pointed out to me when I returned the car twelve days later, during which time I had only driven about 300 miles and had never at any point been involved in any incident that could have caused this damage. When I arrived home I was contacted by e-mail and although I protested that there was no way the damage happened while I was driving and pointed out that whoever had checked over the car before I picked it up had failed to notice the smoke smell and damage to the seat, it was made very clear that the customer's experience of the situation was of no interest to Europcar. What is even more annoying is that it took TEN WEEKS before the company finally billed me for the damage, which included ¬£19 for "loss of use" (after all, it must have taken them about 15 minutes to change the tyre!), and a ¬£40 "administration charge". Suffice it to say that I will NEVER use Europcar again and would recommend others to steer well clear of this company. As so often before, it annoys me intensely that it isn't possible to award ZERO stars!
EDIT, 2/12/2023: I see that Europcar has now invited me to "Please use this link to our customer relations team who will investigate your complaint:". No doubt they think that this token will absolve them and create an impression that they actually act upon their customers' comments, but I refuse to let them get away with that. Anybody who cares to take a look will immediately notice that this is their standard cut-and-paste response to any negative reviews. In view of the total lack of understanding and respect for the customer's views that has been displayed in several e-mail responses so far, I fail to see how there can be any point in contacting the customer relations team. I know that will only lead to more frustration and wasted time spent communicating with people who refuse to even consider the merits of the customer's arguments and it will not change the outcome one iota.

Europcar said us we should not have to pay and so far we didn't receive answer or refund, but what we had to do? UPDATE
Europecar declined my request for the tyre repair to be reimbursed. They say I should have called the Europcar assistence and it was exactly what I did! A flat tyre happens quite frequently and it is unapcettable that Europcar assistance doesn't have the proper tyre so, not to spend the whole night waiting in the car (and even more, from Saturday afternoon to Monday morning, the time necessary to Europcar to have a proper new tyre!), I had to call a private aasistance as suggest by Europcar assistence itself! Before you book a vehicle, please be advised that there are a lot of hidden fees. I used an online platform to reserve my car for 178 GBP as an overseas consumer. I had to pay almost 750 GBP in all when I went to pick up the car. They take signatures everywhere and don't provide all the information accurately. Even after that, Eurocar levies an additional 40 GBP for simply forwarding emails as an administration fee for each and every PCN or other penalties you get. For example, If you got two PCN you have to pay PCN charge plus 40+40=80 GBP to Europcar as an administration fee. Don't trust them, so please be alert before renting and make sure you know the full total before you arrive.

Car was given to me with 2 different tyres on the front. Ready for rental report was provided to me after lodging complaint which clearly shows 2 different tyres on the front. Whilst not illegal it is a safety hazard. Reported this to Europcar who have blamed a 3rd party tyre company even though it was inspected by one of their employees before being given to me. Wiper blades were also desperately in need of replacing. Will never rent from Europcar again.

Please don‚Äôt be tempted by what should be a great company. From start to finish it is appalling.

I am sure that would go along way if there was a problem.
Please let us know how long does it take to get to the terminal after drop off? No idea is the response. Could we book a private transfer with a little more security than no idea. No!
Never again is all I can say.

Terrible experience! Poor customer service!

Staff rude and unhelpful. I was given a fiat 500 drive out of the branch and the brakes were metal to metal making a load noise and I didn‚Äôt feel safe at all.

They then went to give me a dirty car that smelt of smoke. I was in a hurry so took the car but made sure I took pictures. I couldn‚Äôt even fill the car with petrol, as the fuel cap was broken and on my return to the branch they said it was broke and had to open it with a knife.

I complained to customer service dept, but had no joy at all.

I arranged for a car rental for my wife's use during her trip to Ireland with our children. Upon her arrival at the rental station, she encountered aggressive sales tactics. Regrettably, I was not accompanying them on this trip. I immediately contacted the company's customer service to address this issue but to no avail. We are now working with our bank to contest these charges. I strongly advise against using this company.

They told me everything was included in the booking I made online, including 0 excess protection. This was today at approximately midday. When giving him the answers from central customer services he said ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not giving you the car‚Äù and kept saying ‚Äúyou can look at the computer if you want‚Äù - he flatly refused to contact the customer services office and I was left without transport, having to take more time off work and about ¬£148 out of pocket. Poor procedure and a very poor experience. Wouldn‚Äôt ever entertain using Europcar and will be telling friends and family to do the same. Never had any issue hiring a car before and this was an awful experience I won‚Äôt be repeating! If you want a smooth hire experience (as I‚Äôve had several times before) don‚Äôt go to Europcar - or certainly don‚Äôt go to Chelmsford!

Absolutely disgusting company to deal with. Paid for the car online then asking for ¬£700 deposit which I challenged and was reduced to ¬£244. Collected vehicle that was damaged and the depot hadn‚Äôt recorded it. I then went round the vehicle with the agent and filmed all damage to the vehicle. (I did this because having previously hired at the Manchester Trafford Park depot I have witnessed other other customers in similar disputes that have advised on always filming a video - so I do)

Agent then assured that this would all be added to the report and I had nothing to worry about. A day after returning the vehicle I received a damage notice and Europcar have raised an insurance claim.
I took the matter to customer service who asked me to send a screenshot shot of the video. They then replied a day later asking for further evidence so I send the video with both myself and their agent pre inspecting the vehicle.
As a previously regular customer I hadn‚Äôt had any issues and thought this would be quickly resolved. As such I booked another vehicle two days later‚Ä¶ upon collecting it was the EXACT SAME VEHICLE. And still had unrecorded damage again I record a video and write down everything myself rather the than trust the agent to do so.
I return the vehicle and it‚Äôs the same agent from the first hire, I show him the video of himself, he assures me that he will take this to his manager
I have since sent two further emails asking for an update, during which time random figures have been withdrawn from my bank accounts - Despite sending the video I am still yet to receive a reply.

I hired a car for a week from Europcar at Newcastle airport on 6th Nov. It turned out to be a scruffy & dirty Peugeot 208 with over 49000 miles on the clock. On the first day of hire the oil warning lamp lit up. I had to pull in to a service station & check the oil level (which was barely visible on the dipstick). After filling a litre of motor oil the warning lamp went out.
Luckily I didn't have to travel more than 300 miles locally with the car, I certainly wouldn't have trusted this "old banger" on a longer motorway journey.
I intended to take the matter up with the staff at Newcastle airport on return at 8:15 on the 13th of Nov. But the Europcar field station was empty & locked in spite of it supposedly being manned from 8 am. So I had to put the keys in their Dropbox & I complained to customer service once I got home.
I received a superficial apology & an offer of 5% off my next rental. But I won't be hiring from Europcar again & I would advise others to check their Europcar hire very carefully before accepting it.
I have used Europcar at NCL airport many times over the years. But I have never hired a car with such high mileage on the clock, or so obviously poorly maintained & scruffy. It'll be Avis or Hertz next time.
Well done Europcar!

I prebooked a Ford Focus 10 days for 434.40 gbp - pretty normal.
I went to collect my reservation at Heathrow after 65 hours of travel, pre booked and price set at 434.40 gbp.

At the counter, the agent said "free upgrade to an automatic Mercedes".

She then took credit card Authorisation, and only when I spotted the amount on the eftpos terminal, did I spot that I had been charged 1398.40 gbp, so an unauthorised jump of 964 GBP.

Immediately raised the issue, the staff acknowledged the incorrect amount, but they refused to reverse the credit card authorisation. They then said they would draw up a new contract at the original quoted amount.

They flat refused to give me a copy of the original invoice.

They said they could not refund the credit card, it would take at least 14 days - So if I took the original (3 times quoted amount) they could reverse it, otherwise not possible.

This is becoming obvious at this point that it is some form of "commission scam".

So now I have 2 pending amounts against my visa, obviously affecting the total limit of the card.

Next, I went to pick up the vehicle, I am given a Vauxhall Crossland (I requested a Ford Focus), and the state the vehicle is in, is disgusting, and this shouldn't be given to any customers. If this is the state of your fleet, you should retire them.

The vehicle has been used by a heavy smoker, the car reeks of smoke, and there is cigarette burns on the driver‚Äôs seat.

The outside of the vehicle has damage on every panel and the wheels. It looks like it has been through some form of war.

I have a full video of the state of the vehicle before collection.

So I drive out of the lot with my poor looking Crossland, get on the freeway to head a couple of hours down to Southampton. Hot day, AC on, and AC doesn‚Äôt work!

Called customer help line, get nowhere. I then head up to Milton Keynes and go to the Europcar depot there. The counter manager was helpful, test drives the car & confirms AC does not function at all. This is Thursday. They do not have a replacement car, so they promise to call me the next day for a swap over.

No call. Go to the depot on Saturday & its closed.

Call customer helpline. they confirmed Milton Keynes is closed (yep, sitting outside it).

Their suggestion was to head to Luton Airport (I was now at Silverstone) a round trip of 4 hours (remember no aircon, and hottest September in 30 years).

I had to pay for the extra mileage & fuel of course.

I arrived at Luton, Staff were good, Friendly. They then gave me an Vauxhall CORSA. A little beat up, but better than the last OPEL. I headed off out of the compound to have the oil light & check engine lights both start flashing. Tried the Air conditioning & completely non functional. (Don't know if air conditioning failure is standard on these Vauxhall's).

Back to the depot (another 20 mile loop). The lot operator was super helpful, and we checked the oil, not even showing on the dipstick. Then we checked the front tyres, Both completely bald, the LH one showing canvas.

He was embarrassed (felt sorry for him) he took us inside to the manager, and took a while, but they found a SEAT CUPRA manual. It was tidy, and everything worked!

Rest of the trip went as it should have.

3 weeks to have my original amount (1398.40gbp) refunded.

Do not trust or use Europcar Heathrow.

Sent a review on here in March 2023.
This is an update. A car was hired on my behalf due a rear end shunt into my car. This was in early January this year. Hire was organised through insurers with Europcar in Cottingham Road, Hull.
Car was dropped off at the garage doing the repairs, bur car left on the street which I thought was very unusual and nothing was signed by me. I dropped the car back-off at Europcar a .few days later and was told that everything was in Order.
In March I received a notification and was told I had damaged the front left hand side of the car. This is 6 weeks after hire had terminated. They showed a picture of the car front pre-hire and one where the purported damage had been done despite me being told everything was fine when I dropped it off. I refused to pay the approx. ¬£300 they were demanding and told them it was a con. Anything could have happened in that 6 week period.
So everything goes quiet only to receive a demand and the threat of legal action from solicitors (Sue, Grabbit and Runne) if I didn‚Äôt pay up plus a late payment demand of ¬£40. This was received 09 November 23. Total ¬£330. Due to the stress it was causing my wife, she paid up.
I beg anyone not to hire through Europcar. They stink. My practical advice is to take pictures of the front, sides and back before you accept the car and do the same when you off hire; and, make them sign off.
This has been going on for almost a year. I took their word on trust and got stung. They are a crooked organisation. Caveat Emptor.

Do not use Europcar if you are planning to travel from Northern Ireland to the Republic of Ireland. They charge a daily rate which resulted in a further 80% in rental costs. Other car hire companies charge a nominal one-off amount of approx. ¬£25. Final invoice bore no relation to original hire agreement and additional unknown charges were added. Please avoid them at all cost

This review is a warning not to fall for scare tactics when it comes to their premium cover. If you still feel you need additional cover than what they offer as standard shop about. There are dozens of places that offer more comprehensive cover and for a fraction of the cost. ¬£220 for a week is scandalous and its pure profit for them. You can get better elsewhere for about ¬£40 for the week. No wonder they are so keen to offer it. The finacial incetives for the sales person and the fact that they are probably targeted means they have to be pushy with it. My partner however fell for this. She needed a hire car as ours was having some work done and she needed to get home to say her goodbyes to her dying Grandmother. She booked the car online and went to pick it up. She'd read through the cover options and selected the one she required which was the standard one. That didn't stop the person behind the counter laying on the spiel about how much it will cost her if anything were to happen. They were aware of her predicament before hand and also knew she had to make haste but that doesn't stop them. Laying it on thick for someone who already had enough to worry about. In hidsight she knew she should have cancelled when she got down the road and realised that she'd been fleeced but as I said, she had other things on her mind. It's pushy sales tactics that pray and people insecurities to flog an overpriced product. Thankfully there are other more affordable options available elsewhere otherwise I'd suggest this con by the hirecare companies should be looked in to. I did make a complaint about how it was sold to an already vulnerable person but it fell on deaf ears. They're not that interested. She'd signed a contract and that was that. Very little contrition on there part knowing full well how they operate and how much they charge, knowing full well their options are a million miles from being competitive.

Jusy say no and shop about if you feel you need it.

I await the stock response saying how sorry they are and that they will look in to it. Just empty words.

At around 17.45 on 01/11/2023 I had a car delivered from Europcar as a courtesy car for Motability whilst my own car is off the road & in the garage, I didn't use the car until the following morning. But when I started the engine a tyre pressure warning light came on, I called Europcar to report this along with a couple of other things that weren't on their damage list given to me at handover. But all they said was that I had to report it via their damage email. After this call I went out in the vehicle, only to find it drove really heavy & that I had to push the accelerator almost fully down to get any sort of power when crossing a roundabout.
My daughter-in-law drove it on 04/11/2023 & said that it was horrible to drive (she has driven an identical car to this, as her mum had one & that one did not drive like this one) & even you paid her she wouldn't get behind the wheel of that car again. I have been sent from one person to another, been told different things by different people, been spoken abruptly to, (was even told that because my name is spelt wrong on the rental agreement that my insurance wouldn't be valid, it is) so much so that I ended up contacting Motability, bursting into tears on the phone & getting them to try to sort things.
Due to this software/electrical issues with my own car I became afraid to drive it incase it went wrong whilst I was using it, hence my getting a courtesy vehicle from Europcar, but can honestly say that I felt safer driving my own car than this hire car. I have been placed on a list for a replacement vehicle, but not given any eta on this happening, even though I told them that I need a safe working car due to a couple of personal things.
This company despite having a contract with Motability to supply courtesy vehicles to those on the Motability scheme when their own vehicle breaks down & is in the garage, meaning they should keep so many aside for this purpose, but do NOT. Yet, they don't give motability customers the same customer service that they give cash paying customers (those that hire a vehicle through the normal channels, via walk in, website or phone) They treat Motability customers like second class citizens, this car is a prime example of that as it should never have been sent out with any warning lights lit up on the dashboard yet it was sent out to me, something that would not have happened had I been a paying customer. If I were a paying customer I would avoid this hire company like the plague & will NEVER recommend it to anyone.

Update:

On 06/11/2023, I wrote the above review, which Europcar replied to (see below) asking me to contact them on the website in said reply. However, is you go to this sight & click on the email icon, it gives you 3 options, the 2nd applies to me as it is an issue during rental, then it gives you another list of options, none of which applies to me, meaning I can't use this option to contact them as they request in order for them to resolve my issues. Again, if I didn't have a Motability car currently in the garage you couldn't pay me to use Europcar. If I could give them 0 stars then believe me I would 100% do that, I will also tell anyone thinking of using them to run in the opposite direction & find a different hire company to use. These in my honest opinion are one of the worst vehicle hire companies around

Rented a car from Heathrow. I wanted an SUV for three weeks - hoped for Nissan Qashqai, but got a Vauxhall, which is the worst car I have ever driven in my life. If it had been mine, I would have taken it to the garage for service. By the time I got home from Heathrow, I noticed that the front offside tyre was going down very slowly. I phoned your customer service to let them know. After 3 attempts, I got someone who knew what they were talking about and she booked me in to Kwikfit, the company you have chosen to use for tyres. Kwikfit then contacted me to say they couldn't see me, so I contact customer service, and after going round in circles 5 times, they gave me another Kwikfit branch to go to. I took the car there and they said that even although the tyre was low pressure, they couldn't find a puncture. They tested all the tyres and said that in their opinion, the tyres were not tested before hire - all tyres were at wildly different pressures. Last Saturday, I visited my daughter, 50 miles away from me. The tyre had gone down. So, I phoned customer service again because I was no longer going to drive this unsafe vehicle. I learned that one should not have a puncture on a weekend. Local Kwikfit branches were closed, so I was told that I would be recovered to Heathrow (75 miles away), which I declined, as I told your company, I was disabled and could not do that. I was promised a callback and none was received. I then spoke to your breakdown line and the AA came out. It was dark with heavy rain, but the man found the puncture, which Kwikfit couldn't find, and made a temporary repair. I am here on holiday from Los Angeles, and Europcar's lack of assistance in this matter has wrecked my stay in the UK. I lost 4 days of my holiday chasing you. It would seem therefore, that I was rented an unsafe vehicle and when I tried to rectified this, Europcar went out of their way to be unhelpful.

Despite ringing them on instructions from the AA and they confirming an Hire Car would be here this morning this did not happen and as of now we still have not got any car, this was through the Gloucester branch, my wife who suffers fro severe pain in her one foot was in tears walking to work, this was due to this Company being Negligent with Poor Customer Service to which this will go a lot further as they were informed.

Would not give them any Custom in the future.

Went on holiday to Portugal in July 2022 and purchased the electronic tag so I could pay total fee after the holiday and not worry about paying on the day. I recieved my car bill, paid and forgot about it.
Over a year later September 2022, I am chased by debt collectors because the poll was not paid adding only multiple charges of admin due to no payment etc, although first time I had heard of it.
Contacted Eurocar and after 5 weeks of "working" on the case they found the database failed. Obviously I was not told about this failure beforehand. I was then redirected to Eurocar Portugal which took another 3 weeks before a response was made regarding payment. Luckily yes they agreed to pay for all admin fees, I asked couldn't they jusy pay the full thing due to the inconvenience and not my fault at all it was not paid. Obviously they said no.
Furthermore, they will pay me in Euro although I paid in GBP this bill therefore I am recieving less than what I paid the fine for and will get an FX charge from my card.
Still awaiting payment so will see how long that will take, if it ever arrives.
I will never go through Eurocar again, gave me so much administration work and time fighting this. When I first called up they told me I had to pay it or I will be blacklisted! Poor customer service and poor waiting times.

False Claim, Avoid this Company by all means..

ADVICE before you drive thier hired cars please make sure you take all the photos of everything inside and out, this includes fuel guage and mileage.

I recieved a car from this company through COGENT hire as had someone hit my car from the back and needed fixing. My insurance arranged everything. The car was delivered to my house and we went through all the procedures. But before using the car, I had took all the precautions, I took all the photos of scratches, alloy, fuel gauge and mileage just to cover my back.

I recieved this car on the 5th of September 2023 and my car was fixed and returned in the morning on the 8th of September. Anyway I informed them straight away to come and collect their car but never did until the 15th of September, which wasnt an issue to me as the Car was parked securely at home.

On the 15th someone came to collect the car, he just came and took the car without doing all the procedure and I asked him why he wasnt checking and he said he was just asked to collect the car. After a day I recieved a letter saying I had not filled back the fuel which I did and had receipts and photos of the fuel gauge of the before and after. After all the explanation they said it was in error and didnt need to pay anything.

To my surprise, on the 26th of October 2023 after over a month they send me a letter saying I had damaged the alloy wheels. What a joke! It took them over a month to check the car but they had checked the fuel guage the following day after collection and wanted to RIP me off and failed and now they sending me false damages after over a month of having the car. The car shouldn't have been driven from my house without doing proper procedures the same procedure you did when you dropped it. Whoever collected the car could have done those damages you're are claiming was me. Why collecting a car without making sure all procedures are followed.

I'm glad I covered my back by taking before and after photos of everything and im happy to be going to Court if I have to as I have all the evidence I need. I would not be paying a penny to this SHAM of a company. They have definitely destroyed thier own reputation by ripping off people left and right.

I wonder how they sleep at night...ain't we all struggling!

I had made an online booking from home allowing me the time to consider which car, insurance etc. suited me best. I choose a MG at a cost of GBP 318.

Arriving at the counter at Manchester the show began. Everything in my online booking was questioned, which is exactly what I want to avoid making an online booking, i.e. risking saying yes to something that is not fully transparent. What is the point then of making a online booking?

I was asked whether I wanted a manual or automatic. I was not informed about any price difference and in my naivity thought it was because they had excess automatics. At no point in time was I informed that it came with an additional cost.

I was asked about navigation. I said no thanks and I do not know whether I have paid for it. I cannot see it from the very little informative invoice.

I was asked about insurance. I said 3 or 4 times that I wanted the insurance packaged I had ticked of in the online booking. It turned out I got a much more expensive solution. Again I was not informed about the difference in cost.

I was offered a VW passat instead of the MG booked online. Luckily I said no, despite the fact that I was asked if I was sure 4-5 times. I bet that also came with an additional cost that I was not informed about.

I was not taken through the rental agreement, but was only shown were to sign, which I did in my naivity. I just received the invoice, GBP 776, more than twice the preferred solution in my online booking.

No wonder that we were only two persons at the Europcar counter whilst the Avis counter had 10-15 people queuing. I guess it is back to Avis.
